Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and son spent 4 nights at this hotel. It is excellent value. It's location is ideal for visiting the sites of Rome. We walked to all the major historical sites (all within pleasant 20 to 30 mins walk or less)...ie The Coliseum, Roman forum, Trevi fountain etc. It is also 10 mins walk from the Metro and about 15 mins from Termini station. It is also a great shopping area for clothes and shoes.To visit the Vatican city you can get the Metro .. 3 or 4 stops from metro station. There is a great snack bar just below the hotel serves great coffee and sandwiches etc. An excellent Italian restaurant just 3 mins walk from the hotel and a pizzeria just across the road all frequented by Italians ... which as they say if the locals eat there it must be ok! The staff are friendly and always very helpful. The room was clean, comfortable and practical. If I'm ever back in Rome this is where I will stay. Thanks to all the hotel staff ... they were great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, Lovely People”
Reviews.Author: Stepha85
Reviews.Content: Me and My partner stayed here from the 8th of April til the 11th. All of the correspondence with the hotel beforehand was excellent - any questions we had were answered promptly and excellent directions were given to find the hotel from Termini. The staff at the hotel were levely, and helpful throughout the stay. The rooms themselves are small and basic, but everything you need for a great stay is there. There is some noise from the road outside, but I wear earplugs, so it wasn't a problem for me!! The breakfast was good - cakes/pastries, toast, juice, yoghurt, cereal etc. Don't expect a full english! The hotel is in an excellent location for all of the main sights in Rome - it didn't take use more than 15 minutes to walk to anywhere (maybe 20 if you like to take a more relaxed walk). The only exception to this was the Vatican. We got the metro there on the morning (The metro station is less than 10 minutes away) and then we walked back in the afternoon taking in a number of other sights. I would also recommend eating at the Trattoria Antica Hostaria da Angelino which is also on TA... this is maybe 10 minutes away from the hotel, and the food is excellent. But if you want to eat here then I reccomend that you book beforehand. It was literally jam packed on the two nights we were there (one when we couldn't get a table, and one night we actually ate there). Overall an excellent hotel at a reasonable price - I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Rome hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: julie5k
Reviews.Content: When I decided that I would be going to to Rome in 2010 (my first time) for a few days, I had to figure out where to stay. I picked up a Rome for Dummies book; flipped through the book to figure where to stay, I chose the Hotel Giuliana, and it did not disappoint. Needless to say, I have recently returned from Rome (March 2012), and this is the second time my husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Giuliana, and this time we also had my in-laws. This hotel may be considered a budget accommodation. Trust me, this is not in the same league as the seedy Motel 6 chain in the US. It is conveniently located near all the major sights in central Rome by foot. The reason I stayed here again is because the staff is very friendly, warm, and extremely helpful. If you are traveling with an elderly person or have a lot of luggage, the building has an Old World European elevator that will take you to the first floor - where the reception desk and guest rooms are located. Our room was pleasant and clean. The breakfast was good and adequate - plenty of fuel to start your day of sightseeing. The rooms have satellite TV - if you care about that kind of thing. Public transport is close by and several restaurants from which to chose, if you want to eat your way through Rome. If you happen to be doing the Rome Marathon in March, this is a great place to stay as it is within a mile of the start/finish area which is at the Colosseum. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: jeweljem
Reviews.Content: My daughter, son and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. it is close to everything. 10 minute walk from train station, 10 minutes to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. 10 minutes to the Colosseum. Nice rooms and a very good breakfast. Very helpful staff. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: SArah W
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was very central and felt safe as entry was via an intercom. Breakfast was good and staff very friendly and helpful - English speaking also. Our room was pleasant and most importantly the bed was a good size and firm. We would stay again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Jules8488
Reviews.Content: Location wise, this hotel is perfect. It is within 10 minutes walk from Termini station. The hotel room is clean and the bathroom is in good condition as well. If you are willing to walk, most tourist attractions (e.g. Trevi fountain) are reachable by foot, otherwise, there are many buses around the area. We went there around mid February and perhaps that's considered off-peak season for Rome, and hence we suspect that's the main reason why the breakfast quality was rather poor (poor selection and disappointing quality for whatever served on the breakfast corner, including the coffee). However, the staff was very helpful and spoke surprisingly good English. Breakfast wise, there're Mcdonald and other excellend cafes by Termini which can be good alternatives if you are a bit picky when it comes to breakfast. Overall, its still a good choice for those who travel with tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean hotel with very helpfull and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KidJo k S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is a family hotel at the center of Rome (10 minutes walk from the central train station and the colosseum). The hotel has nice and clean rooms. It is not a big fancy expensive hotel; its prices are good, compared with other hotels in Rome. The staff is very friendly and helpful. During our stay, my son had a health problem (stomach pain, fever) and someone of the hotel staff escort me during the night and helped me to find an open pharmacy. They definitely made our stay more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Gembe
Reviews.Content: Me, my son and sister travelled to Rome last year and for a couple of days we stayed at the Hotel Giuliana. A little hotel ten minutes away from the train station. It was very good - the rooms were clean, the breakfast in the morning was great with many options. Antonio was the night desk person and he was amazing - great help. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, good value”
Reviews.Author: AStar1973
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice. The biggest advantage is that it was very conveniently located, walking distance to a bunch of the major sites, and close to the major train station to take you to the rest of the sites. The breakfast was good (unlimited cappachinos, yogurt, cereal, fruit). The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, and above all, great owners”
Reviews.Author: Sean F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in December, three nights at this hotel. We chose this hotel because it was affordable and had great TripAdvisor reviews. Overall, the experience was good. There were some positives and negatives. A positive is that it is downtown, very close to the train station and one of the Holy See basilicas. It was about a 15 minute walk to the coloseum. A negative is that it is a 15 minute walk from the coloseum and other key sites. So, non-ideal but this makes it a cheaper option than something right around the corner from those famous sights which, of course, is a positive. Another negative is that it is in an old building in an area that there was a morning market, which can be loud in the morning. Also, the rooms are what you would expect of a 2 star hotel, so don't expect the rooms themselves to be a 4.5 star room. However, what made this hotel a great experience was the staff. The hotel is family run and they are a very nice family. They are very energetic and will do just about anything you ask. They gave us great recommendations for food and were incredibly friendly. This made it a great experience and I recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, very friendly, a wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carole J
Reviews.Content: Following Tripadvisor reviews we booked our stay at Hotel Giuliana for six nights in early February, it was only a 10 minute walk from termini station and most of the main attractions were easily accessed on foot and the bus or underground transport was so efficient to reach any other destinations that would take a while out of your day or are a little too far. On arrival Antonio was there to greet us, he along with the other staff were so friendly, helpful and very accomodating. The room itself was cold on arrival although warmed up quickly with the heating available, bath was a little disapointing but the room was clean, comfortable and adequate for all we needed. A lot of reviews mention the early morning noise from the market in the street, we were in room 20 which was on that side, the first morning the noise did wake us up but we found due to the amount of walking we did it was not a problem for the rest of our stay. Breakfast was a buffet that was always fresh and plentiful, cappuccino very good. Rome really is a beautiful city with so much to see, our highlights were the Trevi fountain at night, the Collosium and the Vatican although enjoyed all of the others too. Rome could be an expensive stay but we researched before we went to ensure best budget eats, Napolli just opposite Hotel Giuliana is a very good and reasonable pizza, Pizza Forum in Via di san giovanni in laterano did a fantastic bruchetta, lasagne, water and coffee for 10 euros each, Cafe Cafe do a lovely hot chocolate for 3 euros each, forno campo de fiori also great and the hazelnut Ice cream in Il Gelato di San Crispino was stunning. Overall we had a fantastic time in Rome, if your on a budget we would reccomend hotel Giuliana, they fully deserve all of the good reviews, I really hope to return to Rome and would stay at this hotel again. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa2488
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for almost a week total. We left and then returned at the end of our trip. The staff were SO friendly and helpful. My boyfriend and I flew in from different location and had some trouble meeting up. Antonio put up with calls and emails from several family members back in the US. They treated us like family! The location is amazing! A 5 minute walk from Termini, a few blocks from Via Nazionale, a main shopping street, and the Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore. The breakfast was also very nice and filling. A good variety with great coffee. The rooms were spacious enough by Italian standards. If you stay in a double superior room there is plenty of space! The little pizzeria across the street (da Napoli) is INCREDIBLE! I would definitely recommend this hotel and we would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ownercarry
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! Location is no more than 20 minutes from nearly any big site, big rooms with a great bathroom, coffee-store coffee whenever you want and many more things. Wife and I stayed there for 6 nights in late February. We had room 10 which we asked for because we didn’t want to be on the other side which is over the pop-up marketplace on a side street. That might have been a little quieter because seemingly every scooter or motorcycle with a loud muffler came by the street from 6am on. But the reality was it was never an issue because even getting up at 830, Italy’s work schedule of 10-8 never made the noise an issue. Better were the people. We dealt primarily with husband and wife team Marianna and Antonio (literally the early shift and the late shift). Seriously, it was hard to do better than this couple. Get it done in the am and the best chat after a long day. Not all Italians are this friendly or good with English and with making you feel welcome. Our room was a pair of twins put together (just like on a cruise ship), a desk, a real safe built into the wall, night lights for reading, great window over the street, a full service bath with bidet (do Europeans really use these?) and a small refrigerator to keep our beers and sodas cold. It was literally USA size at economy (winter) rates. Towels were like you’d read (not so thick and kind of rough) but never failed to dry after a trip to the shower that had nearly as many spouts as the Fontana de Trevi. The beds looked really fatigued with a big sag in the middle, but never once, gave a bad night’s sleep or any kind of ache. Don’t let what you see ruin the reality. We also had free WiFi that helped us research the next day and if you needed something printed, just ask. Breakfast was the simplest of simple with a cheese, bread (and toaster), some Danishes, fruit selection, yogurt and three cereals. No meats or multiple cheeses, but really, keep it simple and have 2 espressos instead!! If you need a full breakfast just ask where to go (Irish pub and B&B down the street) and you’ll find it for 5 Euros. Just as great are the shops and eateries within 5 minutes. We’d forgot Tums and ibuprofen - that’s right across the street. Want soda and some local goodies? Around the corner is a supermarket. Want some excellent Italian food? How about 4 places ranging from 6-12 Euros for pasta dishes. Bar Viminale was one our favorites for fast and easy, including take-away. At the end, it was hard to leave. Rome is incredible to visit and H.G.’s facilities and people made our visit a genuine Roman Holiday. We can easily see why they are so highly regarded on internet rating sites. Contact them directly for the best deals and book soon, there’s just 11 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location for trams but 15 mins walk from subway”
Reviews.Author: Vinh N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing value for price. It cost us roughly $75 AUD for two people per night. The rooms had a great feel to them and were beautifully decorated in red. The bathroom facilities in the room were great as well. Very helpful staff with perfect English. The included breakfast is a basic buffet, no complaints there. However, make sure you learn to use the tram system if you want to get here without walking too far (assuming you use pulic transport). We only stayed in Rome for 2 days, and going around 10 different European countries beforehad, we had only mastered the subway system. Unforunately, Rome is not very well connected by subway (perhaps some history lessons on your tours will tell you why) so the hotel ended up being 15 minutes (slightly uphill) walk.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Rome early in February before spending another couple weeks touring Italy. We returned at the end of our trip for an extra three nights to see some of the sites that were previously closed because of the snow.The price of our previous hotel, which was excellent, had increased by nearly 50% in that time, putting it out of our range. We selected Giuliana based on trip Advisor reviews and price, but we felt that they cut a few too many corners to keep the price down. The heating in the room is off during the day and it can only be turned on by reception. They appeared to turn it off again during the night. It takes quite a while to warm the room because it is the hot water radiator type. Our towels were not changed during our visit, which doesn't really worry us, but since the heating wasn't on and the towel drying rail didn't work, they remained damp. On the plus side, the hotel is only about a 15 minute walk from Termini station, it is walking distance to all the sites and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. The free wifi worked well and the included breakfast of toast, croissants, cereal and coffee was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BrockStrongo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, good value hotel in a good location in Rome. I had a single room which was a decent size, comfortable and clean. It's on the first floor of a building and there's a lift or an easy walk up the steps to get there. It's a 5 to 10 minute walk from Termini Station but feels in quite a different / nice neighbourhood - just on the edge of Monti. Staff were very friendly. Breakfast is pretty basic but fine. Excellent value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: malta_jan16
Reviews.Content: This is my second time that I stayed in this Hotel. Rooms are very clean, staff very helpful. It is located few minutes away from Rome Termini. I am sure that I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Environment 100% family”
Reviews.Author: Janes B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, Stazione Centralle, shops. Completely family environment where guests receive full attention with the greatest readiness and education. The breakfast is simple but complete with coffee, milk, juices, fruits, breads and croissants. We recommend and will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location to stay”
Reviews.Author: IExploreTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We were very happy during our 7 day stay at the Hotel Giuliana. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to Rome travelers with value in mind. The rates are very reasonable. I recommend that you book your stay directly on their personal hotel website. We used the express train from the airport for €14. The Hotel location (15 minute walk) was easy to find with the provided directions from the Termini Train/Bus Station. It’s also easy walking distance to most of the city attractions and shopping. The provided hotel breakfast selection was very tasty and was enough food for us to start each day complete with personalized coffee. The entire hotel was clean and well kept. The management team was very courteous and helpful. Thanks again to Jean, Marianna, Antonio, Ashwin, Federico and Marilyn. You each helped us at one point or another with our needs or an immediate answer to our questions. It felt like we were staying at your home with the ultimate care in our privacy. Thanks for arranging our day bus trip to Florence. It was a nice day trip to see a different city. We would defiantly stay at the Hotel Giuliana again when we return to Rome. A couple traveling from USA & Russia.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Helen H
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this charming hotel, which is so convenient for sightseeing and is just a short walk to the train station and metro. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, the room was spotlessly clean, although it was located on the side street where there is a market most mornings. We were offered another room but didn't bother, as we were so tired at night, we had no problem sleeping - the beds were very comfortable with lovely crisp clean sheets. Wi-fi was avaliable in the bedroom.I would recommend this hotel to family and friends without any hesitation. There is a lovely restaurant just across the street called Napoli - we would highly recommend it - friendly, good value and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ruubaroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Giuliana for 3 nights in Dec '11. Everything was perfect right from the moment we entered the hotel till the time we left. Location is pretty good, 15 minutes walk from Termini and manageable distances to other major attractions. Our room did look a bit small (we were 3) from outside but was very well maintained. Breakfast was great & served always with a smile :-) by Marilyn. Owners are just wonderful & take such care of you that you feel like at being home. Special Thanks to Antonio for nice chats in the nights & lending us some milk:-). Marianne & Ashwin were very helpful. All in all a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: yatri_osu
Reviews.Content: We chose hotel Giuliana after reading the positive comments on tripadvisor, and we weren't disappointed at all. The hotel is conveniently located about a 10-12 min walk from the Termini station and walking distance from the Colosseum and Roman forum. Its very easy to go anywhere in Rome from the hotel either by the Metro or any of the buses. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful to us, giving us directions and tips for the sights. We had an economy room which was modest. Keep in mind that the hotel rooms in Rome or Paris will be smaller than in US, unless you go to a chain or pay very high price. However, when we go to a new place we keep our mind open to enjoy new culture and customs so a smaller room and bathroom didnt bother us at all. Many reviewers have complained about the noise, and again I would say, Rome is not a relaxing vacation at the beach. Its a bustling ancient city, so soak up the atmosphere instead of grumbling about noise! The breakfast was typical Roman affair, nice and light and suited us well (vegetarians), but don't go looking for heaping plates of eggs and meats. I would recommend Giuliana to all and would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Have returned again”
Reviews.Author: blackblackterrier
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to be in Rome, and we selected Giuliana for its great value, convenient location, and most importantly, the friendly staffs. We were very excited to be back again, almost like a family reunion. We also found a local super market (SMA) close by this time, only about 5 mins walk. Wish we had found it last time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Washingtron
Reviews.Content: The staff here went above and beyond to make us comfortable. It's very much a no frills room, we had the superior, but the bathroom was extremely large and had a jacuzzi shower head thinger that I've never even seen before. The double bed was two singles pushed together but they didn't come apart as can happen. Internet was included and fairly quick. Breakfast consisted of the sweet pastries, various cereals, orange tang drink, yogurts, toast, variety of spreads, whatever coffee drinks you'd like (a really good cappucino). I think that in any other country, this hotel may be a two or a three star, but if your expectations are realistic for the big city of Rome, this is a great, inexpensive find in a great location. Quick Booking Tip: Book on their site through them, not through Venere, Hotels.com, etc. They're cheaper that way and recommended to us that next time that's what we should do. Quick Foodie Tip: Walk up the street away from the church (turn right when you exit the hotel) and take your first right. Walk up this street past the Opera and right before you reach the large Termini square area on your right is a tiny tiny hole in the wall place that serves the tricky to find Porchetta sandwich. It's called Er Buchetto and for a few Euro you get a porchetta sammy and glass of wine. Perfect lunch place!

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: KevinBahrain
Reviews.Content: The Giuliana is in a wonderful location and as other reviewers have said, one can walk to many of the major sights. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Great coffee in the morning with ample choice for breakfast. The staff was always so welcoming and were very helpful with suggestions and booking us tours. We stayed a week and will return in March.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like family - great base for exploring Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Canucks_from_Calgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giuliana in Rome for three days in October, while we were honeymooning around Europe. This hotel was well located with both good access to the train station, the subway, and within walking distance of the majority of the sights. We did do a decent amount of subway riding (which is kind of insane! Prepare for pushing and shoving!) while we were in Rome, but mostly to start and end the day. My other half was quite sick, so extra walking was out of the question for us. We found our room to be a nice size (though I'm told it's one of the smaller rooms) - we just had a standard double. The breakfast was great and there's a little balcony outside to sit on when it's nice out. The shower is heaven with actual water pressure (!). When we booked our room, the staff sent us an email detailing tours that are available with recommendations as to when to book them so that it was easy to pre-plan our trip. WiFi isn't available in your room, but it is available at the breakfast area / lobby. The major selling feature for this hotel is definitely the staff. It's family run, and everyone is amazingly friendly! Their English is perfect, ask them where to go for food! We did a number of times and weren't disappointed. We loved our stay in Rome and are hoping to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Sandy53j
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. The room is very nice and clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: This perfectly situated hotel is a must for your stay in Rome. Everything from here is walking distance, we didn’t use any form of transport during our stay. The rooms are clean and ideal. The breakfasts are a perfect start to your busy day ahead and the staff can not do more for their guests. Price is very good! My husband and I had a wonderful time in Rome and a lovely stay at Hotel Giuliana. Rebecca & Stephen Showler

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff & value”
Reviews.Author: claireomahony1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good value for money. Very well located, being close to the train station, metro & main tourist attractions. Staff are very friendly & helpful & go out of their way to help. We booked a superior room & the extra space was worth the additional cost. The room was very clean & surprisingly quiet. There were many excellent restaurants within a short distance. Ask at reception for their recommendations. Would highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alde13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located near train station and not far from anything. The subway is not near but is not essential. The room is very very clean and comfortable but there were something weird in a soap dispenser, we never knew what was, but it was scary. The service is perfect but we missed the ham in the breakfast. We would come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hazel Y
Reviews.Content: Such a quaint and cosy hotel to come home to after a busy day out in the streets of Rome! Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were all incredibly friendly and warm! They made my first ever holiday with my boyfriend that extra bit special!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Little_Atlas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before catching a cruise from Civitaveccia. The hotel arranged a car & driver to meet us at the airport. This was nice after a long flight from Canada and only slightly more expensive than taking the Leonardo express train. The staff were the highlight of our stay. They really do take care of you with all sorts of tips and pointers for whatever your interest may be. Definitely worth the price of admission! The rooms are a bit tiny and the plumbing could use some help due to the hard water clogging the faucets and shower head. The street market can be noisy if you intend sleeping in. These are the only drawbacks that detracted from what is wonderful hotel. Overall, our stay was very good and would recommend this quaint, family-run hotel to those who like personal service and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Giuliana! It felt like our very own home away from home. Jean and her staff could not have been more helpful! So gracious and generous. The location is ideal and it is very easy to get to and from the train station. The rooms are well sized and very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: BowralGillian
Reviews.Content: Thank you everyone at Hotel Giuliana ! This is the friendliest and best value hotel in Rome. Walking distance from Termini, with comfortable rooms and excellent service - this is somewhere we will return to every time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - in a family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: mette-camilla
Reviews.Content: A small very charming hotel in perfect distance from several well known sights. Served by a the most loving family - always willing to help. Are you planning to visit Rome - with your spouce or a friend - this hotel is perfect. Close to Colosseum, Forum Romanum, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, etc. We'll be back! Mette-Camilla and Anders

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irish7436
Reviews.Content: At first we were startled to find we had to take an elevator up to the hotel but once we arrived and met the owners we immediately fell in love with the whole idea of using the old european style elevator and being catered to by this friendly, caring family. This hotel is in a wonderful location for both the trains and the buses, also the hop on hop off bus which is so convenient i n Europe. There is a wonderful restaurant right around the corner called Rst Flli de Lucaroma and several cafe's to have a light lu nch or coffee. We highly recommend this Hotel which is moderately priced.

Reviews.Title: “A true home away from home - felt welcome like family”
Reviews.Author: Meurig F
Reviews.Content: We have for 7 -8 years stayed at the Giuliana hotel in Rome, a family run business. It is ideally located in the centre of Rome. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff, you wouldn't get any better service in a larger hotel. The rooms are clean & comfortable, with double glazing throughout to minimize the noise of the busy city centre. The hotel is very near the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Termini. We all would not think of going anywhere else. Thanks to all the staff of the Giuliana Hotel for their warm welcome every year we visit them. Norma, Meurig, Helen & Len Review: October 2011

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: weater
Reviews.Content: This is a small family hotel. You will not miss the entrance, it is a large wooden door. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms recently renovated. Although the closet door had to be fix, but we didn't have any major problem. The location of the hotel is very good, near the city center and most of the monuments. We preferred to move around on foot, so it's location was ideal. There is a small pizza store almost opposite the hotel with good prices. Around the corner there are also small cafeterias and restaurants with average prices. The hotels has basic amenities and the breakfast is limited to fresh croissants, bread and coffee. Recommended for 3-4 day excursions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Turtlesitter
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel, very conveniently located and you won't find a friendlier or more helpful staff. We were able to walk to everything even the Vatican (but we like to walk). The rooms are very clean and adequate. There is a market in the mornings so if your room has a street view I recommend wearing ear plugs. We did this and slept fine. If you don't have ear plugs the market starts setting up around 5am and can be quite noisy. Free wi-fi was a plus. There is an Internet cafe close by if you don't have a computer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: trippy25624
Reviews.Content: First of all, Jean was a very gracious host and really made us feel welcome in Rome. She suggested a restaurant right around the corner, and later we saw her there - so you know it was good! This hotel is pretty close to the train station, and not too far of a walk from the Colliseum/Forum (maybe 15-20 minutes???). There's a small, old elevator for bringing your bags up. The room was pretty large by Europe standards, as was the bathroom. The only real drawback was that our window opened up to a patio where people ate breakfast - oh and you have to pay extra for air conditioning, which my parents tried in their room, but they couldn't get it working.

Reviews.Title: “All this comes at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: gdrm
Reviews.Content: In expensive Rome, Hotel Giuliana is a wonderful surprise. It is centrally located so that you can walk everywhere in the old city. It is clean and, for Rome, quiet. The rooms are pleasantly fursnihed and decorated, the breakfasts are good, and the staff could not be more helpful. All this comes at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: the hotel was extremely clean and charming. the staff was most kind and gracious. the location was within walking distance to nearly everything of interest. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend looking for reasonably priced accomodations and an extremely helpul staff. I will stay there again on my next trip to rome

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BYOB
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel near the train station. Clean rooms and friendly service. Nothing special but a decent choice for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and service. Fast free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: jwobkk
Reviews.Content: Good stay here and I think it represents a fine value for the travel dollar. Easy walk from the Termini train station. Room was small but functional. Bath and the shower in particular are very small - clean though. The staff is friendly and helpful. They happily made restaurant reservations for us and gave us smart directions. Our room faced the outside street and can be noisy at night with cars driving down the cobblestone street at high speeds. If you are sensitive to noise, request an inside room. Breakfast in the morning is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff that makes you feel like your staying with friends!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Jan_Oregon
Reviews.Content: Good location, about a 10 minute walk from the Termini train station (not too bag with luggage...there were others walking with luggage too). Clean rooms, nice breakfast buffet and the staff makes a great cappuccino! Great base location to do your Rome site-seeing. I would recommend one of the hop-on/hop-off buses to get you around the city. There are stops near the hotel and at Termini. Hotel has Wi-Fi and it works best in the lobby area. The staff speaks good English and they go out of their way to make your stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, great hospitality and great people”
Reviews.Author: Steve193
Reviews.Content: Just had an excellent stay at this very well positioned and delightfully hosted hotel. As so many reviewers have previously commented, the hosts were very friendly and helpful, and there was always a cheerful answer to questions I had. The recommendations for eating were right on target! One restaurant close by, La Boheme, I went to twice because of the good authentic food and reasonable price. The room I stayed in was a comfortable, clean single room, with adjoining bathroom.It will be improved soon when it gets wireless capability, which other rooms have. (Although the free wireless on offer in the lobby was much appreciated). Breakfast was generous. Loved my stay here, and will stay again when in Rome. Thank you Jean, Marianne and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerard D
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Rome staying in this fantastic hotel. Jean (the owner) and her daughter Marianne were really helpful and gave great advice regarding restaurants etc. The hotel is really homely and quaint. Rooms are basic but clean. Jean mentioned to us about possible noise from the street but there was none at all, even with the market at one side of the hotel. The hotel is in a great location and continental breakfast with fresh coffee was just the ticket. Jean seemed to have a good knowledge of restuarants and recommended a great place around the corner (La Boheme) which did great food at reasonable prices and is well worth a visit. Myself and my wife hope to return to Rome and Hotel Giuliana again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Giuliana Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LizbethRD
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at this hotel. Owners on site and worked the office as well as the small breakfast. They were very accommodating and congenial. They went out of their way to provide extra electrical cords for my partner being on a CPAP system at night. They were most helpful with directions and advice on what time, where to go and things to do. We are in our mid to late 70's and found the accommodations very nice and comfortable. We walked to many of the tourist attractions which are mainly downhill from the hotel as well as just a few short blocks from the Termini. Walking back required a taxi on one occasion as we got lost and the legs were totally worn out. Very clean, nice hot water - no critters visible there or after we came home and the price was good for Rome. Loved the nice email on our return home, thanking us for being at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Alan g
Reviews.Content: Lucky to find such a warm friendly family run hotel with excellent staff. Nothing was too much trouble and the location was great for what Rome has to offer. Yes it can be noisy outside but your in the heart of a city so you go with it. The room was clean and had everything you need to sleep, bed comfy for a good nights sleep after touring the city during the day and into the small hours. Breakfast was adequate and the coffee fantastic. For a break in Rome where everything is at hand and where you feel part of the family and not just a paying guest in a corporate hotel then this is just for you. I am British Airways staff and stay in many hotels around the world and nothing compares to the friendliness and hospitality we received here at Hotel Giuliana. We both and a wonderful time and would highly recommend your hotel to friends and family. We hope too to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel near to sights and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Alison_L
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel on Tripadvisor and thought I'd give it a go, the online "from" prices looked very reasonable (around 62 EUR) but after being unable to book online I contacted the hotel directly and was quoted 150 EUR per night. As this was a trip for my birthday and on the strength of the good Tripadvisor feedback I went ahead and reserved a room. The hotel is near to the Termini Metro station. From Fiumicino airport I hopped on a bus costing 6 EUR that took just under half an hour to get to Pyramide Metro station, from there I got a 1 EUR travel ticket and travelled the couple of stops to Termini. The cobbles on the way to the hotel are a bit challenging for suitcase wheels but I managed to get to the hotel in just under 10 minutes. As others have commented there is a modest "Hotel" sign by the door and you have to go into a lobby area to ascend some stairs to the hotel itself. There is a rickety looking old lift but as it was only a couple of flights of low rise steps I always used the stairs, it was quicker than waiting for the lift. Initially we were given a "superior" room, number 20 and informed that we would need to swap to another room the following morning. This wasn't exactly ideal and I had thought that as they were aware I was staying for my birthday that this had been a little courtesy extra. To be honest I didn't consider the room to be superior. It was clean, well appointed and of a good size. The bathroom had a shower over bath affair but in the afternoon there was no hot water and the shower was a trickle. I reported this to reception but was glad that I would be moved to another room. The following morning we werer given room 10 on the front of the hotel and this was a lovely little room. Slightly smaller than our previous room and with a shower cubicle rather than a bath but it suited us down to the ground. We were given complimentary air conditioning (usually 10 EUR) for the bother of moving rooms and it was greatly appreciated as temperatures hit 29 degrees outside. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The shower itself could have done with some descaling but showers in the morning were hot and the water supply was more powerful than in room 20. Yes there are ocassionally street markets outside but actually I found the noise levels perfectly acceptable and I was so tired from sight seeing it didn't overly affect my ability to sleep. Breakfast was a rather basic affair but I cannot bench mark it against other hotels in Rome. There were pastries, cheese triangles, fresh fruit, juice, yogurts and bread/ toast. Tea and coffee was freshly made to order and lovely. All staff and the hotelier, Marianne, were exceedingly helpful and friendly with impeccable English. The restaurant opposite provided a good evening meal but I can whole heartedly reccommend eating at the restaurant just a few minutes walk away next to the opera house, a family run business since 1908 and the food was delicious and fairly priced. Do get a table inside as the street tables don't have a great view. Eating and especially drinking out in Rome can be a costly affair, up to 8 EUR for 400ml of draught beer! Good food was in plentiful supply and I thoroughly made use of the cities gelateria, if you see a Blue Ice chain do go and get one of their grande cones, the choice of flavours was the best I found, even in the smaller stores of the chain. Location wise the hotel is about a mile away max from the main sights, it wasn't too far to walk to the Trevi Fountain of an evening for a good meal there. On the return journey I got a train from Termini overground station costing 14 EUR and took about 30 minutes straight to Fumicino airport. The trains depart from around platform 28 which is a bit of a walk once inside Termini station so allow about a good hour to get from the hotel to Fumicino. I loved Rome, the transport was exceedingly good value but as all the sights I was interested in were within walking distance (even Vatican City if you enjoy walking as I do) I couldn't really cash in on that value. Eating and drinking out hit me very hard and one night I spent over £100 at a lovely seafood restaurant near the Trevi Fountain for a bottle of cheaper Prosecco, two starters and two mains! Generally I'd say allow around 70 EUR per person for three courses and a bottle of wine and a tip. As I'm not used to staying in city hotels and as it was a rather late booking I cannot comment on the value, I feel booking early is essential to get the best deals. A 5% discount was offered on the hotel should I have paid in cash and I am informed that this is a usual tax dodge employed by most establishments in the city. In the end I paid by card and there was an additional 16 EUR city tax that had to be paid in cash. There were some return visitors to the hotel while we were there and i would certainly consider the Guiliana again when I hopefully return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: imatraveln
Reviews.Content: This is within easy walking distance to nearly all of Rome's top sites and an easy 10 minute walk from the train station if you have just small luggage (we had roller carry-ons). IIt is in a good neighborhood, with a bank/atm nearby. Marianna and everyone else were very friendly and helpful. They have a nice little breakfast area with coffee made on the spot to your liking each morning. The breakfast is very simple but so are nearly all the breakfast options in Italy - many places don't even offer breakfast. The room is sparse but who spends lots of time in the room in Rome? The room was very clean, quiet, and kept relatively cool. The bed wasn't bad but wasn't great either - I'd say right in the middle. But we were so exhausted after hours of sightseeing we really had no problems sleeping. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Here come the Girls"”
Reviews.Author: Jo P
Reviews.Content: Thank you Jean for looking after us, you are a very warm and welcoming hostess. You went over and above the call of duty finding us a restaurant and giving us directions to all that Rome has to offer. The hotel was clean and had everything needed for our weekend break, your located within walking distance of all the sights and metro. Thank you also for arranging our transfers to & from the airport. We will recomend you to our friends and fellow British Airways staff,.When we come to Rome again we will be staying with you. Highly recomended for a city break, location, clean,friendly good coffee excellent staff. Jo

Reviews.Title: “Girlie Weekend”
Reviews.Author: poppyboavista
Reviews.Content: Just spent a lovely weekend with my girlfriends in Rome celebrating 50th birthdays. Our stay at the Hotel Giuliana was comfortable and located in a good location for sight seeing. Jean was an excellent host and made us feel very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble and Jean booked us into an excellent restaurant for what I think was one of our best meals of the weekend. Morning coffee was delicious and much appreciated after a few glasses of Prosecco the night before!!! I would definitely recommend a stay here and will return in the future. Lee F

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Unicorngiraffe
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 1am due to a delayed flight and they happily had someone waiting for us to check in and then opened breakfast early the next morning as we were leaving on a Pompeii tour at 6.45am. The staff were absolutely delightful- on our last day we had about 3hrs to kill before our train left and since it was so hot outside we stayed in the lobby and had a great chat with the owner. The room was lovely, we opted for the non-air conditioned choice to save money but in hindsight I would have paid the extra 10 euros because it was too noisy outside to keep the window open at night so it was quite stuffy. But other than that, it's great value and great location- an easy walk from the termini and to the Spanish Steps and other places. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like you are staying with family!”
Reviews.Author: Patty K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a pleasant experience for us!! You are very well taken care of there in room and for breakfast. They serve a lovely light breakfast and make you coffees or hot chocolate fresh when they ask what you would like. There is no smoking unless you go out on the balcony and that is great too! It is very well located close to many attractions and they are very good about getting you info on whatever you would want to see or do. The day we left the service they called to pick us up came in a car when they had requested a van for us, Ashwen came down to be sure it was and was upset when it was a car. He called them and got it taken care of in minutes and stayed until it was resolved. If you want a pleasant stay with great people that CARE about your visit to their city this is the place to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Denise0B
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great being only a 10 min walk from Rome Termini train station. The owners were warm welcoming, helpful and ensured everyone had an enjoyable breakfast. The room was extremely clean. My husband and I are light sleepers and perhaps there are rooms at the back of the hotel which may be quieter. Having said that we would stay there again. tip: Pizzeria across the road does amazing pizza and pasta dishes.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: robert c
Reviews.Content: A recent stay in September 2011 for three - most polite and helpful staff, always friendly and welcoming. Good location for sight seeing and trips around Rome, it's a pleasure to stay there, will certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Andreia71
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at the begining of our holidays, and even me, who am usually a fussy person could not find anything to complain about! The 3 persons room is really big and comfortable and one does not feel like sleeping in a cupboard, but has a real feel of comfort and cleanliness. We felt very much at home there. The staff is always helpful and nice and the price really affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable secure stay”
Reviews.Author: nico9966
Reviews.Content: If you will be visiting Rome make sure you stay at Hotel Giuliana. It's very safe and very affordable with a great breakfast and above all very clean rooms. Very helpful staff. Jean and Maryanne and all the great staff will certainly greet you with a smile. We will most certainly go back next year. P.S. Great coffee in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeerkatBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of our honeymoon. The room was good, though the toilet didn't seem to flush very well...if you kept pressing it was fine! The hotel is well located, the colosseum is about 15/20 minute walk. The staff were friendly and it was one of the most reasonable hotels I could find in central Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Trophie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Giuliana for 5 nights at the beginning of September 2011. Jean and staff were the perfect hosts, always very pleasant, friendly and helpful. Jean also kindly booked a Vatican tour for us which turned out to be one of the best tours we went on during our trip. The room was comfortable and light with a window opening onto the street (it was very quiet when the windows were closed). The air conditioner worked very well (it was quite hot and humid in Rome when we were there), our room was always cool. Free wifi was also included and breakfast consisted of cereals, fruit, toast and pastries, juice and coffee (proper latte). We enjoyed the location - a couple of no fuss restaurants around and only about a 10 minute walk to Termini, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Definitely good value for money in Rome (we got a good deal booking directly with the hotel) and a very pleasant stay. We would recommend this hotel and happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation excellente !”
Reviews.Author: Maree126
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little hotel. Clean (extremely clean compared to other Rome hotels) and the staff was absolutely friendly and helpful. Nearby all amenities. We took the hop-on-hop-off bus and it was about 100 metres from our hotel. Should I ever go back to Rome, I would stay at this hotel again. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Roberan
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 1 night in this hotel in Rome. We picked the hotel based on price & location & were not disappointed - good value for money & great location - an easy 10 min walk from termini station, located in a quiet street & easy walk to all of Romes wonderful attractions. The room was a reasonable size & very clean - staying in august is was quite hot in the room & in hindsight we should have just paid the extra 10 euro for air-conditioning. But otherwise a great little value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLB87
Reviews.Content: Rome was the final stop on our trip and this hotel really made sure our trip ended on a good note. The staff was friendly and helpful and really made sure you felt like you were at home. The included breakfast was nice every morning. The air-conditioning was key for traveling in august as the temperatures were over 30 degrees every day. The location was convenient for the forum and Colosseum and city center, the Vatican is only a short subway ride away. I would recommend this hotel and all the glowing reviews on this site are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -Perfectly situated - an all round great stay”
Reviews.Author: griswaldsSurrey
Reviews.Content: This is a small typically Italian , family run hotel ideally placed for all the key tourist areas. We stayed in a family room accommodating all four of usand enjoyed a lovely breakfast before walking around town and visiting the well known [ and some of the less well known] sites. The hotel is very well kept and clean and the staff really couldn't be more obliging and helpful. It has restaurants and amenities close at hand and have subsequently recommended it to friends and colleagues we work with in the airline industry as a great place to consider when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back asap”
Reviews.Author: veram_paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near the Termini Station Terminal (10 minute walk) but is also very quiet. The rooms are very clean, comfortable (shower / free wifi). Very nice breakfast included. The major point is the staff : very friendly and keen to help us in any situation. It feels being home at Mummy's. We had a very romantic stay and will be back asap !

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Clarendontraveler
Reviews.Content: It was small, spotless and run by wonderful people. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “a Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: nurseregan
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Very centeral. Staff very helpful and English speaking. Excellent service.Mini bar, air conditioning but most importantly lovely staff all were so kind and happy to help make our stay as pleasant as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Affordable, Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amerid5581
Reviews.Content: Very affordable and perfectly situatuated hotel for a stay in Rome. We were greeted with such friendly helpfulness by the owner of the hotel. The rooms were nice and quiet. The staff, especially Tony, were incredibly helpful and friendly and kind. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, would recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Flyon
Reviews.Content: Overall nice hotel. Its 15 mins walk to main terminal train station so quite accessible location and you could also walk to most other locations. Bring directions as it can be hard to find. Press the buzzer to gain access. Its on Level 1 so up the staris but there is a lift even though its tiny. Room was a fine size, bed comfortable, mini bar, bathroom fine except didnt have hot water for shower for first 2 mornings, advised staff and it was rectified. We were on the road so some noise from traffic but as its a side street it wasnt too bad. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breatfast was very basic. Plenty of restaurants, etc near by.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: manamoomama
Reviews.Content: Our entire stay was spectacular from start to finish. There aren't words enough to describe how at home the entire staff made us feel. We left with lovely memories of a beautiful city and new friends that we hope to visit with again. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: pcr4546
Reviews.Content: As the taxi dropped us off we were not to sure, but once through the huge solid wood doors into a enclosed court yard up one flight of stairs (lift available) our initial reservations were soon put to bed as we were greeted by the very friendly Marianah and soon shown to our room, spacious, clean, with air con (needed in July). 250 meters from the Termini train station, close to restraunts, shops and the hop on hop off tour buses just 100 meters away, this is family run hotel and they are very helpfull in all respects, fluent english speaking to. Good value and if in Rome again we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, and with a great location”
Reviews.Author: nztravelchick
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel was perfect for our stay in Rome with our 5 month old baby. The staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and the rooms were clean and spacious enough. Breakfast was good and the atmosphere is friendly. Our stroller didn't fit in the lift as the lift was too narrow, but the hotel is only on the first floor so it wasn't too bad. The only downside was the thin walls - not so good for our neighbours who would have had to put up with our baby crying! But overall it was a great stay and we would stay again. Only 15 minutes' walk to most major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: annem5223
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is a wonderful hotel in Rome. My daughter and I stayed there at the beginning and end of our Italian holiday In May and June 2011. The staff were so friendly and helpful, nothing was a problem. The rooms were very clean and surprisingly quiet and breakfast was good. It also has a good wifi which is a wonderful bonus. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BigSis44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Giuliana a week ago and was very pleased with the staff and the service. The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly, and the cleaning staff was excellent. The A/C worked very well, and helped to mask the street noise outside (which I understand is typical in Rome). We also appreciated the good wifi connection, simple yet filling breakfast and most of all, the hotel's proximity to the Roma Termini train station. If you are looking for a good budget hotel (although $170/night we paid during peak season is hardly budget for me), we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was home”
Reviews.Author: WootTravel
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. While I have read some of the other reviewers calling this hotel "outdated", I would not say that. It is like being at a family member's house. The staff was amazing; friendly and accommodating. We arrived very early in the morning to be greeted with a smile, help with our luggage and some much needed coffee. They quickly put our rooms together so we could freshen up. They were so helpful with where to go in the city, where to eat and what to expect and we were so grateful for the extra attention. The price is reasonable, the hotel was neat and clean and the staff was fantastic. If you want an impersonal cushy hotel, find another place to stay...if you want to experience Italy in a friendly comfortable place that feels like home, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel was ok”
Reviews.Author: Drewish
Reviews.Content: The staff here was fantastic. They were very helpful with every question and need. The room was pretty basic, but it was clean and had a big bathroom. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana made us feel like Rome was "our" city”
Reviews.Author: travellingparents
Reviews.Content: We spent three very enjoyable nights--May 26-28-- at the air conditioned and very quiet Hotel Guiliana before leaving on our one-week Mediterranian cruise and then came back and spent one more night--June 5. From the Rome Termini station, one walks three blocks down Via Cavour and turns right at the Piazza Esquilino and goes another block--So the hotel is close enough to be handy, but far enough so that the train station crowding, noise, and hubub is far away. The Giuliana staff--all of whom spoke impeccable English-- was very friendly and helpful, recommending restaurants when we asked, and even making our reservations and calling a taxi when we requested them to do so. The morning coffee--cappuccino, actually--was some of the best we've ever tasted. At breakfast, there was fruit, yogurt, rolls, croissants, cereal. We'll gladly return again and again. At the Giuliana, we didn't feel like we were visiting Rome; we felt like we actually lived there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly,great location!”
Reviews.Author: Pamelajmilthorp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during the 3 weeks we were in Rome. The staff were so friendly, the breakfast was great and there was a market right outside. We could walk to all the major sites and the metro/train station is only 10 minutes away. We loved this place! Thank you to all the wonderful staff at Hotel Giuliana were amazing! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Jfhull
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Short walk from train station. Feels like it was next to almost all cites. Great service. Very friendly and knowledagble.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: ryansandeigo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two days and we have nothing but good things to say about it. The location is fantastic - a ten minute walk (max) from termini station, maybe fifteen minutes from the colosseum, with a ton of shops and restaurants nearby. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable (the woman who checked us in had an english accent so communication was simple). They helped us out by recommending some places to eat, as well as telling us which bus we had to take to go out at night. The area is completely safe, we went out to the bars Thursday and Friday night with no problems! The streets are well lit, and there aren't homeless people everywhere like in some cities. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We will definitely be back on our next Rome adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family run hotel. Excellent service. Great location to Termini and Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: gypsysnowy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few mid range/budget hotels in Rome, and this is the cleanest, friendliest, best run place that I have seen. Jean and her lovely family do everything they can to make your stay as good as possible. The Spanish steps are just a walk up the road, and from there it is easy to get to Trevi, Pantheon, everywhere! Its only a 10 min walk from Termini, so easy to get to and from, but far enough away for it to be in a nice area with good restaurants nearby, pharmacy, opera, etc. Definitely stay here if you are after basic but clean (with great showers, a lift, breakfast and coffee) all included. Plus, you get wonderful service from wonderful people!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, family run hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maloney3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giuliana for 4 nights at the beginning of June. This was our first trip to Rome and it was such an amazing, memorable trip made even more memorable by the wonderful staff at Hotel Giuliana. They are all very friendly and helpful and more than happy to recommend restaurants, places to visit and different options on getting around Rome. From the moment we arrived when Tony came bounding downstairs to help us with our cases we knew we had made the right choice to stay here. The hotel is clean and simple and situated in a great location - near to the Colosseum and Ancient Rome as well as the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps (including the designer shops!) It is also very close to the metro so it is easy to get to the Vatican and other places (although Rome is defintely best discovered on foot). The staff are definitely the winner at this hotel though! Thank you to them all and we will defintely stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: MJCH
Reviews.Content: During Easter week my husband and I spent four very pleasant nights in Hotel Giuliana.It is in a perfect location for exploring Rome as it is within walking distance of all the historic sights,the best shopping streets and close to public transport and bus tour providers. The hotel is simple, clean,comfortable and very good value. Management and staff were most helpful and did everything they could to make our stay pleasant. The fact that all the staff have fluent english was an added bonus.It was a most enjoyable visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks! What a pleasure it was to stay with you.”
Reviews.Author: kazanddave666
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 8pm after a long flight from Australia. What a welcome. We felt so at ease. Rooms was lovely, breakfast good. Staff were so helpful and wlecoming. Wished I could have stayed longer than two nights. Found this a great location for all the sights and very handy for the Termini for our connections on Eurostar to Naples. Thanks Hotel Giuliana! It was a delight. Karen and David Hughes Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in an expensive city.”
Reviews.Author: tripregular
Reviews.Content: The people who run the hotel are its best advertisement. Friendly, helpful and competent. That includes everyone on the staff. Plus, good location, convenient to local sights and transportation, comfortable and clean facilities. We were surprised and appreciative of the early (6:30) breakfast provided on our departure. They didn't have to do that, but they did. If we return we will have to book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, right price.”
Reviews.Author: themillers09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 11 with my teenage son and daughter. I booked at the last minute and the hotel staff was very willing to help. Since I had a son and daughter, they made my room into a triple. Maryanne and Antonio were very friendly and gave good advice with tours, direction, food choices and even reserved a taxi for our departure. Breakfast was better than the average European-style place with breads, pastries, juice, cereal and coffee. My picky teen kids loved the experience and service. My kids were amazed at the friendliness of this hotel compared to the bigger ones we've stayed in while traveling to other countires and the US. This place only has 11 rooms. The price is commesurate with the location. It's a 5-10 min walk to the Metro (Termini) and the Trevi Fointain is within walking (30 min). The Open-Top bus tours all all within 5 minutes walk. A nice place at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: RRP2011
Reviews.Content: excellent and friendly service; adequate breakfast (excellent coffee); reasonable walking distance (15 mins) from Colosseum, Trevi Fountain

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooned in Rome and couldn't have found a more welcoming place”
Reviews.Author: World_TraveIer
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great find, thanks TripAdvisor! Rates were great when compared to other hotels in good locations. The wife and I went for our Honeymoon, stayed in three different hotels through Europe, two in Italy, and this was by far the LARGEST ROOM and the BEST BATHROOM we had - not sure what you value in a room but we realized after we left how nice we had it. The only reason I'm giving one less star for sleeping quality is because we had a Double Superior bed which is essentially two twin beds pushed together and it can be challening at times but for the most part wasn't a factor. We were about one block away from the "Hop On Hop Off" bus stop so that was prime as they take you everywhere. You're also around the corner from tons of restaurants, walking distance to the Trevoli fountain and many other sites. We met the owner and her daughter, very friendly people, did everything in their power to make your stay perfect. Called a cab anytime you needed it, printed out train schedules if you were only curious, recommended items to eat, wines to drink and were very accommodating incase you came back and were still up for a drink they had a full bar and were willing to help. Also this was the only place we stayed at the included the breakfast in the price which was great. Overall I say location was perfect, area is safe and perfect: two later bars in walking distance, about a dozen restaurants in crawling distance, a tobacco shop next door, pharmacy across the street, atm on the corner, plenty of gelato nearby, main sites in walking distance - no more than 10 minutes or so depending on where you're heading. Also, if you're not a walker, which I wasn't after a few days, you can cab it to any main attraction for under 10 euro (be VERY CAREFUL with cabs! - the front desk gave me the scoop on what to look for otherwise I would have been scammed plenty of times)

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: brittnila
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is the BEST hotel I stayed in while in Italy. The size (11 rooms, I believe) makes for a quiet setting, which is always a plus when you're days are so jam packed of sightseeing. The rooms are small, but incredibly clean, and very comfortable. Location wise - amazing. Everything, excluding Vatican City is within a half hours walk from the front door. The biggies are even closer. I think the best thing about the hotel though is that staff. Everybody that worked there was so friendly, and so happy to chat. My friends and I actually sat for an hour or so every day with them after our sightseeing just talking about anything that came to mind. The fact that they were so happy to talk, really made it feel like staying at a friends house opposed to a huge, overcrowded hotel. I would stay here in a second next trip to Rome, and actually still keep in touch with Jean, Antonio and Marianna. These people are amazing. Also, they had the best recommendations for yummy food close by.

Reviews.Title: “Jean and her crew are great”
Reviews.Author: cjbignell
Reviews.Content: From the moment you go in the door Jean and Her crew are very sweet and helpful very good breakfast in the tiny breakfast area. and it turns into a wine bar after noon. My husband sat there a few afternoons as we got our second wind for the next tour. they were very helpful suggesting tours and place to eat. i would go there again in a heart beat. miss you guys alread!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CliveT49
Reviews.Content: We were a family of three. We found that the location was perfect. We walked from the train station to this in about 10 - 15 mins and checked into our room. Lots of attractions can be easily reached by walking. The staff was very helpful and gave us lots of tips and information on places to eat, visit and do, and how to get around. Breakfast each day was good and there was enough of a variety of things to choose from, to make it interesting. We had a pleasant three day stay at this hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: deruderu
Reviews.Content: This is a family run hotel located in the 1st floor of an old building (ground floor is just an alley way with the usual big tall doors like the most streets in Rome). The location is about 5-10 minute walk from Termini station. The room is not too big but sufficient for my short stay in Rome. Despite the size of the room, there is a bidet, toilet and bath tub in the bathroom. The bed is comfortable. I was able to sleep well in a quiet neighbourhood of this busy city. The hostess is very friendly and recommended restaurants which are very good. The room booking includes breakfast which serves toast, cereal, fresh made coffee by the house maid, fruits and yogurt. It was a good start for the day. If you are not looking for anything fancy and good value, this hotel would be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this WONDERFUL Rome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrentofAZ
Reviews.Content: Great service, from reservation, check-in, housekeeping, breakfast, check-out and for all the little details like tour reservations, site suggestions, little added amenities, they do it all! We really felt like "Guests", in the truest sense of the word! The location near the train station, tour operators, relatively quite street, great shopping, historic sites, interesting neighborhood, nice restaurants, etc.... just can't be beat. It's not a luxury property, but you can't do better for a modestly priced facility in a great location We've already recommended it to friends and family. If we ever return to Rome (and I hope we will!) we will stay here again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A family hotel, a place that makes you feel welcome and you want always come back!”
Reviews.Author: MSolange
Reviews.Content: This is a Hotel where people stay and want to come back, you feel so welcome and safe . That happened to me, I have been there in 2008 and I came back on 2010 with my Mother and Aunt. I have found in that Hotel everything that usually people looking for in a Italian city: comfort, organization, cleaning and people extremely kind. The location is fantastic and the price is fair, for me it was a wonderful experience. Solange

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in the Center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CindyKingston_PA_USA
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome, and we were fortunate enough to stay a week at the Hotel Giuliana. It is a family run hotel, meticulously clean and bright. Breakfast was served graciously each morning, and the round-the-clock staff began to feel like family, seeing to our every need, advising us on travel and arranging transportation when needed. We were certainly guests of a family in a professional, yet personalized hotel tucked convieniently in the very center of activity of this beautiful city, just near the breath-taking Basicilica Santa Maria Maggiori, and only blocks from Termini Station. Our hope is to return to stay at the restful Hotel Guiliana when we return to further explore this spectacular city.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel for that "Home away from home feeling."”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine0226
Reviews.Content: My partner and i arrived exhausted at the Hotel Giuliana after 26 hours of traveling. We were greeted warmly by Antonio, who helped carry my luggage in and had us checked in to our comfortable room within minutes. The hotel is nicely decorated with modern and beautiful furnishings, yet still holds the historical appeal that comes from an 18th century building. The atmosphere at Hotel Giuliana is warm and welcoming all the way through. The room was good sized for a hotel room, and was again beautifully decorated. It had a large window that over looked the street where the market was held every day, a mini-fridge and a safe. The t.v. was small, but since we don"t speak Italian and we did not travel from Oregon to watch t.v. it posed no problem for us. The bathroom was BEAUTIFUL with marble counters and a bathtub/shower. And although the shower guard looked small at about 2 1/2 feet (far from the 10" that Rnegadea claimed) it was more then enough, and we never once had a problem showering and water didn't spray all over the bathroom. The bath towels were nice and big, and all of the towels were soft and spotlessly white. The double bed was nice and comfy, with spotless linens, a nice soft blanket and a warm bed cover. After Antonio showed me how to work the heater/air-conditioner the first night our room stayed nice and warm. There was a slight smell to the hall but it is a very recognizable one that is caused by age, it is not unpleasant and very normal for any building that is so old. The breakfast area is nice and offered pastry, fruit and toast. There was juice and other drinks available but the best part was that they made your coffee as you ordered it- espresso, tea, cafe americano, you name it and they made it at their coffee bar. In a business where the norm is a coffee pot set out for guests, this is another example where Hotel Giuliana goes above and beyond for their guests! The location was perfect. It was a short walk to shopping, cafes, restaurants, and many tourist sites. For the sites a bit farther away, Termini station was only 7 minutes walk. Or the staff was always willing to call a taxi for us. The churches within walking distance were amazingly beautiful and worth seeing. I loved everything about our 9 day stay at Hotel Giuliana, but what makes this 2 star hotel worthy of a 5 star rating is hands down its staff. Antonio was always smiling and very helpful with all my questions. He showed me how to operate the heater control, brought my luggage up, found me some extra pillows when i asked.He also made a drink for me and my partner before we went out for dinner one night, and when we came back engaged to be married, he offered a hug and many congratulations. When asked he admitted to knowing that my boyfriend was going to propose!!! I don't know of any other place where people make you feel so comfortable that you want to share your life changing moments with them! And i felt just as comfortable with the rest of the staff, they were all kind and helpful. The night/early morning staff Ashwin and Federicod, always greeted me and answered any of my questions even at 3 a.m. in the morning when i was awake trying to adjust to the time zone change! Marianna who worked the day was always helping us figure out how to get where we wanted to be and even marking it on a map for us. She was knowledgeable about transportation options and was able to give us accurate travel times off the top of her head. She helped us plan our train trip to Venice and told us how and when to purchase tickets. She knew the best places to shop and when i ended up with 2 more suitcases of items then i had arrived with, she recommended having them shipped home to the U.S. She found out where i could do this, printed up the address and called a taxi to take me there. She felt like an old friend and as with Antonio and Jean i found myself sitting for 30 minutes or more talking about all manners of things. On the day before we had to leave, another guest at the hotel had a frightening experience while out at night, when the guest had to go to the police station to file a report Marianna went with her and translated for her. She was there for 2 hours. Once again above and beyond! And that leads me to Jean who is the force behind the magic. She and her family treat the guests as if we were family too. I found my self on 3 occasions talking with her for over an hour about life, careers, religion,love,family, hopes, and dreams. It was wonderful to find another person with such a caring heart. It shows in everything she does and it has passed down onto her family and the rest of the staff making the Hotel Giuliana the best "Home" away from home i have ever been to. If you want a excellent and inviting stay while you are in Rome this is the place to go. I will be back and i will recommend Hotel Giuliana over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - disregard Rnegadea comments.”
Reviews.Author: kitwalker_devil
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only 5 minutes from Termini and you could walk to some attractions if you wanted to. Laundry and good takeaway food spots weren't far from the hotel at all.
