We arrived at the hotel to be met by Antonio (night shift) who was absolutely the most polite and nicest receptionist we met on our entire europe trip. He helped with the internet access, all the directions to places we needed to go, and also advised the cheapest way to call USA for a reservation I needed to change. The breakfast - I beleive it is the standard European breakfast with some pastries, cereals, fruit juice and toast - which is more than enough for breakfast. The Room - a nice clean double bed, clean bathroom facilities and a heater that worked fine. There was no smell in the room and yes it was cold outside no doubt - the heaters worked beautifully as I actually slept in a sleeveless singlet under the blankets. Yes the TV was small but when you're on a trip to check out the historical sites of Rome who cares?! To be totally honest I have seen a smaller and much less appealing room in London which cost me a helluva lot more. The hotel overall was very good service and excellent value for money - if you're looking for 5 star concierge service and want to complain about the size of a TV then this is not for you but if you are in Rome to do a lot of sightseeing and need a place to bunk with good service for a very good price then this is the hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Going Back”
Reviews.Author: goliath03
Reviews.Content: Last December was the 10th year that we stayed in the Hotel Giuliana. The location is perfect, about 10 minutes walk from the Termini and within walking distance of many of the great sights of Rome including the Colleseum, Trevi Fountain, Basilicas of St. Mary Major and St. John Lateran. and the Opera House to name just a few. It is a relatively short bus journey to the Vatiican. Buses, trains and the Metro are within easy reach if you wish to go further afield. There are many fine restaurants in the area, a supermarket just a short walk from the hotel and a street market. The Hotel Giuliana is clean, comfortable and with the breakfast included this makes it excellent value for money. All the staff are friendly and helpful and do everything possible to make your stay enjoyable and memorable. The Hotel Giuliana is a gem in the heart of Rome. That is why we keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely family welcome”
Reviews.Author: snowball002
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for nine nights taking in wales v italy rugby and sightseeing, we had a very warm welcome from marianna and eventually all the other english speaking family. we were given our room on arrival which was very clean with safe ,fridge, teasmade ,air-con and a very comfortable bed. breakfast was basic but enough with very nice coffee. hotel ideally situated for all sights and termini station for trains and buses , we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, everything else average.”
Reviews.Author: anadyne_heart
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for several days while exploring Rome. The location worked out very well for us. It was within easy walking distance from Termini (but not so close as to be in any way sketchy) and had a grocery store just a block or so away. We were able to walk to almost anything we wanted to see in downtown Rome, and there is a small street market with knockoff purses and some produce and clothing, etc., on the side street adjacent to the hotel's building. We weren't bothered by the street noise and couldn't really hear it unless the windows were open. When closed, the windows shut out a lot of the sound and chilly air. As for the staff, we just didn't have the same experience as other reviewers. I don't think we ever met the owners or managers. The person behind the desk was always very businesslike and polite, but certainly not friendly or especially approachable. They were able to answer questions about bus or train locations, maps and such, which is all we really needed from them and so we were satisfied, but we had the eerie feeling each time we came in that we were guests in someone else's home and had interrupted them in the middle of some more important task. Our room was fine, neat and clean to the eye. Yes it did have that overused airplane restroom smell, but after living in old buildings for half my life I think it comes from the older plumbing system and not from lack of cleanliness. Having said that, the smell could get pretty thick at times and regardless of the source, it was tough to sit in the room at times and forget eating there. The bathroom at least in our room was really fantastic though - clearly a fresh remodel, tons of hot water and a nice sized shower. We also had a small fridge in our room...not sure if it remains on though when you leave the room and take your room key out of the charger though. The items in the fridge weren't too overpriced - there is beer, water and soda as I remember it. That was really convenient. We never had the breakfast but we did drink the lovely coffee that is made for you upon request and really loved it. Overall we found this a fairly average small hotel - nice, but nothing special. We would recommend this to a friend for the location and general neatness of the room if they could get a great price here, but perhaps not recommend it resoundingly.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Giuliana is a gem in Rome with a wonderful staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: andrewsrj
Reviews.Content: Hotel Review We travelled to Rome April 21 & 22, 2010 and stayed at Hotel Giuliana for a second time after 4 years. Jean & her staff were wonderful and professional as usual. We had booked our room with them by internet. They confirmed our reservations, but also added the personal touch of letting us know they were looking forward to seeing us again. Upon arriving, it was like seeing an old friend…so personal and inviting. They were sincerely happy to see us again! The rooms were wonderful, nicely decorated, and clean. There is a lovely breakfast area, which was included in the price of the room. The location is right downtown Rome, close to the train station, it is so easy to get out and walk everywhere to all the attractions.. The staff were extremely helpful in suggestions for restaurants, shopping, sightseeing, etc. They were always more than willing to check airlines, cabs, etc. for us. They were able to arrange a cab driver to take us to the airport at a flat fee. It was such a great experience..Antonio was great, lots of fun in helping us with questions and suggestions. Loved to be there, hated to leave, but definitely want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cavancowboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, good location, friendly staff, great value, room very clean, good size room & bathroom, great start to our Rome trip

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: livlycke
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, nice room and loccation. We will hopefully be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and staff”
Reviews.Author: Carmitsu
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with anything. I am not sure what if anything could be changed. The location was 5-7 min from the train station, 3-5 min to Santa Maria Majorie. On a major street to visit many other places. Straight walk down to Spanish steps. One day we had to walk from the St. Peters and we were able to find our way back easily with the map they had given us. There are plenty of places to eat near by. Italian Chinese .........Many price ranges. Opera house is around the corner. Small outdoor market right next door. Really great location. Very nice and helpful staff great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Europe_bound1010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is a little gem in the heart of Rome just a few minutes easy walk from the Termini train station. Their service is warm and friendly- they greeted us with a warm welcome and let us check in hours earlier (at 10AM!) than their stated check-in time. They went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and gave us a city map and some tips on where to go and how to get there. At 60eu. for a standard double room which included breakfast, this was a great bargain as well. You can easily walk to a number of area attractions- the Colosseum, the Forum, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, but the public transportation, both metro and bus are very close and convenient. We bought the Roma pass for 25 eu for 3-days which gave us free access to some local sights and free metro and bus travel for our entire stay. We were greeted with friendly smiles each day as we wearily returned to our room. They even let you buy a bottle of wine right there to enjoy in your room. Bed was super comfortable and we slept great with no street noise to speak of. Bathroom had great water pressure, plenty of hot water and was very comfortably sized. Great price, great location and amazing Roman hospitality. You can't go wrong at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A small, welcoming, comfortable hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: samosal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January and were looking for a base close to trains, metro and buses and some of the major sights (we walked to the Colisseum) and the Guiliana was very convenient in this respect. However, what really made our stay was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staf,f which creates a very relaxed atmosphere. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and breakfasts generous. We loved the huge old wooden entrance doors and the "retro" lift too, which gives a lot of character to the hotel's setting. Good choice of local eateries too. Highly recommended. .

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Remarkable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pacificbum
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Guiliana for about 6 nights while in Rome. The experience was fantastic! The staff really above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and convenient. The location is excellent...you can see the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore from the balconies of the hotel, and its about a 5 minute walk to Termini (the train station in Rome) and about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and Piazza Barberini. Excellent location in the heart of Rome! All the rooms were extremely clean and well kept (we had friends staying in other rooms). The size of the room was in fact much larger than typical hotels in Italy as well. And as far as value, Hotel Guiliana was one of a kind. I guarantee you will not find a cleaner hotel with friendlier staff in any better location in Rome. I've had the pleasue of traveling to Rome on 6 separate occasions and have stayed all over the city, and there has not been a better hotel than Hotel Guiliana! Thank you to this great hotel and staff for making this trip our most memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Number one family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: malta_jan16
Reviews.Content: Just arrived from Rome. I recommend Hotel Guliana, since staff are very helpful. Hotel is very clean and hotel is in the city centre. Many thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A charming family run hotel in the heart of history”
Reviews.Author: rockymountain302
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome from our host Marianna who was extra helpful. We felt very cozy in this old world hotel that was situated perfectly in the historical center of Rome.Everything was in walking distance and that is exactly what we did.Surrounding it were wonderful restaurants which of course we enjoyed very much with amazing wines of Italy.The English speaking staff were just amazing. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning in the very comfortable dining area and of course the cappucino made to order.Our room was spotless with all the amenities of home.We were so excited that the market was set up each morning just on the street outside our window. We would so highly recommend this hotel and is just excellent for the value and please say hello to the staff for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location, cleanliness and customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Maria60811
Reviews.Content: If you value customer service, this is a great place to stay. I traveled with 3 other people and we all enjoyed our stay at Hotel Giuliana. It's a small (no frills) hotel in a great location of Rome. We walked almost everywhere. It's close to the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, and good shopping. We took a short cab to the ancient city. By far, however, the best part about the hotel was the friendly and VERY helpful staff. Be sure to ask them for restaurant recommendations because every place they recommended was AMAZING. They also are very helpful making cab arrangements and offering tips about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was amazing”
Reviews.Author: danna_alexandra
Reviews.Content: I feel so bad for having forgotten the name of the gentleman who was working the front desk, but he was AMAZING! He gave directions, made metro recommendations and restaurant recommendations. I always sleep with a fan on at home and asked if they had a portable fan available, they didn't but after a quick call to the owner I was given the remote the the air conditioner so that I could use the fan on it, very thoughtful. The location was very close the the Coloseum and the Roman Forum, and was a very easy walk to the Spanish Steps. Walking to the Vatican is possible, but i would NOT recommend it, it will take up all your energy. Take the subway or the bus, it's cheap and worth it for sure. Room was spacious and shower was hot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....plain and simple”
Reviews.Author: Gunny49er
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walk from Rome train station. Very friendly and interesting owner. I stayed in a single room and the bed was really small but the price was quite reasonable. I'll stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem of a hotel with the most wonderful, personal service.”
Reviews.Author: Nansdrivel
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother-in-law and I stayed at this adorable little hotel as our last stop in Italy. We had been traveling for a week and were a little weary. But when we checked in, we were greeted with such warmth and friendliness that we were immediately energized! Our rooms were very comfortable and clean, and the hotel is in a terrific location. The family who owns this hotel is just delightful. We were treated as if we were family, too, and enjoyed our daily chats with everyone on the staff. I was lucky enough to enjoy a glass of wine with the owner each night we were there - we had wonderful conversations! All of us highly recommend this darling little hotel. Perfect location, clean and comfortable rooms, and a staff that truly cares about your comfort and treats you like family. We'll never stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for nearly everything in rome”
Reviews.Author: ARTHUR21
Reviews.Content: We stayey two nights and saw a lot of Rome due to having access to the train and bus tour locations within a short walk. The hotel room was basic but clean and the continetal breakfast was sufficent, the staff were very friendly and helpful, was a good experience. Also there is a very good chinese restraunt near by called La Giunca on 00185 Roma-Via Daniele Manin ,very clean and modern and great food. We had a week in Tuscany before Rome so we were just about done with bread and pasta. If departing from Rome by air its only a 10min. walk to the Rome Termini train station and a 30 min. train ride cost euro 14 .

Reviews.Title: “The best value hotel you will ever find - excellent rooms and service!”
Reviews.Author: TheLittleWelsh
Reviews.Content: Rome is notoriously expensive and a proper tourist trap that's why I was so gobsmacked byt the incredible value and service we received while staying at the Hotel Giuliana! Located down a small road off a large shopping street, the Hotel is found on the second floor of a huge building - as most hotels are in Rome. When entering the hotel you'll be greeted by warm smiles and the friendliest service you could ever hope to receive. The rooms are medium to large in size - excellent for Italy - and have simply but homely furnishings. The beds are comfortable and large and the bathroom was spotless and very accommodating with lovely little bottles of soap and shampoo. The breakfast was excellent and we ate ours on the small balcony - croissants, coffee, cereals, toast, fruit, yogurts - delicious and very continental! The staff are so helpful at Hotel Giuliana and offered plenty of hints and tips and directions to help us make the most of our short stay in the fabulous city! Also there is a small supermarket further down from the hotel located under a nearby bridge and going in the other direction there is a restaurant which was open every day of the week - another amazing thing to find in Italy! I would 100% you stay here if you go to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, handy location with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DeM255060
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights recently. This small hotel is located within easy walking distance of the main train station, Termini, in a pleasant neighbourhood. All attractions are within walking distance of the hotel, but if you prefer to use public transport then the main transport hub of Termini is close. There are restaurants and coffee bars nearby, and around the corner is a street market selling fresh fruit, cheese, and bread which made a wonderful picnic lunch. Our room was very clean and comfortable. A Continental Breakfast was provided. The staff were absolutely wonderful - friendly, courteous, helpful and non-intrusive. We would stay again and would recommend this gem to those travellers who want to be out enjoying the city but want a clean, comfortable and handy hotel for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_CLT
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where the last reviewer stayed, but it wasnt Hotel Giuliana. From reservations to check-out we experienced nothing but superior service. The Hotel arranged car service coming and going and provided excellent recommendations for dinner and helpful "get around tips". Breakfast was lovely. We were even late getting up and the staff made us coffee even though service had already been completed. We had a triple room and overlooked the street. The room was large and accomodations were very adequate. If we are ever back in Rome, we'll certainly be staying at Hotel Giuliana! - Ciao Michael

Reviews.Title: “Just Location, nothing else; stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: bilader7
Reviews.Content: Close location to the Rome Termini, but very poor Hotel. The rooms are very small and dirty. Breakfast is almost nothing. We had to change the Hotel at the first day of Rome. Day staff was helpful but the night shift there was a poor man playing cards on the internet all the night, my wife got sick here and noone helped even for a hot drinkable water, we had to boil our own in the kitchen if the hotel. No recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RSaravanan
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and our 2 kids stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for 3 days during the last week of October 2010 - and we really loved our stay there! If we do make another trip to Rome, we would simply pick Giuliana again, for 3 reasons: 1. Quality of service, 2. Spacious, comfortable rooms and 3. Proximity to Termini.. The people at the hotel were extremely helpful in enabling us get the most out of the time we had, and the hotel's location (10 mins walk from Termini) is very ideal for having the hotel as your base and planning your excursions to various parts of Rome.. There are quite a few good restaurants at walking distances around the hotel as well.. In short - excellent value for money, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: AJCairns
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights and found the location of the hotel and the staff to be both excellent. I had chosen this hotel from previous reviews on Trip advisor and we were not disappointed. Staff were especially helpful and friendly. After touring around Italy we needed an extra night accommodation prior to flying out the next day and we chose to stay here again on our way home. We are 2 single ladies in our middle age who have not travelled much on our own and this hotel was an excellent choice for us. Thank you to Jean and staff.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service at a 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: k9mother
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Jean, Federico,Antonio and all the wonderful staff at the Hotel Giuliana for making our first trip to Rome a wonderful experience! There are many reasons to stay at this hotel but the marvelous staff is THE main reason, they go above and beyond to meet or exceed your expectations. As for the other reasons, the location is very conveniently close to the Roma Termini train station. You can easily walk the 6 blocks and not bother with a taxi. It's also within easy walking distance of the Colosseum ( 1.5 Km.- around 20-30 minutes, depending on how much window shopping you do), Piazza Navona (2.2 Km-30 min.),the Spanish Steps ( 20 min.) and Piazza del Popolo ( 2.2 Km. - 30 min.). The rooms are very spacious and clean, with plenty of room for your suitcases. It is a juxtaposition of modern and antique: we loved the high ceilings and great wifi service! We had a lovely, sparkling clean bathroom with a shower & tub- we did have hot water "issues" the first day, but these were quickly resolved by Jean and her staff. In short, a terrific stay thanks to the staff there who will go the extra mile to get you a coffee before your 7:00 a.m. pick-up for your Vatican tour ( that they also arranged for us- NO lines to get in, and you get in before everyone else), and unfailingly steered us to great restaurants ( Antica Boheme, right around the corner). GRAZIE MILLE !!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, with Friendly and Helpful staff. A+++”
Reviews.Author: mchverchko
Reviews.Content: I just travelled to Italy for 10 days with my sister and a good friend. We started and ended our trip in Rome at the Hotel Giuliana. The hotel is in a great location and close to many things. The staff was friendly and very helpful with recommendations and services (They even offered to keep some luggage for us until the end of our trip, which was amazing and helped with our travels since we were changing cities a few times.) The rooms and bathrooms are super clean. I really can't say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff was. Another example, my friend dropped her glasses and they were looking through the toolbox to find us a screwdriver to put them back together. I will be staying there the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “the Best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 1whitecat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of everything you need to see when in Rome. Antonio, Marianna and staff are great. They made our stay in Rome special, they were very helpful, and made us feel that this was our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay at Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: Robbo076
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great priced Hotel with awsome staff and breakfast inclueded then this is he place too stay!! I strongly recomend Hotel Giuliana, as they go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mliu21
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Giuliana. The staff was really friendly and I had a great conversation with Jean, one of the owners. She and her daughter (and a few others I think) run this business and they've really done a fantastic job with making their guests feel at home. They were even okay with storing my luggage with them for half a day when I was traveling through Rome after my stay, which made things convenient. Breakfast at the hotel is delicious. And the location can't be better. Walking to and from Roma Termini only took about 10 minutes and I had my luggage with me. I highly recommend this place to future visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if you like walking”
Reviews.Author: tekirisma
Reviews.Content: While centrally located between 3 metro stops (incl. Stazione Termini), each is at least 10-15 min. walk away up or down hills depending on which stop/line, and whether you're coming or going. Sometimes I just couldn't take that last walk and climb! after a day of touring, and just cabbed it. Buses are closer but still a little walk. At least Two restaurants, within 1-3 min. walk. Bathroom quite nice with the commonly-found corner slide doors for the shower: if you're a larger person, they can present quite a challenge, just fitting through them. Staff are all extremely friendly. Breakfast area/lobby tiny, with just a few 2 seater tables. OJ, bread/toast, cornette (glazed croissant), coffee/tea/cappacino, cheese (small foil-wrapped triangles), jelly, 3 kinds of cold cereal, milk, apples, bananas, honey. Adequately filling, if not exciting. Room small but adequate. CNN only, on TV. Only one outlet in room (besides the one high on wall for TV) so if you have re-charging to do for more than one person or item, be sure to bring a little power cord with several outlets: & power is only on when you're IN the room. Beds (twins for us) small but fine, and Very comfortable! Street noise (road traffic) made it hard to sleep unless window closed, then negligible noise. Internet available at a charge: paid 12.5 Euros for 7 nts. Personally would look for a hotel closer to metro if I were ever to return to Rome (NOT my favorite city), otherwise wouldn't hesitate to recommend it if you're not in need of frills.

Reviews.Title: “Could not wait to go back for my second staying!”
Reviews.Author: blank94
Reviews.Content: In the centre of centre of the world famous sites. Walking distance to Termini Piazza's, fine restaurants and sightseeing tour buses. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service at Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: Gator95
Reviews.Content: Thank you Antonio and Marianna for a wonderful stay in Rome. Your personal service was exceptional as were the made to order breakfast cappuccinos . Thank you for your assistance in locating fabulous restaurants, aquiring transportation and learning about all Rome has to offer. We will certainly recommend your pleasant hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SoakUpTheEnergy
Reviews.Content: We loved the Giuliana as much as the other reviewers did. The room was small, but very clean with a really nice bathroom and no street noise to speak of. The staff was exceptionally helpful. The Termini Station is just a few mintues' walk to the hotel, so if you fly into Leonardo da Vinci airport and take the express train into the city, you can definitely walk to the hotel. There is also a Metro stop a few blocks away which was nice as it was our first time in Rome and this enabled us to get to and from attractions easily. There are some good restaurants in the neighborhood. We would definitely recommend the Giuliana--the value was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: efhaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and found it very quiet and comfortable. Our bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. We had air con which we used but in the mornings, could turn off and open the big window. The hotel's location is close to many eateries and the train station. The morning breakfast was typical and tasty. There was adequate hot water for our shower, though in our room, the pressure was very low. Our friends' room had more water pressure so it was not hotel-wide. The owners, Marianna and Antonio, were lovely and full of tips and suggestions. After a full day of site seeing, it was a pleasure to walk into the hotel and be greeted by either the owners or one of their staff. After 2 weeks in various locations in Italy, the friendliness and willingness to make suggestions and offer assistance, more than makes up for a hotel or B&B's lack of fancy showers or breakfasts. This is what makes a hotel a place you'd like to return to. Antonio makes the best Cappucino and was always willing to make one for me, regardless of time of day! I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Darlene47
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted immediately and graciously. Comfortable room with ample room and lovely washroom ajoining. Quiet atmosphere and lovely breakfast to start the day. Close to the metro, shopping and restaurants. Ask Antonio or Marianna and they will direct you as English is spoken at this hotel as well. Will definitely return and stay at this hotel, you can walk anywhere from here and see the beautiful sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Giuliana was effortless, the way it should be”
Reviews.Author: Noons36
Reviews.Content: Giuliana was conveniently located for us arriving at Termini, but also close enough to walk to most to old city sights. The hotel staff were the most friendly we encountered during our 5 week holiday. The room was very clean, wifi worked well and was comparatively affordable. We would stay at Guiliana again. The best hotels are the ones that make your stay easy, and this is one of those.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Fit”
Reviews.Author: griffinrossi
Reviews.Content: Just a brief review from someone who normally doesn't leave any reviews good or bad on places I've stayed or ate in. Albeit my second stay in Rome, Hotel Giuliana will be the choice stay for any further trips to Rome. Location wise it's perfect, a straightforward 10 minute walk to sights such as il Collosseo, the Trevi Fountain/Pantheon or the Spanish Steps. The neighbourhood is safe, quiet and central whereas the staff of the hotel were courteous, friendly and more than helpful. The rooms were an adequate size for two male adults, spotlessly clean though and serviced everyday (unlike our previous hotel from 2009). I'd thoroughly recommend any travellers young or old to stay here and will most certainly do so again. Good hotels can be somewhat of a rarity anywhere and this one deserves all the praise it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: comefromaway2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what I needed. The only thing that wasn't so great was the bed was an exceptionally small single bed and was very hard and quite uncomfortable. I'm not normally someone who cares to much, I just want a bed, but this one was quite hard. Also I was in a room without air conditioning. I knew this when I booked it, but given that it was Rome in August, I would not book a room without air conditioning again. There was a fan, which helped. Other than the bed and the AC, the staff were wonderful and always there to answer any questions. The breakfast room was very cute and breakfast itself, which was included was quite good. A variety of fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee, cheese, croissants, juice, etc. Basically everything you need to get a good start to your day. I didn't feel it was lacking anything breakfast wise. Also the location was wonderful. I arrived late at night and it was a very quick simple walk from the train station which was nice. It was also very centrally located in terms of seeing the other sites in Rome, the Colosseum, Forum, etc. As long as you stay in an air conditioned room, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best memories in rome”
Reviews.Author: medovnik
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this lovely hotel for one week. The staff was so friendly that we started to feel like we were at home at the end of the first day. They did their best to help us and make our stay more beautiful; especially the lady at the reception who made us smile every time we encountered! The location of the hotel is also another thing that deserves attention because that made it possible to go almost everywhere on foot. The only problem could be the noise coming from the street market next to the hotel but if you are an early bird like me, it will be nice to be woken up by some other people and make a fresh start in the morning :) The breakfast is a kind of traditional Italian breakfast and is included in the price. My recommendation: Never think twice to reserve a room at this pretty place if you are lucky enough to find one!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTICO”
Reviews.Author: misscinnamon_23
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana was fantastic! The staf was extremely nice and helpful and the rooms were very comfortable. Plus they were air conditioned. The hotel is siutuated in the central part of the city so walking everywhere was easy. Breakfast was delicious. I will definitely stay again the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice....”
Reviews.Author: neha69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this family run hotel for 2 nights and it was a pleasurable experience. The staff at the front desk is very helpful and speak good english. The hotel is a 10 minute from Termini station and walking distance to most sights. There is also a bus station 1 minute away and the city has a affordable and well connected bus service. The rooms were of good size and very clean with a ok size bathroom. Breakfast at the hotel is quite limited. The highlight of the hotel is the street market next door, where one can do good shopping at reasonable prices. The hotel is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good basecamp 15 minutes walk from Termini”
Reviews.Author: BN68
Reviews.Content: Good coffee, bland self-serve breakfast, and worth extra 10Euros for air-con room in the 40C heat wave. We were glad that we could come back for a shower/short rest in early afternoon. Room was very clean, shower temp rather difficult to adjust. Was not bothered by noises of a local market outside even though I am a very light sleeper - in fact we enjoyed exploring there and bought our daily rations of fresh fruits. The Amore Ristorante across the street recommended by hotel was horrible - large portion but tasted worse than fast food. Areas around the hotel and Termini were quite dirty but we felt safe to walk around at nighte after an initial hesitation

Reviews.Title: “like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hobie.mike
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an extended trip of Italy. Hotel Giuliana was to be our base station for Rome as we (my sister and I) met up with my wife. Plus we were on bicycles. So that meant, storage of bikes and gear while not using the bikes, accommodating changing requirements for lodging at the end of our trip. The family run Hotel Giuliana kindly handled all our needs, plus we had a wonderful room and one of the nicest breakfasts you can imagine. While in Rome, the staff provided us with recommendations for restaurants and other tourist activities. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for kind, attentive staff, have special needs, like we had with our bicycles, need to make complicated arrangements and like the atmosphere of a family run B&B.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy,Friendly,Great location place to be.”
Reviews.Author: baeng69780
Reviews.Content: This small,family run hotel is only a ten minute walk from Romes main Termini train station or 20 mins in a taxi from the airport.( taxi cost 55euro.train 12 euro per person) There were four of us so we got a taxi. An impressive entrance doorway leads you into a marble floorway lobby and stairs or lift to the reception. A friendly greeting awaits and a room key card quickly given. The rooms we had (a double and a twin for the kids) were spacious and tidy. Ensuite facilities of course for both with minibar and tv in the double. Comfy beds with clean pressed sheets and spare pillows and blanket if req. Breakfast was had in a dining area suitable for the size of premise,consisted of fresh made coffee,toast,croissants,cereals,fresh fruit,yogurts. Plenty for all and enough choice depending on your diet. The hotel is situated around the corner from an excellant open topped bus tour which departs every half hour and is one that you can get on and off at various locations around the city. You can easily walk from the hotel to all the sites.The colluseum,Spanish steps,Trevi fountain to name but a few. A Happy,Friendly,Great location place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: swhwriter
Reviews.Content: The staff of Hotel Giuliana is very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. Breakfast was good--fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, croissants and very good coffee. However, you should know that this is really more of a pensionne--it's located on the second floor of a mixed-use building. There's a rather rickety elevator (we took the stairs). The pictures of the rooms on the website are not entirely representative of ALL the rooms. Although our bathroom had been newly remodeled, the room itself was cramped and rather dreary. We asked for a quad and got a double bed, twin and tiny cot (luckily our 13 year old son is small for his age--an adult would not be comfortable on this). There was no dresser. Everything was very clean--no problems there. So, ask questions about what your room will contain. It's located near two different subway lines and the train station, so convenient but not particularly charming. More of a business neighborhood. Clean, safe, reasonably priced, helpful but no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: whobee
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is excellent. The entire staff speaks both Italian and English very well, and is very kind. I stayed in a single room in July and the room was quiet, clean, and comfortable. This will be my hotel from now on every time I am in Rome. Wi-Fi is available, breakfast is provided, and the hotel is near many restaurants and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Will not recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunny316sa
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay the hotel. it is not worth the rooms. This does not qualify as a hotel. This would probably be a private house with room to spare. you have to pay extra if you want air conditioning in your room. They also charge you for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch customer service”
Reviews.Author: Marcia13
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms both were clean and modern. Breakfasts were continental with fresh fruit and fresh coffee not packaged. The best part of this hotel was the customer service. Someone was at the front desk 24hrs a day to assist with booking tours, answering any questions, and spoke English. The location was acceptable 15 min. walk to railstation. Loads of restaurants a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana in Rome Lazio, Italy”
Reviews.Author: gatorbug
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful stay at Hotel Giuliana!! Extremely clean and well kept rooms. The staff was unbelievably helpful with all my questions!! I would recommend this Hotel for anybody visiting Rome, especially if it is your first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TonyGlynn
Reviews.Content: Having been recommended this Hotel by a friend we checked out Trip Advisor Reviews and booked for 5 nights. This was a great decision as everyone was “spot on” and the Hotel definitely exceeded our expectations. Hotel Guiliana is ideally located just 10 minutes walk from Termini and 200 meters from Via Nazionale, with all it’s shops and restaurants. We felt very safe walking home in this area every night. We were made to feel so welcome by all the staff, who answered any queries and were more than happy to give us time and make suggestions about places to see. Our room was very spacious, comfortable and quiet. Each day started off with an excellent breakfast consisting of cereals, fruit, juices etc. served by the lovely Marilyn who always had a smile for us. This was our first visit to Rome. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it, not only because of it’s history but also because of where we stayed and the hospitality afforded to us by Jean, Marianna and everyone in Hotel Giuliana. Would definitely return to this Hotel without hesitation if we are ever fortunate enough to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mags01_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for three that was lovely. The accommodation was typically Italian and spotlessly clean. Jean was a fantastic host and looked after our every need. I would recommend this hotel to all friends and family. I hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with real customer service and nice clean accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Montreal-Couple-Ret
Reviews.Content: A very nice eleven room hotel that offers a great location, clean and comfortable rooms, and superior service at a very reasonable price, which is provided by both family and non-family members. They always went out of their way to answer all of our queries and to make excellent recommendations. Owners Jean and Luigi run a very fine establishment, and we will not hesitate to highly recommend it to all our relatives and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful English-speaking staff; comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: gailwallace
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here - it's less than 10 minutes from the train station and we were able to walk most everywhere. Our triple room was clean and nicely decorated with a large beautiful bathroom. Beds were on the small side but comfortable Excellent, helpful staff! Only problem we had was that a street fair began setting up outside at about 4:30am and it was very noisy. Next time I would ask for a room not on the street side. There was an excellent restaurant down the street - Cafe Strega, I believe. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: roxsheeba
Reviews.Content: We found Rome the hardest to select a hotel for, so many to chose from, so many differing reviews. We were not disappointed by Hotel Giuliana. The location is great, we walked to everything (including the Vatican), the rooms were not the biggest or best we stayed in on our trip but more than sufficient for our needs. One night we were disturbed by noise outside our window (they decided to redo the pedestrian crossing at 2am), when we mentioned it to the staff we were moved to a quieter room. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location where real Romans live, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_boomer_tripper
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Hotel Giuliana. The first time was in March 2007 and I was travelling by myself. This time I was with my wife. Choosing to return here should speak for itself. I remembered the proximity to the train station and the excellent service and help. In this case, returning was even better. This hotel is really half way between a B&B and a hotel. Giuliana is a beautiful and bustling 10 minute walk (with luggage) from the Termini station. As you enter from the street on the ground floor, you might wonder about your choice of place, but as you enter Hotel Giuliana on the 1st floor (2nd floor to North Americans) you enter into a personal, quiet, and very pleasant hotel. Since this hotel is family run, the feeling is more like a B&B. All the staff know you and all are eager to assist you in getting around Rome, making plans for the evening, and calling to research things on your behalf. The breakfasts are very good from a European perspective - a full continantal breakfast and then some. Most importantly, the cappuccinos, lattes, and espressos are first rate. We liked that fact that almost everything we wanted to do in Rome was just a 5 to 15 minute walk away. As well, we were in a location where real Romans lived. We liked the authenticity. We also liked the fact that we weren't in the hustling, over-crowded areas like the Spanish Steps or Trevi fountain. Great places to walk to, but I wouldn't want to be surrounded by that for my stay. Hotel Giuliana is also just around the corner from Rome's main opera house. We took advantage of this - and also took advantage of the very good and un-touristy restaurants in the vicinity. If you haven't been to Rome before, then you will definitely feel cared-for and well guided by the staff. If you have been to Rome before, then you will appreciate the feeling that this is your home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and really nice people”
Reviews.Author: fresque
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for three nights. Very well situated almost everything is in walking distance for most people. Very close to the coliseum. The staff were excellent and always in a good mood even with my stupid tourist questions,like why did Hitler occupy Rome and not the vatican, etc. The room was clean and totally adequate. (keep in mind it is a 3 star) The breakfast was good. The hotel was a bit tricky to find but it is an inexpensive ride from the train station. I want to thank the staff for making my stay in Rome so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly in better-than-expected location for exploring”
Reviews.Author: honestbernini
Reviews.Content: Five minutes walk from the central train stattion and within walking distance of all the main tourist attractions. The double room was small but clean and the staff (it's a family-run business owned by English speakers) couldn't have done more to make us feel welcome. They went out of their way to book tickets, give directions and recommend restaurants. The room is basic, but of you are visting Rome for the sights, the it's perfect and felt very secure (there was a safe). The hairdryer wasn't powerful so if you have long thick hair and are visting in the winter, you may want to bring your own dryer. A street market began setting up under our window about 7ish, but didn't bother us in the least. All in all a great place to stay for exploring the city, We are going to go back and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great localization and a very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: erikanahmias
Reviews.Content: This is a family hotel, it has a good price and it's very well located, close to Termini Station (about 10 minutes walking), Repubblica station and Cavour station, just behide Maggiore churche, in a walk distance from Colosseo, from Piazza Venezia and Piazza della Repubblica. The rooms are large (compered to the Europeans hotels) and clean, the shower stall is a bit tight, but the bathroom is nice. The best thing about the hotel staff. We were very well treated, Jean gave us great tips on places to eat and trips to other cities in Italy. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AndyandMarian
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay from the time we made the booking over the internet, they did all they could to make our stay as enjoyable as possible, the room was lovely and clean and the staff could not do enough for us throughout our stay. The location is ideal and was a great base for seeing the best of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great Rome mini hotel at an unbeatable price!”
Reviews.Author: NorthofVancouver
Reviews.Content: We found this lovely little hotel through tripadvisor. Marianna and her wonderful colleagues made our home in Rome feel absolutely great! They helped us choose restaurants, visit museums and to understand the local culture. The hotel location is excellent, and apart from a modest street entrance, our room and services compared favorably with the hotel where my nephew stayed for triple the price. Why not have more money left over for shopping and entertainment? We booked directly through their web site which resulted in more personalized service: http://www.hotelgiuliana.com/

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and considerate staff”
Reviews.Author: lu10
Reviews.Content: A little difficult to find at first - just follow the directions. Large door opens into a common area good for parking scooters. Stairs to right to reception. A lot of stairs. Elevator very small and slow. Staff very welcoming and nice hotel once you get to the top of the stairs. Rooms and bathroom very clean and adequate. We spent three nights and enjoyed breakfast area each morning. Able to use reception area computer to get boarding passes for return home. Easy to get back to Termini. Staff recommendations were great. We were advised not to use subway but staff recommended it over the bus system and staff gave the better recommendation. Staff provided great recommendations for dinner and mapped out our destinations. Trip out to the catacombs had to be by bus and staff gave us directions that got us there. Bus system is sketchy and drivers aren't helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, central & run by lovely family”
Reviews.Author: JudiMadrid
Reviews.Content: After searching for hours on Trip Advisor for a hotel in Rome I'd be going to with 2 other friends for the weekend, we finally went for Hotel Giuliana and weren't disappointed. It's VERY close to the Termini railway station (less than a 10 minute walk) and on the first floor of an oldish building. It's run by an English/Indian lady with her Italian husband and children, all of whom are delightful and extremely welcoming. We'd asked for 2 rooms (one twin & a single) to be near to each other which they were (right next door). The rooms had a safe, TV, were clean, even if the bathroom in the single was extremely small. The location is fantastic! You can walk everywhere, which of course is the best way to see Rome as there's history on every corner. The first night the owner recommended a lovely trattoria to have dinner which was literally just round the corner and very untouristy with excellent food. After that we went on to a bar within a 2 minute walk which had live music and good atmosphere and was still open at 2.30am. Breakfast in the morning was nice buffet style: choice of croissants, toast, yoghurt, fresh fruit, orange juice, tea and coffee. All in all a very good experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Leesi
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay a Hotel Giuliana. Great location, close to everything (we could walk to many of the major attractions). Extremely friendly & helpful staff, good air-con, didn't hear any noise at night time, markets right next door, good size room. Only down falls were that the shower was like showering under a hose, room is a little outdated, breakfast not great. Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the family”
Reviews.Author: wongster_au
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and this time we had a family room. walking distance to all the main sites and convenient to the Tremini and the bus terminus. Across the small park is The church of Santa Maria Maggiori, slightly to the right facing away from the front of the church down one of the lanes is a hidden gem. The church of Saint Prassede, hunt it down and be amazed, opens in the afternoon, excellent for quiet reflection in this busy city.

Reviews.Title: “You feel like you are staying with family.”
Reviews.Author: geoteter
Reviews.Content: We booked on the advise of fellow travelers on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. We arrived at the airport with a driver waiting (Jean set it up for us). Check in was easy. The room was simple, but had all the amenities one needs. Safe, Refrigerator, shower, TV. Frederico was so helpfut with all our needs. We always had directions, what bus to take, any advise and tourist info was readily available. What we loved most about this hotel is the people. After long talks with Jean, we realized that everyone here really wanted to make sure that their guests had a great time. We really can't say enough good things about the Hotel Giuliana. All we can say is, "If you are staying in Rome, this is the hotel for you'. You will feel welcomed and most of all, well cared for. Thank you Jean, Marianna, Antonio, Ashwin, Federico and Marilyn for showing us a great time in Rome. We will be back, hopefully this summer for our wedding. PS. The hotel is in a great location. The Termini Station is 5 min away as well as two other metro stops and a bus stop on the corner. Walking distance from most tourist sites. If you have any questions, please email me : geoteter@msn.com George Teter and Donna Capili

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargin”
Reviews.Author: L2KLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome for 5 days in January. Absolutely great staff with very clean rooms. The decor of the rooms were very basic with no extras. Hotel is about a 7 -10 minute walk to the train station. 15 minute walk gets you to the Forum area. Best to just walk everywhere. By the time you walk to the train station, take the train, and walk from the stop to say The Patheon or Piazza Navona, is is just as easy to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMannin
Reviews.Content: An excellent palce to stay when in the eternal city. A small family run Hotel which is welcoming and in one of the most convienent locations in Rome. The Rooms are very clean and spacious, with great bathroms, the hospitable staff are always freindly courteous and welcoming, making you feel you are staying in a special place. This Hotel also offers excellent value for money, especially considering the rooms and service. It will not disapoint, and i don't hessitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Colmoc1
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. The staff are unbelieveable, efficient, welcoming and helpful. Like many Italian city hotels, the rooms at the Giuliana are on the cozy side but that said the rooms are spotless and have everything that you would expect in a good hotel. The hotel is located very close to the main train station and is within walking distance of most of the major sights. Because it is slightly off the main tourist strip the restaurants nearby are good value good quality establishments and not the usual tourist traps. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Other hotels you are just a credit card, here you are a family member!”
Reviews.Author: JessAndFro
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Rome over the years. I must say that Hotel Giuliana exceeded all expectations. Many hotels just treat you as a credit card that checks in and out, Jean and her staff treated us like family. With a central location off of Via Cavour and near the train station, you can easily walk to any site in Rome or have a quick walk to the Metro. The rooms are very well sized, clean, and well appointed. The bathroom size was a pleasant suprise versus other bathrooms in Italy - a full bath with shower and plenty of counter space. The breakfast area was sunny and open and they accomodated extra requests like fresh lemon for tea. Any questions we had were quickly answered and helpful hints were shared. The restaurant recommendations were exemplary and provided wonderful hotels where locals eat versus just tourist spots. The staff was also quick to provide hints, little known sites to visit and were very knowledgeable about history and anecdotes. We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Guiliana and then traveled some before returning back to Rome for another 2 nights. The hotel graciously kept some of our luggage and arranged for us to return to the same room with our bags waiting for us, adding to the feeling of home. I would without a doubt stay here again and would recommend it to anyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - super location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cork53
Reviews.Content: Hotel Guiliana is a great hotel in a very central location near to the train station and within walking distance of all major attractions. I booked for for four nights, having read the reviews on Tripadvisor and wasn't disappointed. It was very clean and cosy and the staff really was exceptionally nice. Breakfast was good; plenty of cereal, toast, fruit and yoghurts and in the evening you can get tea and other drinks from the reception at a very good price. We really felt at home in this hotel and would definitely recommend it. Great hotel, great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Rimljanin
Reviews.Content: The hotel Giuliana is very nice and we enjoyed our stay very much. The room was nice, clean and well equipped (TV, refrigerator, electric kettle). The bathroom was also very clean, nicely decorated and spacey, with bathtub and bidet). The breakfast was very good (except if you expect eggs or ham, but everything else was there). Before we came, we read some bad reviews saying that the hotel was on noisy streets. However, it was not the case. Our room was above the smaller street, and there is indeed, like someone said at this site, a small open-air market that starts working very early, but with windows closed they are not loud and they cannot really wake you up. Some other rooms of the hotel are overlooking a bigger street, but it seemed that it was not very loud either. All in all, this is a nice hotel in the center (10-15 minutes walk from Colloseum), with a very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: MiriamBR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 10 minutes from the Termini Station on foot and quite near other subway stations, which makes it a good place to stay when arriving or departing by train, and a quite convenient location to start exploring the city. The rooms are not luxurious but quite comfortable, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is nice, with fresh fruit, cereals, bread, yoghurt, coffee, etc. The hotel is also close to Via Nazionale, a large shopping street, and there are plenty of small restaurants close by. Great cost-benefit relation, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: TrvlChik
Reviews.Content: It was my first solo trip and i couldnt have asked for a better start to it! Fantastic, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Room was clean and modest. Close to the main train/metro station. As a single female traveller, i felt completely safe venturing out at night.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: kel4691
Reviews.Content: The service and room is the best and very good location.good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: siccudrat
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on page 117 of the "Italy for Dummies" book 5th edition where it was assigned 2 dollar signs. Because we made use of the "Roma Pass" that bundles admission to 2 museums and unlimited use of Rome's public transportation system this hotel turned out to be a very Smart and Valuable place to stay! Rome has two subway (Metro) lines that form an "X" with Termini at the intersection of both. Most buses have stops at metro entrances clearly marked at the bus stops; so after a day of walking around you can catch almost any bus to get to the subway to get to your "Roma Home". This hotel is a 10 minute walk from Termini. The hotel management was educated in England and is absolutely charming! They are fluent in both Italian and English and staying there is more like staying at a favorite Aunt's house. The management suggested places to eat and provided knowledgeable directions. An enjoyable breakfast was served each morning to start the day off right. The modest rooms are clean, comfortable and smoke free, much like your favorite Aunt's. Enjoy your stay there and tell them that the Tarducci family said Hello!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary sservice in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sweden8Sweden
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally kind and helpful owners! Perfect location in the center. Friendly and cosy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “just a wonderful hotel to stay in. friendly family staff. could not do enough for you”
Reviews.Author: capecod45
Reviews.Content: small spotless hotel. family owned and operated. near train station, fine restaurants. quiet, and wondeful breakfat. family would sit and talk to you. were as helpful as they could be. wonderful capuccino. if you are in rome stay with them

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: truax58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel Giuliana in Rome. The location is about a15 minute walk to the bus and train station which is very convienent. Many sites are with in walking distance. Also many good restaurants close by. The staff at the hotel were amazing. So helpful and kind. They really made our stay enjoyable. They were installing new flat screen TVs in the rooms and lobby while we were there. Our room was small but ample. The hotel was kept very clean. Debbie and Steve Truax

Reviews.Title: “Great location... and that's it”
Reviews.Author: SilviadeBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Rome. The staff is nice, all right, but nothing to write home about. (We visited Florence and Venice after Rome and hotel staff members were just as nice.) I must say the room was too small to fit a double bed and 2 single beds. In fact, one of the beds was blocking the cupboard, so it was either sleep or unpack! We were not comfortable at all in the room. However, I think rooms are OK for a couple, and well, after all, you will not spend much time in your room when visiting Rome. The air conditioning was working properly, which is something to take into consideration if travelling in summer. Breakfast was OK and the coffee they serve was just excellent. I found the hotel a little bit on the expensive side considering it is a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bob1700
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and found this to be a very comfortable hotel with a great staff. The hotel is located just a few blocks away from the Roma Termini train station and convenient to good transportation. The hotel staff could not have been nicer! They even managed to get us last minute tickets to the Borghese Gallery! We would return to this hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “High rates for a good service...”
Reviews.Author: Italiano24
Reviews.Content: LOCATION 9/10 Conveniently located close to the Termini Station and in a safe area due to the presence of the local Interior Ministry Headquarter. RECEPTION 10/10 Very good service...this is their competitive advantage vs the usual Italian customer service approach. People are smiling and helpful. The atmosphere is relaxing. The staff speak English fluently. Possibility to leave the luggages for the last day of staying before going back to Termini station. ROOM 7.5/10 Very small but clean and nice. Some noisy from the outside due to the traffic or to the local market set up in Via Balbo (from 6-6.30 am)....so...to be avoided if you would like to sleep till late! Some TV channels are missed. BREAKFAST 7.5/10 Good breakfast for a nice start of the day. It is served till 9.30am only...it would be better to extend the time to 10.30am. PRICE 7/10 The price is extremely high, especially if compared to the local 3 star hotels. at the same price it is possible to find 4 star hotels in the downtown. On the other side the high rates help in maintaining a high class kind of customers.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Turtle04
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better hotel. The whole staff was friendly, helpful and just overall great. They answered all our questions both before our trip and during the trip, helped us book a tour, basically met every need we had. The location was a few blocks to public transportation which was very convenient. The rooms were quite comfortable. We had one triple and one double. If we ever get back to Rome, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Longmont
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days. Great, friendly staff on duty 24 hours with excellent English. Only 11 rooms so there is a very cosy atmosphere. Can wall (about 6 blocks) to the train station for both Italy and airport trains plus metro.. Breakfast simple but good -cereal, juice, coffee, yogurt, bagettes. We paid extra for airconditioned room and glad we did so. If windows have to be open, it would be very noisy from street traffic. Nice safe neighborhood and you can walk to many of the sites. Rooms simple and very clean. Staff let us use the one computer at the front desk for email check. Glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you are on a limited budget”
Reviews.Author: PeterMEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: If you want or need to stay near Termini for a few nights and don’t want to spend too much then I would say that this hotel is quite a good choice. Rooms are a reasonable size and clean, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a reasonable choice for breakfast and the coffee is excellent. The hotel is on the first floor of the building and the entrance at street level is not particularly attractive. You need to press a call bell for the outside door to be opened. The one thing that I would consider before booking is the traffic noise from the street outside. Via Depretis is a busy street and traffic noise is very noticeable well into the early hours of the morning. You will find it very difficult to sleep with the windows open. Closing them (they are double glazed and effective at cutting out the traffic noise) means that you will probably need the air conditioning. An extra 10 euros per night for a unit that itself is quite noisy. The hotel is on a street corner and the other street has a daily market in the morning. Stalls are set-up very early; 05:30 am. Another reason for sleeping with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaBaku
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful,small and very quite. The hostess is a very pleasant woman and that left a good impression about the hotel. Rooms are clean. Recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Location, Fantastic People, Unbeatable Price”
Reviews.Author: CaleNelson
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hotel Giuliana. The service was outstanding. They can arrange pretty much anything you need and always with a friendly smile. I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome. Mr. and Mrs. Nelson

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Totally Enjoyable Room, Friendly, and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: bmessina
Reviews.Content: • Clean and Enjoyable: The room was perfectly clean and everything worked. There was never a need to ask for anything; everything needed was provided. • Friendly: Every person on the staff was warm and helpful. Helped with tours, helped with directions. Hugs and kisses for returning guests (this was our second stay at this lovely hotel). • Centrally Located: Walking distance from the Termini; take the airport train to the Termini and walk to the hotel (no need for a limo). 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. 20 minute walk or less to many piazzas, the Colosseum and many other sites from antiquity, 5 minute walk to the Ciao Roma Hop on/Hop Off bus which gets you everywhere from the Vatican to the Borghese Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: cruzin42
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Hotel Giuliana due to the helpfulness of the staff, the proximity to Termini and the cleanliness of the rooms. Breakfast was included and they make great coffee. We have stayed near Termini before and been very unimpressed, but this time we enjoyed our stay and coming back to the hotel after a hard day site seeing was like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: catmouse56
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about my stay at Hotel Giuliana. I stayed for 6 nights during the hottest week in Rome, so the air conditioning was a godsend. The staff, Marianna, Antonio, the night front desk guys and especially the maid (I think her name was Mariella) were absolutly fabulous, very helpful and always pleasant. They made you feel right at home. The room was spotless, as was the bathroom and little the balcony outside for us smokers was an added bonus. So was the mini frig in the room. The close proximity to Termini, the Colosseum and Santa Maria Magiore was great . I would definately stay there again if I ever return to Rome and would absolutely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with no shortcuts taken.”
Reviews.Author: Megsimay
Reviews.Content: This is fabulous accomodation and great value for money in the centre of Rome. The staff are so friendly and you are made feel very welcome once you come in the door. I was in Rome for a total of 8 days. My boyfriend and I stayed at another hotel for the first 4 days and were not at all happy with it, so it was a joy to spend the second half of our holiday in a truly comfortable, clean and welcoming environment. If I return to rome (which I hope to do!) I will be checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and confortable”
Reviews.Author: MMPenchel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but confortable. The service is simple, people are friendly and acctually the hotel are run by the family. They gave us good orientation on how to go but were not over suggesting. They recommended a good restaurant nearby with good price. The rooms are not big but clean. Mornings we would hear some noise coming from the street market but nothing strong. Breakfast enough. Nothing particularly exagerate but again service was pretty good. If you carry big or many luggage be prepare for the stairs. They have an elevator, so it helps. But you never know..."machines". I strongly recommend the hotel. They were very supportive since our reservation. They answered many questions even before our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Alex, Nataly, Sergey and Tatyana.”
Reviews.Author: Alex_from_Israel
Reviews.Content: Very good location. The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and air-conditioned. We are very enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Badgerwife
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Giuliana after reading the fantastic reviews on this website, and weren't disappointed. The location was ideal for us, really close to the train station Termini and a 15-20 mins walk from most of Rome's main attractions. The rooms (we had 2 as we stopped for one night on our way back from the Amalfi Coast) were spacious and comfortable, and the air conditioning (at an extra £10 per night) was a godsend. The staff (Jean) were very friendly and welcoming and contributed to a relaxed experience. We nonetheless wouldn't give it 5 stars because the breakfast was basic and average (no fresh goods apart from fruit).

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to give it a 4”
Reviews.Author: Krak
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent location. The room is sufficient and the staff is adequate except for the breakfast waitress who was great. The problem is there was a terrible odor in the bathroom. It smelled like sewage all of the time and was very unpleasant. We asked for assistance, and I think they sprayed air freshener, but that was a very short term solution. Given the price and location, I would have given it a 4, but providing the fact that we couldn't breathe without wanting to puke means a 3 is generous.

Reviews.Title: “The location was excellent to see the sights and the staff was friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: OverTheRainbow09
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and very "family friendly." The staff was helpful and made us feel like we were "home away from home." The hotel was quaint, rooms were small, but adequate. Our stay included a breakfast with cereal, fruit, coffee, juice, and pastries which certainly saved us time and money when we were anxious to see the city. The location was perfect for walking, catching buses, cabs, etc. The best part was the friendly staff, especially the manager who gaves us directions, called for reservations, and greeted us every night with a smile and questions about our day. Great "first experience" for us in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit!”
Reviews.Author: BLUEKNIGHTNYPD
Reviews.Content: Our group of four found the Hotel Giuliana very warm and friendly. Each morning one of the staff: Jean, Marianna, Antonio, Ashwin, Federico and Marilyn meet our group and shared coffee, or expresso on the house in addition to other food. They were all very interested in our plans for the day and were very helpful with suggestions. The rooms were very clean and the hotel was centrally located near all attractions. The elevator remind us of a Cary Grant movie with it's open wire construction. Very charming and unique Highly recommend this fine hotel to one and all.

Reviews.Title: “The Giuliana has to be the best value for money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Athclare
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed just 2 nights in the Giuliana. We chose it for its location, price & good reviews and what a good choice we made. Luigi and his charming wife and daughter who both have better English than most english speakers I know, were so friendly and inviting, helping with travel advice and making us feel at home. Our room was small but adequate and scrupulously clean. The air conditioning is extra but essential in July. We made an interesting discovery as we were retiring on our last night, tucked behind a curtain was a well stocked fridge, mini bar. An early morning street market right below our window might be an annoyance to some, obviously outside the control of the hotel. The location is perfect if you're travelling by train or plane. We flew into Ciampino on Ryanair and a €4 bus ride drops you at the main station, Termini, which is less than a 10 minute walk away. Just up the street you can get the hop on, hop off open top Ciao Roma bus, the perfect way to see the sights. The area is nice and feels quite safe by night with lots of good value restaurants within an easy walk. If we visit Rome again we won't consider anywhere else. J. Darby, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “fantastic,great location,welcoming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smNam
Reviews.Content: staff very friendly always happy to help.hotel room was very clean and not too small.everything about the hotel and staff exceeded our expectations especially marianna who helped us even before we got there .centrally locacted for all sights.we would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.we had a fab time in rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TheLatinos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the centre of Rome very close to all the major sites! It is a warm and friendly family run hotel. They also have an intimate knowledge of the surrounding areas speaking both Italian and English. Would defniately stay again. Cosy atmosphere for breakfast which made us all feel quite at home. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we felt a sense of warmth and comfort during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “All we needed: extra-friendly service, location, city info, breakfast - the best of our Italy trip!”
Reviews.Author: GelatoOregon
Reviews.Content: Definitely our favorite hotel in our 2 week Italy trip! The English-speaking staff at the desk were available 24/7 and were extremely helpful, friendly, accommodating and very clear with their information. The hotel's location was close to the bus/train station and within walking distance of great shopping and wonderful historic sites. The quiet, comfortable rooms were air-conditioned, and the breakfast was very adequate. My daughters and I felt immediately welcomed and safe, and we plan to return next fall, and have already recommended this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “I am happy to say that Hotel Giuliana exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: sightseerConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana was wonderful from start to finish. After booking on line, I asked many email questions and received prompt answers. Mariana was so helpful and booked some tours for us that were at very good prices as well as arranging transportation to and from the airport, also at a ressonable price. This family run hotel provides exceptiona service and advic for the traveler, better than the concierge at an expensive hotel. The location is fabulous. Less than 10 minutes walk to Termini for bus and train. Also, less than 10 minutes walk to Piazza della Republica for bus and Metro. The person at the hotel desk could even tell us what bus line to take to get where we wanted and made a reservation at the Borghese museum for us. Just a block and a half away is Santa Maria Maggiore, a very beautiful basilica that should not be missed and right there you can get the Hop-on-hop-off bus to see the sights. So easy to find your way home, just take bus or Metro to Termini, everything goes to Termini. The room was lovely and clean. The bathroom was updated, with marble, and a real tub with a shower. My sister and I had twin beds and plenty of space in the room. I highly recommend the hotel and thanks to the family members and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Happy, friendly, helpful people made our stay very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: EuropeFan09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Guiliana in mid June and we were most happy with our choice. The hotel is not quite what one might expect, being situated on the second floor of the building. However the reception was friendly and our room was very pleasant and clean. When we arrived the lift was not working but it was fixed about 2 hours later and we were informed by telephone. The breakfasts and coffees were excellent and the 2 recommendations we had from the staff for dinner restaurants were both great also esp. Cafe Strega. We thought it might be a problem sleeping because of traffic noise but the double glazing kept us peaceful and the air conditioning kept us cool. The location is within easy walking distance of most of the wonderful sights of the Historical centre of Rome and the staff will help with tours, maps and guidance for buses etc should you wish to venture further afield. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location! ALL staff very friendly and helpful!!!”
Reviews.Author: CindyandSimon
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 4 nights here, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is on the second floor of a typically "romantic" Italian building which gives it real character! All of the staff were so pleasant and helpful, and all can speak English as well as Italian, which was a great help, especially when we wanted advice on local attractions and good restaurants etc etc. The rooms were immaculate and very comfortable, our room had a lovely Jacuzzi style shower. The hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk to the Spanish steps..which we visited in our first evening after going to a beautiful restaurant across the road from hotel . Overall a great base from which to explore Rome - Thanks very much!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: crossculture
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giuliana is an economical, family run establishment with a tight-knit staff - absolutely the kindest, sweetest, most helpful people we met in our three weeks in Europe. The temperature in Rome during our three days at the Giuliana was over 90 degrees, so the airconditioning in the room was welcomed. Room was small but impeccable.
