Breakfast (included) was standard high-carb hotel breakfast fare. For art/culture, close to Santa Maria Maggiore and the National Museum. For travelers, close to Termini Statione. Walkable to all sites in Rome. 5% discount when paying bill with cash. We highly recommend the Giuliana.

Reviews.Title: “A small city centre hotel of merit”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkInterrailer
Reviews.Content: An unhesitating recommendation for this small and excellently managed hotel close to the Termini Station. Especial thanks to Marianna, her mother and Antonio who run the place with flair, will give guidance on good places to eat, and will book tours around Rome. Its position near ritzy shops and the ancient sights of Rome is a strong attraction, although you must be prepared for walking in the city centre. There is a street market in the road adjacent to the side of the hotel and although our room overlooked this the double glazing is good enough to cut out the noise. Room sizes and fittings are standard for Europe, cleanliness good and service great. If you like the personal touch this takes some beating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: louiselouise2000
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time in Rome and a lot of it was because of the lovely staff at Hotel Giuliana. We were with our little one (16months) and nothing was too much trouble for them. It really made our trip special.

Reviews.Title: “I definately recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: soloFemaleDenver
Reviews.Content: I appreciated how nice they were and how willing they were to help me. I was able to check in early (they cleaned the room right after I arrived at 10:15 am, and gave me space to use to rearrange my bags while I waited), the breakfast was healthy and fairly substantial, and they told me where a great local grocery store was that was only 2 tiny blocks away (bottles of wine for less than $2, bars of chocolate for 60 cents). The room was small, but pretty standard for Europe. My room didn’t have AC, only a fan, but I was comfortable (some rooms do have AC, and I think I could have paid extra to get it?). It was very clean. It's an easy 5-8 minutes walk from the main train & bus station and the transfer point for the metro, and blocks from a few tourist sites. It would be a farther walk to other main Rome sights, but they are walkable or it would be easy enough to get to the metro and bus station, where most routes originate. Even as a single female, I felt safe walking in the area after dark and early morning.

Reviews.Title: “It is good, but”
Reviews.Author: coastal10
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at the Hotel Giuliana in May 2009 as we had gone to Rome to meet a cruise. The staff is friendly, helpful and speaks English well. The room was clean and things worked well including the air conditioning. Since it was hot this was quite welcome. The drawbacks were that our room was rather small. There was a wardrobe and two shelves, but really could not unpack. The bathroom also was small with no space to leave toothbrush. shave cream, etc. The breakfast was adequate but certainly basic. Would I go there again? Yes, but again only for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: willgothere
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than once and would highly recommend it if staying in Rome. It is in a great location close to the termini and within walking distance of attractions and restaurants. As in previous reviews, the best asset the hotel has are the staff. They are very friendly and will do everything they can to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. They are on hand to give you directions, recommendations, book taxis, everything. I think the breakfast could be improved by providing some fresh fruit and breads. The rooms are compact (similar to most hotels in Rome) but are clean and well appointed. Bathroom could have been a bit cleaner but was ok. Fresh towels and products every day. Overall good value for money considering the location and service

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: CrashTash
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough how friendly and helpful the staff were! They recommended 2 different restaurants for dinner, and both were excellent! The hotel is within walking distance to all the attractions we wanted to see - except for the Vatican which was only a short train ride away. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendy, great location”
Reviews.Author: njnoke
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of visiting Rome for 5 days. I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana and just loved it. It is a small, family owned and very friendly hotel in a good location. It is near Santa Maria Maggiore, the Termini and the Repubbilca Metro stop and the owners are wonderful, warm helpful and caring people. I was traveling with another woman and was concerned that we have a safe as well as convenient location and this hotel was just that. All of their recommendations for food, transportation and shopping were right on the mark. They were very accomadating in arranging anything we asked for as well as our transportation back to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and memorable”
Reviews.Author: anj101
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation to Rome and we were going on a recommendation of a friend for a hotel. The Hotel Giuliana and its staff were a perfect fit for this holiday. The room was very clean!! It was average sized but we spent all our time visiting the amazing Colliseum, Vatican, Trevi fountain etc. All of these were in close proximity to our hotel, some requiring more walking than others. We highly recommend the Hop On Hop Off bus tours. Our concern was being within close proximity to the termini for our trip to the airport. This termini is only a couple of blocks away. The cute outdoor market was in the street just up from our hotel. Right next door is a wonderful bar/cafe with great food and gelato. The vegetable pizza we discovered in Rome was delicious as well as the great house wines. The hotel has some of the best coffee ever!! The staff was excellent about providing an early breakfast for us before our excursions or tours. Can't wait to return to both Rome and Hotel Giuliana. Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Homely, & Informative Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hogan461
Reviews.Content: This hotel is family run. The staff went out of their way to assist with ensuring we found the best way of reaching the sights without any problems. They were extremely kind and informative with regards transport and needs. It is a small compact and spotlessly clean hotel . The only suggestion would be to have a kettle in the room in order to make a drink when you needed. It was a really pleasurable stay. Thank you to Marianna, Antonio and all the other staff for their care and assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest and Helpful Staff in Rome”
Reviews.Author: yorksramblingrose
Reviews.Content: We spent hours on the internet looking for a decent hotel near Termini Station in Rome and, eventually, saw this one recommended on Trip Advisor so we booked it. We weren't disappointed. The staff were lovely - they were friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms and bed linen were spotless and the breakfast was good. The price was also reasonable. It is in a good position as it's about a 10 minute walk to the station so you don't need to pay for a taxi. We would certainly stay here again if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: KMS910
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Giuliana at the end of April for 4 nights. We couldn't have been more pleased with our selection. Jean, her husband Luigi, daughter and the rest of the staff were some of the nicest people we came across in our travels. They made sure that our stay was as pleasant as could be, making sure that we had everything that we needed. Jean suggested several great restaurants (we even sat next to her one night at Melo!! a must if you stay here). The rooms were spotless and very comfortable. The breakfast was great and provided a great start to the day. No need to waste time searching for a spot to get coffee or something to eat in the morning because its right there. Centrally located to Termini and many of the major sights. The price point of this hotel won't brake the bank, especially if you are travelling from the States. I would highly recommend this hotel. Thanks to Jean and her staff for all their hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina_Travelbug
Reviews.Content: Jean and the entire staff at Hotel Giuliana are FANTASTIC! My first introduction to the wonderful hospitality was when Jean called me to confirm my room reservation over the phone, and we had a very pleasant conversation. She, along with the rest of the staff, were absolutely charming and helpful once we arrived. She recommended sites and restaurants and made dinner reservations for us while we were in Rome. The hotel itself is only about 6 blocks from Termini Station, easy walking distance, on a quieter side street. It is within walking distance of most of Rome's popular attractions (Colosseum, Forum, Trevi, Pantheon, etc.), and only a few minutes walk to the metro to get to the Vatican. Our room was large (by European standards) and very comfortable and clean, with a full-sized shower. We felt very happy there, very safe, and would DEFINITELY return. I highly recommend Hotel Giuliana: a great location, warm and helpful staff, and clean comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: ESF9FA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for touring Rome by foot. Walking distance to the Main Termini for the Eurorail and also to the subway. The staff was extremely helpful and hospitable, the rooms were big and clean with private bathrooms. Close to restaurants, laundromat, internet cafe...anything you could possibly need. Added bonus of a complimentary continental breakfast to get your day of sight-seeing started. Priced extremely reasonably, with a discount if you pay in cash instead of credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Good value choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon-SH
Reviews.Content: Jean and family will look after you like one of their own house guests. The hotel is clean, and the essentials of the compact rooms (bed, bathroom) are very good. The location is very convenient for sightseeing on foot. The one downside is that traffic noise is pretty bad (Roman traffic is awful) so try to get an inner room. We'd certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: sharmilav
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to all the highlights of Rome. We walked everywhere and took the metro to the vatican. There is a train directly from the airport to Roma Termini which is 5-7 minutes walk from this hotel. It was very convenient and we didn't need taxis. All the shopping places were also close by. The rooms are clean and the staff very considerate and accommodating. We got a lot of tourist tips and recommendations from the Reception (Antonio, Marianna and Jean). Overall we had a wonderful stay and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff fantastic...room a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Madbenjoel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position within walking distance to most major sights. It is also safe and the staff were quite friendly but I have to say, after reading the reviews prior to leaving, I had expected a little more personal warmth. Maybe just a victim of high expectations. The staff did provide good recommendations for eating and sights. The room was spotless but I was travelling with three children (16,14,10) and the four single beds in the room didn’t leave a lot of space. Kids loved the free wireless internet and the quaint lift from the ground floor. It would have been good for an organized happy hour so we could meet other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....shame about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GordonWorcester
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the comments which have been made about this hotel but not be quite so enthusiastic. Yes, the staff were reasonably friendly but no more than should be expected. I have stayed in many hotels across the world but would have to say that this was the worst breakfast I have ever had in a hotel. Although there were other wrapped items on offer I could not believe that was no fresh bread or rolls available...all that was on offer was thin sliced bread for toasting. I have never ever known any breakfast anywhere else in the world not to offer fresh bread. The hotel is situated in a very pleasant and convenient area, about a quarter of a mile from the station. If you are catching the airport train you need to allow another 10 minutes once you arrive at the station, to reach the correct platform. The sataion is hubge!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: lolliez
Reviews.Content: Myself & my family 11 of us stay here for 4 nights our welcome on arrival was amazing even tho we arrived before check in time they still had all our rooms ready & which we didnt expect, there was a nice selection of things for breakfast each morning, the rooms where spotless & serviced each day they had a nice balacony area but no view but the views from the rooms where nice there was views of the markets in must of the rooms we had booked & the Basicalla up the street. Location wise you couldnt ask for anything bettereverything was within walking distance & the termini was about a half a mile walk which isnt that far if u want to get Publinc transport from the airport to the hotel no need to get a taxi. Will be back again soon hopefully thanks for everyting while we where there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!! What a great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: AirDonkey
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for the first time with my girlfiend from 3/20-3/24 and cannot say enough about Hotel Giuliana. The room was spotless and friendly. Location was fantastic; 10 min walk to many sites including the Colosseum. Restaurants and bars a minute's walk away. Breakfast every morning was just right. It hit the spot and gave us a great start to each day. Next, the best part; the staff!! I apologize I don't remember names, but the gentleman originally from India was fantastic! He helped us multiple times by referring restaurants, booking tours, and mapping out walks around the city. The young lady originally from London was also amazing; booked our cab to the airport and was just a great person to converse with. I could not have felt more welcomed by anyone else! The breakfast lady was also very friendly and helpful. Hotel Guiliana was a great place to stay. It was nice coming back to the hotel and having it feel like home and just a few short days. I highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a warm, welcoming hotel in an excellent location in Rome. Thanks Hotel Guiliana from Colorado!

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean rooms and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateGb
Reviews.Content: stayed her in mid February and I have to say it was everything and more a "budget" hotel should be. Personally I like staying in nice hotels, but my wife who is more of a seasoned traveller found this little gem. The room was a good size, and clean, bed comfortable, bathroom spotless. Checking in was excellent, all the staff speak excellent English, recommended restuarants nearby which were superb (even saw the owners in there the same night we were !), loads of maps and advice. Cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean ,well positioned small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TorresN_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in Rome in early March 09 at the Hotel Giuliana. Don't be put off by the large exterior door or the 1940's lift when you enter the ground floor hall.The hotel is situated on the 2nd floor and Jean the owner makes you feel welcome immediately. Our bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean, the double glazing did allow some traffic noise, and on the Saturday and Monday we heard the street traders setting up their stalls at 6 am ( with the windows, shutters and curtains closed ) . Breakfast was included in the price and was sufficient, no frills, tea/coffee toast ,cereal, juice, fruit /yogurt. Well positioned for sightseeing , good restaurants near hotel, don't pay 18 euro for a taxi from the train station, its a short 10 min walk. Overall ,would recommend, and would happily visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CoAntrimUlsterman
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Rome, and booked Giuliana on strength of previous reviews. Ignore the somewhat unprepossing street entrance, accommodation is first rate for the price. About 5 years ago on last trip to Rome I spent more on a so-called hotel with rooms you couldn't swing the proverbial cat in, Very handy location, close to Termini, Santa Maria Maggiore (for the hop on/off tour buses) and the bus routes on Via Nazionale. Friendly owners, whose restaurant suggestions were spot on. Only 2 mistakes - first was booking through one of the agencies; go direct to the hotel for best rates. Second was ignoring the advice re walking from Termini station and getting ripped off by a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: H0LLYDAZE
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in Hotel Giuliana in February and could not praise the owners and staff highly enough for their excellent service. This family-run hotel is very well located, easily accessible on foot from the train station and provides a perfect base from which to explore Rome. The hotel reception is manned 24hours a day and all guests ring the doorbell to enter, therefore it is very secure. Having said that, the area seems to be very safe anyway. Rooms were spotless and beds were comfortable. Breakfasts were very good, consisting of cereals, juice, croissants, toast, fruit and yoghurts. The service could not have been better. Jean and her daughter Marianna were extremely helpful and went out of their way to help us plan and book our activities. On our last day, I was ill and despite us having already checked out, they went to the trouble of preparing a room for me to rest in before flying home and even telephoned the next day to ask if I was better! This hotel ticked all the boxes for us. In addition the staff's genuine warmth and friendliness made it the ideal place to stay. We will continue to recommend this to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: irelandTony
Reviews.Content: We truley enjoyed our stay at this hotel sitauted in a very nice location withing walking diatance from all the sites. The hotle staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay in Rome. would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Rome. Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Iaincar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in Rome and cannot fault the Hotel Giuliana. All the staff were very helpful, rooms were clean and well kept. Good breakfast each morning which was very much welcomed before exploring the city of foot. Location wise the Giuliana is perfect, 10 min walking from Tremini and within walking distance of all major tourist sites. Great restaurants close buy and a good Irish pub showing live sport just round the corner. All in all Giuliana ticks all the boxes for good value in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jessg
Reviews.Content: I wasnt reallyy expecting much as the price was so cheap but I was pleasantly suprised. The rooms were nice and clean decent size for European standards. The woman who is the owner I think was so nice and welcoming! It had a nice family feel to it. The location was great. Just around the corner to the train station where i got the hop on off bus tour. Quiet and safe as well. Nice places to eat around the hotel as well. Really enjoyed my stay and I will definately be going back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Dicey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and were not disappointed. The location is great - within walking distane of all of the main sights (tip: bring a comfy pair of shoes!). The room was spotless and had everything we required for our stay. It was very convenient to have breakfast at the hotel which comprised cereal, juice, toast, yogurts, fruit and pastries. Only negative is that some street noise (traffic) could be heard in the room - but a pair of earplugs easily sorted that out. For it's category, this is an excellent hotel and offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, lovely room and central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say HELLO to everyone at Hotel Giuliana. Thank you for the EXCELLENT service you provided and for making the 1st part of our trip through Italy unforgettable! They really do make you feel like family here. Our room and bathroom were roomy and decorated nicely. Breakfast was perfect for us. Close to everything. They set up our tours and transfer from the airport to the hotel which worked out perfectly. I would definitely suggest staying here as I will the next time we're in Rome. 5 star treatment for 3 star price....Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MJKToronto
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for exploring ancient Rome. Walked everywhere including to great restaurants. Biggest asset is the friendly helpful staff who treated me like a friend visiting from abroad. While not a luxury hotel it is excellent value for a trip where most of the time is spent sightseeing. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome recently, and found it was a lovely small hotel, with tidy clean rooms. The staff were friendly and welcoming and always available to help you with any matters. The breakfast was basic,but fresh and tasty. Overall, we had a very nice time and found this a good safe spot to explore Rome. I would not hesitate to recommend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly home from home”
Reviews.Author: glendalough
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for five days at the end of Jan 2009. It is situated about eight minutes walk from either metro line and about ten minutes walk from the main historical sites such as the Colesseum. It is situated on a quiet back street. We booked and paid for a standard room but were given a larger superior room on arrival as it was quiet (we didn't ask for this and were charged the lower price for a standard room). It was immaculately clean with useful facilities such as tea/coffee making facilities, a programmable safe in the wall, a wall-mounted hair dryer, TV and bath & shower. The towels and linen were changed regularly and the room cleaned every day. The hotel is maintained to a very high standard and rooms were being renovated during our stay, although it appeared to be painting etc which didn't disturb us in terms of noise. The hotel is run by a family, and at least one of them was present every day. They were most anxious that we were happy with everything and were more than helpful in terms of suggesting places to visit and local restaurants to go to. They were very happy to chat and answer all our questions about local life and customs. It was very good value for the location, standard of service and facilities. The personal attention in this small family-run hotel is what sets it apart from more commercial and larger hotels. We would definitely recommend it to friends and family and would definitely return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2783
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Giuliana before check in time and were pleased to be checked into our room straight away. We were slightly taken aback by a nasty smell but we opened the windows, unpacked and went out for the afternoon. The room was very small but nice and clean and the bathroom looked lovely, it just couldn't be entered due to the absolutely foul smell. We (laughably now) tried to mask the smell by purchasing some air freshener but unfortunately this did nothing but accentuate the pungent smell. We had to sleep wtih the windows wide open (middle of winter, noisy traffic) to try to get some respite but unfortunately had no sleep due to the street noise. In the morning we went to speak to the male staff member who looked embarrassed and then said he knew what it was and that he would get the maid to fix it. We were not staying in that hotel after our sleepless night and so asked if we could leave without being charged for the further two nights we had booked. He said we needed to speak to the female staff member and when she arrived, she said she could move us to a room that didn't smell! This made us both extremely angry as if she had an empty room that didn't smell, why would she put us in that one?! We declined her offer, although the room did not seem to have the same stench we were very upset and exhausted having had no sleep, and paid the cancellation of one night and got out of there! As we were leaving she informed us that nobody had ever complained before. Obviously a blatant lie given the other reviews on this site and the male staff member's reaction to our complaint. Extremely disappointing given that we had booked the hotel on the basis of reviews on this site and that this was the last hotel of our trip. Appalling that they would charge a cancellation fee as there is absolutely no way they should be letting that room to anybody. If you book this hotel, cross your fingers and hope that you get a non smelly room. And count on getting your breakfast elsewhere, it wasn't very nice either!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Lilisul
Reviews.Content: Great place, great people and service, excellent location, close to the station and most sites of interest, and easy for metro and bus use. Staff very helpfull and provides great tips for locations and restaurants. Rooms very clean, elevator to transport the luggage and good price for the rooms. We stayed for five nights. Only suggestion for improvement is to add some cheese and ham to cofee selection and extend wireless range to the rooms. Loved Rome and loved Giuliana!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nekecat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Guiliana for three nights while in Rome. The hotel is wonderful. Very clean, comfortable beds, easy to find, within walking distance to everything. Close enough to train station but not too close. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. They suggested a wonderful restaurant to eat dinner at. I highly recommend this hotel while visiting Rome. Prices were very good for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: TheBartons
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana was the first location for our honeymoon. The hospitality was wonderful. The staff went above and beyond their general duties to accomodate us. The rooms were always clean and the location was fantastic...we'd walk outside and around every corner was something on our list of landmarks to see. Without the lovely people at Hotel Giuliana, I'm sure our stay wouldn't have been as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: docnhisrn
Reviews.Content: Average hotel; great location near the train station. Clean, quiet, room with very helpful staff and an inviting breakfast. Helped with arranging tour packages and offered locations for dining. All staff spoke fluent English. Overall, pleasant stay and what we expected for two star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Indianazoe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana in Rome, Italy, is truly a home away from home. We have stayed at the Giuliana 3 times now. This time, we took our daughter and her family with us and they had a wonderful experience. We've just been home from our last trip to Rome and the Hotel Giuliana a little over 3 weeks and we are ready to return. Hotel Giuliana is conveniently located for site-seeing. It is near the main train station and 2 metro stations are within easy walking distance. We walked from the hotel to Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and Piazza Navona several times, in fact. The Giuliana is small, friendly, safe and cozy. The fine folks there go out of their way to make you feel at home and they are most accommodating. They continue to upgrade the Giuliana in order to serve their cliental better. We highly recommend you give them a try. George and Anita

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Hotel Giuliana!”
Reviews.Author: cdewaters
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Italy and stayed the Hotel Giuliana. The staff is so efficient and tend to your every need. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location of the Giuliana is so central. We loved the proximity to shopping, restaurants and sights! The morning breakfast was delicious! The service impeccable! Thank you for the incredible Italian experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service and very clean”
Reviews.Author: MM545
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Italy from Bombay, India and our overall hotel experience was the best in Italy. The hotel is family run and the quality of customer service is outstanding. The staff and hotel owners were extremely friendly and went out of the way to help us enjoy our trip. The breakfast was very good, the rooms were like new and I believe they renovate them every year. The bathrooms were excellent also. The location of the hotel is almost perfect located close to the Santa Maria Maggiore church and 10 minute walk from the main Rome station - Termini. The hotel is within walk able distance to the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely People”
Reviews.Author: Radsmatazz
Reviews.Content: As we walked in, we were met with a delightful old style elevator which led us to the tiny reception area. Our room was very comfy with all the amenities that we'd have wanted. After all that I'd heard about petty theft in Italy, it certainly was nice to be in a place where I felt my belongings were safe. But perhaps more importantly, the hotel was run by a lovely Italian family who were always friendly, accomodative and oh so helpful. The hotel's room rate seemed a tad high; but then again, my husband and I hail from a country where a five star hotel room goes for as low as USD 120!. Also, I'd have liked a hot breakfast of bacon and eggs, but then we knew going in that it'd be a continental breakfast. Overall though, we enjoyed our two nights at the Hotel Giuliana very much. It always felt nice to come back "home" after a long day of exploring Rome :-) Keep up the good work, Giuliana. All the very best to you!! (Darshan and Radhika; from Colombo, Sri Lanka)

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful, Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: pianista18
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find in Rome! This small hotel was truly a home away from home for me. The family that owns and operates it is kind and helpful, warm and friendly. They could not have been more gracious. The room was small, but so very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious, and the cappuccinos were amazing (all included). A perfect location to walk to the train station, opera house, and so many amazing sights. I stayed one night before I left on a cruise, and had booked another hotel for the two days follwing the cruise, but I was so taken with this hotel that I cancelled the other reservation and came back to Hotel Giuliana. I would definately recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “very helpful owners and staff”
Reviews.Author: mrsmag11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for four nights and found it a very convenient place to see all the main sights in Rome and all within walking distance.The owners and staff were very helpful and nothing was too much bother for them.Our room was spotlessly clean and the breakfasts were good --especially the coffee! There were also a number of very good restaurants within a few minutes walk.All in all we had a lovely break and would recommend The Giuliana without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: MaxWashington
Reviews.Content: Our groupf 10 recently stayed at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome. The Hotel is located within walking distance to many restaurants, transportation and sights.The rooms are very clean, nicely appointed and very reasonably priced for central Rome. The entire staff is friendly, courteous, always willing to be of assistance and made us feel at home. The staff could not do enough for us which far exceeded our expectations. It truly was our home away from home. Everyone in our group would go back to the Giuliana when in Rome. It was a memorable experience and I highly recommend the this little hotel in Rome, which is a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GenevaSwissmiss
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel vis a vis value for money. It is centrally located, very near to Santa Maria Maggiore, the Stanzione Termini and the Cavour Metro stop as well as being an easy walk to the majority of the major attractions. The hotel is on the first floor of an old apartment building and is very family oriented as well as being family run. Hats off to Gina, Mariana and Luigi who truly made our large group feel like one of the family. They helped us in every way imaginable, referring us to delectable restaurants, giving spot-on touristic advice as well as actually organizing tours for those who wanted that type of service. The rooms are pleasant, large , en-suite and include air-conditioning, satellite television, a hair dryer and a safe. Breakfast is included - the coffee is delicious - and it is of the fruit, pastries, bread, butter, cheese, yoghurt and cereal variety - more than adequate. The owners try very hard to make your stay a pleasant one and I think they have admirably succeeded. We would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and not great value”
Reviews.Author: birtleman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other locations in the same area but due to the ratings on Trip Advisor we tried this property. We were disappointed in that we think it is over rated and not great value for the area. We have stayed in the Sonya and the Hotel Opera Rome both are nicer, more modern, better breakfast and better value. This hotel is just okay and the breakfast is also just adequate. The value is not there. For example extra if you want A/C the travel from the Airport that they arrange is very expensive and the taxi driver said it was because of the kickback to the hotel. I think the rate was 65 eruos. Hotel Opera arrange a shuttle for 14 euros per person, The breakfast and room are superior and the price about the same. In general we felt that this property was just okay a little tired and over rated. Staff were great but we would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: goldtripper
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Giuliana after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and we were very happy with our choice. The location was perfect and was less than 10 minutes walk from the railway station. The hotel is walking distance to major tourist spots which is exactly what we wanted especially as we only had one night in Rome. Jean, the owner was so friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. She must be good to work for because all her staff were the same! Nothing was too much trouble for any of them and we were always greeted with a friendly smile. The room was great. A large comfortable bedroom, lovely ensuite ,and all spotlessly clean.The continental breakfast was very good too. We would have liked to stay longer. We unreservedly recommend Hotel Giuliana for your stay in Rome. Steve & Joan Gold Coast Australia

Reviews.Title: “a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: LizGlos
Reviews.Content: Recommended on this web site and booked accordingly. Owner could not have been more helpful with the booking processes and made us very very welcome. Great location for exploring Rome on foot. Thoroughly recommend this friendlty, family run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: dlb_08
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Giuliana based on all the positive Trip Advisor reviews we read...and we were not at all disappointed. The staff is warm, friendly and very helpful; the location is excellent; the hotel is very clean; breakfast is great. This was our first time to visit Rome and our stay at the Hotel Giuliana made a great vacation even better! We hope we can stay again in the future and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “a brilliant discovery”
Reviews.Author: PHRS
Reviews.Content: our third visit - a brilliant small hotel - perfect location - Jean her family and staff all so welcoming, and nothing is too much trouble for them to help to get the best out of your stay in such a special city. Rooms very comfortable and spotlessly clean. A simple but good breakfast. We will return again. JNCS & PHRS

Reviews.Title: “Second time”
Reviews.Author: Lingarth
Reviews.Content: Our second time at Guiliana, and we will stay again next time in Rome. Excellent location and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family run hotel with a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: paul pickburn
Reviews.Content: Friendly family run hotel with a warm welcome This is our third visit to the hotel Giuliana – it must be doing something right as we have no hesitation about recommending it to friends We returned confident of a warm welcome at hotel Giuliana which delivers the right mix of value and comfort – we were not disappointed Having just the one night in Rome on this visit, the hotel is perfectly located five minutes walk from to the station offering access to the airport and trains to around Italy and beyond The hotel is also in easy walking distance of all the main sights The hotel delivers an excellent breakfast in their small breakfast room The hotel has many family run restaurants within a few minutes walk offering a good food at reasonable prices Particularly recommended is the bar and coffee shop down stairs

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: travel_BR
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights in this lovely hotel. We were upgraded for free to a bigger room (I do not know what other rooms looked like, but ours was quite big with a big bathroom) We then came back for another night about a month later before flying home. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The lady who served breakfast remembered us and made us coffee every morning , we did not even have to ask. We left some luggage behind in the hotel while we went around Italy and it was kept for us until we came back. Hotel and rooms were very clean. The hotel is close to Termini, and to restaurants and pubs. We recommend this hotel, it was a pleasure to stay in it. We will definitely come back there again .

Reviews.Title: “Love the Owners -- Super Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Lizvt1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right near the Termini Station which is a big transportation hub! We took some guided tours of the forum which I would highly suggest and we also took a tour of Pompeii/Naples and the tour bus company came to pick us up from the hotel to take us to their headquaters which made it very easy to do extra things and still get back to the hotel without worry. The owners of the hotel were a Mother Daughter team that made sure we were doing well and would ask everyday if they could do anything for us. We really loved them because that made it feel like home to us. They also made the BEST cappuccino and the hotel is located near this cute little pizza place that was super sweet plus had great pizza/wine!! My Husband and I really really loved the location, the friendly staff, and NO WORRIES!!! :) I would highly suggest staying here and when we go back to Rome we will stay here again too! They speak great English and are always willing to help you!! :) Enjoy! E&C B :D

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely friendly and very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: gjspg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent a week in Rome staying at the Giuliana. Choosing this hotel was the best piece of planning we have ever done. It is family owned and run and every member of the family makes it their business to ensure your stay with them is enjoyed to the full. The middle of the trip was planned to coincide with a "major" birthday of my wife and on returning back to our room on that afternoon Jean the owner and her daughter Marianna had placed a tray and a bottle of wine in our room, a very kind and thoughtful gesture. I can confirm the other posted comments regarding its location, it is an easy walk even with a suitcase from Termini Station and close enough to walk to most main sites. The Vatican we travelled to by metro from Termini to Ottaviano station, it's an easy walk from there. Late September proved to be an excellent time to visit Rome but quite honestly you will enjoy it at any time. We spent seven days there which is a long time for a city stay but it gave us ample time to see most of Rome with some of the sites visited a second time to get a better understanding. We never felt threatened even at night, I know some people are worried about this aspect of city visits but just be sensible and walk where you see the locals and other tourists and you will be ok. You can eat really well at a reasonable price if you seek out the restaurants and trattorias the locals use. Any one of the excellent staff you meet at the reception desk will be only to pleased to give you really good advice about this and anything else. There will be no searching for a hotel for our next visit, I will just contact the Giuliana direct. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: Cooljewel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a total of three nights, and would stay here again if returning to Rome. The location was very convenient (lots of restaurants within walking distance, and Roman Forum/Colisseum a twenty minute walk away). The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and also spoke perfect English. They even went as far as giving directions or advice on any popular sites, and gave out maps to help out. The complimentary breakfast was fairly basic but very tasty, with juice, cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit and pastries, cheese, and coffee/tea made to order. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The place had a quiet family-run feel, almost like a bed and breakfast. Overall, this hotel was excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: Beezle18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Giuliana for four nights, and found it a perfect place for a city break in Rome. An easy 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and Forum, a couple of good restaurants and several great gelaterias a 5 minute walk away. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our twin room was small but clean and had everything we wanted, including a mini fridge. All in all a good, unhassled stay, and a great base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “So welcoming, great hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: carlita1uk
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk from the Termini in Rome. An art deco style hotel, very clean, modern room. Amazing staff, all so friendly and helpful. We are most certainly going back with our daughter next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I returned to Hotel Giuliana for the second time this year, and was welcomed back with absolutely fantastic hospitality. As someone who consistently and often stays at many five- and four-start hotels, I can assure you that very few can match Giuliana's excellence in customer service. Antonio is absolutely unmatched, he is the most fantastic hotel host one can ever dream of; Jean and Marianna are also consistently excellent, so is the rest of the staff. They make you feel like you are truly a valuable guest, and it's sincere. Giuliana is such a great hotel that it enhances the greatness of Rome, and its warmth is just another reason to go back to Rome. Giuliana is at a great location, close to Piazza della Reppubllica and close enough to Termini. On my next trip to Rome, hoping it happens soon, I do plan to return to Giuliana. I have been raving about Giuliana to all my friends and family, and am willing to recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: flossybun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giuliana for a special occasion and could not have been happier, we loved the hotel. The location is great, within walking distance of so much that Rome has to offer. At the end of the road on which the hotel is located, is the beautiful Chiesa di Santa Maria Maggiore (a useful landmark to head back towards to find the hotel again when you are new in Rome). The room was very comfortable, and the A/C unit provided cooling respite from the July heat in Rome - we had fabulous hot sunny weather throughout our stay, so explored most of the morning and came back to the hotel for a nap and to cool down before heading out again! The hotel staff are all so welcoming and friendly, always cheerful and greeting you as you come and go, and happy to advise on questions you have, or to recommend places to eat or visit, and they always go the extra mile to make your stay special. In my case I requested something for the room for the special occasion and they had this all ready when we arrived - great service. If your Italian is rusty or you don't have much knowledge at all, the staff here all speak English well. This is a lovely little hotel where you are made to feel at home. Breakfast is a selection of fruit, yoghurts, bread, croissants and cereals, juice and tea and coffee, just enough to get you started for a day of sightseeing. A couple of recommended places for food, That's Amore, almost opposite the hotel, very handy if you don't want to go out too far in the evening, and Otello on Via Della Croce near the Piazza di Spagna. We enjoyed strolling to Fontane di Trevi and Piazza di Spagna in the evening, about ten minutes walk or a bit more if you're strolling very slowly!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana Rome, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gerrymittel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana, home away from home. We stayed here five years ago, enjoyed our stay then, so returned this year. Location is great. Walking distance to train station and Ancient Rome. Trattoria's near by serve yummy Italian food. We used Santa Marie Maggorie as our landmark, as hotel is just a block from church. The staff at Giulinana are great. They are all very helpful booking tours and helping us find important sites to see. All have become family to us, especially Antonio. We hope to return soon. Would not think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service ever”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough great things about Hotel Giuliana and it's accommodating staff. We brought our daughter, age 5, with us, so we wanted a hotel in a stellar location. Hotel Giuliana is very centrally located and in a very safe neighborhood. There are wonderful restaurants very nearby and there are 2 gelato shops, one next door and one attached to a bar around the corner. We had to change our date of arrival because our daughter unexpectedly needed hospitalization, so Jean and Marianna worked with us to either hold a room at Giuliana or find a room for us elsewhere if they had no cancellations. Luckily, soon after we arrived a room became available and it was fantastic. After being in a Roman hospital for a week, admittedly anywhere would have felt like a palace. But the spacious (for Rome!), clean room adorned with lavish marble and a grand lavatory was luxurious. Breakfast was perfect, cereal, yogurt, cheese, croissants, juice, etc. Another plus is that there is a tour company down the street from the hotel. Normally we would tour the city on our own, but with our daughter we decided it best to take a tour. Since she wasn't feeling to par, we took the Ciao Roma bus tour which has a flexible schedule, as you can jump on/off the bus as you please. It was perfect. Can't say enough about how gracious and accommodating the staff at Giuliana was for us. A wonderful stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “You need look no further!”
Reviews.Author: TigerJim007
Reviews.Content: In May of this year we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome. We are two married couples in our 50's and could not have been more please with our selection. First of all the staff was outstanding. Though we were a little early they checked us in right away. The rooms located on the second floor were perfect. They were on the street side but still pretty quiet because of good windows and excellent A/C. The bathroom was good size and modern. The location is a short walk from the Termini and the bus stops are close by. We could easily walk to the Spanish Steps and the Coloseum. There was a Tabachi shop, good restaurants, gelateria and a couple of bars within a hundred feet of so. Breakfast was modest but good. When I reserved the rooms I used Trip Advisor as my primary reference. I used Rick Steves guide book (the traveler's bible) for all of our other accommodations in Venice, Florence and Monterosso, CT. The Hotel Giuliana was not in the 2007 book but it read so well I took a chance. I'm told the Hotel made the 2008 edition. Look no further if you want a nice friendly place that is competitively priced with good rooms and location. WHEN we go back we will be staying at the Hotel Giuliana!!! Jim, Paula, Sandy and Tom from Massachusetts, USA. btw. We backpacked and used the excellent train system a la Rick Steves! The only way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: luciejason
Reviews.Content: It is not hard to write a review when it comes to this hotel. The hotel and staff are amazing. We arrived early at the hotel, around 8am, yet our room was ready and the Manager (Marianna) was very accomodating and allowed us to check in early. We were is desperate need of a good rest after travelling over 20 hours on the plane from Australia. The rooms are excellent value for money, the location is exceptional (everything is walking distance - including the Colosseum, The Pantheon and the gorgeous Trevi Foutain), and you feel like you are at home. The hotel has someone at the front desk 24 hours a day and the staff are extremely generous with their time and hospitality. My wife and I will stay there next time we visit Rome and all I can is "thank-you to both Marianna and Jean for such a wonderful stay". "It was like a home a way from home."

Reviews.Title: “Great location at Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: susanj1310
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this gem , location, hospitality and value for money is what Hotel Giuliana is all about. The owner and her husband are amazing hosts in fact I don't think you could get any better service or value for money in Rome. The room was spotless, was serviced all three days we were there. The rooms are small and the bathroom was tiny so a bit of advice - if you are above average sized person, stay away from room 16. We were told there are a couple of family rooms that are bigger so if you stay here, ask about them.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoppit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for five nights in late-May 2008. It is a wonderful hotel two blocks from the Santa Maria Maggiore church with a lobby, breakfast area and 11 guest rooms on the first (not ground) floor. The breakfast buffet was fresh, tasty and on par with the other Italy hotels we stayed at. Our room, #16, was moderately sized, comfortable and faced an alley off the main street. While we are early risers and not easily disturbed, the alley is used for a morning flea market that starts setting up a dawn. Amenities included two comfortable single beds pushed together to form a double, a safe, wall mounted 13” TV and refrigerator. The bathroom was small, but easily accessible, though the shower was somewhat uncomfortable and the water pressure was marginal. Free internet was available in the lobby. Note, the room has a system that shuts off the power upon exit, so be careful with any battery charging. Jean, Ashwin and Marianne were charming and knowledgeable hosts, providing everything from touring information to restaurant recommendations with ease. While dining is very subjective, we thoroughly enjoyed the two that Jean recommended: Antioca Boheme and Tratoria Melo. In summary, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Giuliana and would not hesitate to return. It is in a very good location, quiet, well maintained and an excellent value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana, Roma, Italia”
Reviews.Author: Gemini2205
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my family for a mid-week break in early April 2008. The accommodation at Hotel Giuliana was very comfortable and good value for money, with breakfast included in the price. The hotel is located within easy walking distance (five to twenty minutes) of the city's major sites. The family that run the hotel are extremely friendly and went out of their way to be as helpful as possible. The next time we travel to Rome, we will definitely look to stay at Hotel Giuliana once again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jp3Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in June with 2 children ages 4 and 6. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful and as everyone has noted perfect English. Beds were comfortable and bathroom large. Very close to the Termini as well as within walking distance to many other sights. Would return if the price is right. Notes: *Got the best price contacting the hotel directly by email. *avoid room #2...we were booked there, it is located right behind the desk and we could hear noise all night... *great food from a restaurant "Bohemia" located right behind hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: iceqween
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. 9 girls. So we had 3 triple rooms. Rooms are adequate in size and very clean. The hotel is located close to the Termini Station and Bus Tours. Great restaurants just across the street too! Within easy walking distance of the Colesseum, which is a must for any visitor to Rome. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and very helpful. Brilliant english. Recommending restaurants, trips and really making you feel at home. We arranged a taxi transfer to and from the airport through the hotel. Comforting especially when you arrive at night in an unknown city. I would definately recommend this hotel and would return to it without hestitation. Small family run hotel and they will do everything they can to make your stay the best possible. Heather & girls Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fab”
Reviews.Author: Tashkah
Reviews.Content: This my first trip to Rome with my 2 sisters the hotel is great we received the best service ever. The location is central , the most convenient for all sights visits, all walking distance fromthe hotel except the Vatican which we had to use the Metro. The staff were great we couldn't have asked for more! If you really want to experience Rome and all the sights this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A magical experience”
Reviews.Author: joe4anne
Reviews.Content: Our party of four have just returned from a week at the Hotel Giuliana where we had a wonderful time.The location of the hotel is excellent and only a short walk from termini train station.Our rooms were spotlessly clean.Our towels were changed every day and our bedlinen on at least three occasions. We have previously stayed at 5 star hotels in Rome and did not recieve such wonderful service. The staff and management were extremely helpful and friendly. They treated us as friends.Breakfast was great each day with plenty to choose from. I would definately reccomend a stay at the hotel. Although the hotel only has 2 stars, you will enjoy a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful expierence”
Reviews.Author: LEK007
Reviews.Content: We really can't say enough good things about this hotel! Our travel agent booked this hotel because we were looking for a nice hotel on a limited EURO budget. We were only in Rome for three nights after spending ten days in the Sorrento area so, budget was a main concern. We were prepared that due to the price this hotel it may be below standards; were we EVER wrong. Charming, extremely clean and the room size for Rome at this budget was very comfortable. We had a double room, an A/C unit ,which was welcome to the stickiness of the humid weather, and an appropriate, comfortable shower area. The best part of this hotel was the service. The staff speaks excellent English and literally, went out of thier way to help us at every turn. I was having trouble using the TIM cards for our cell phone and could not understand the vocal instruction in Italian. The charming lady at the desk also had trouble and suggested we ask the night clerk when we got back in later that night. All of this after she offered us to use their phone to call the States when I had told her I was trying to check in on a family member. I declined the request because it wasn't an emergency but when we returned back to the hotel at midnight, the kind gentleman had been informed we might need help with the phone and he took ten minutes to fix the situation. Night after night they were there with a solution or suggestion. It was three or four blocks from the Metro which is unique since most of Rome is not connected to Metro stops. A big plus at the end of the day. We absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who has high standards for service and is facing the Euro crunch. We stayed in a more expensive hotel in Naples and it was a pit. You have to be very careful with hotels in this price range and quite frankly, if you are only in Rome for a few days, save the money and book here no matter what your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel; great location and the most attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Godoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giuliana Hotel for four nights in May 2008. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The staff as so attentive and go out of their way to help but in a non intrusive way. The breakfasts are good- freshly prepared. The location is excellent for getting around Rome - about 15 minutes walk to Colisiun and about 5 mins to the metro central station. We had a wonderful stay and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RamblingOne
Reviews.Content: We (couple) stayed at this hotel on the May Bank holiday weekend for 5 nights. The location is excellent and very easy to get to from Termini station. In fact the hotel emailed us very good direction when they confirmed our booking. The hotel is on the first floor of a large building with a ground floor door at street level that you buzz for entry. This was never a problem irrespective of what time of day or night we arrived back. The room we had was spotless, and kept that way for the duration of our stay. The price included a continental breakfast (juice, cereal, coffee, toast) that would get you started for the day. All the hotel staff (incl the owner) we met were very helpful and spoke excellent english. They were very good to book restaurants for us once we gave them phonenumbers to ring. We are happy to stay there again, and recommend it to anyone. Great area, near restaurants, walking distance of Termini for metro or bus to anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: LoneRock
Reviews.Content: Our introduction to Rome was the Hotel Giuliana which we found to be modern and comfortable. Our stay included three days at the beginning of our trip and one at the end. What made both stays memorable, however, was the staff, who were each warm and helpful to the point of treating us like old friends or family. We will return to Rome with our own friends and family and can't imagine staying anywhere else but at the Giuliana.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carolw
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in late March and used Trip Advisor to find a good hotel. We can only echo everyone else's recommendations. Great location, friendly staff, room small but adequate and everything very clean. All good - will recommend it to anyone who wants somewhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Jeaniusann
Reviews.Content: I was referred to Hotel Giuliana by my friends Fabiola and Pina from Hotel Paba when no room was available there for March 17-19. I appreciated the recommendation. The location was ideal for my 2 girlfriends and me. No need for a taxi from the train station, since it was an easy walk. The owner and staff were incredible, always pleasant and helpful. Our room had 2 twin beds and a roll-away bed. The roll-away had a thin mattress, but we solved that by removing the mattress from a second stored roll-away in our room and laying it on top. That made a world of difference. Breakfast was provided in the cozy little bar/breakfast room, with made-to-order esspresso/cappucino, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt and breads. At departure time, one of the staff was even at the front desk at 4:00 a.m. to make sure we caught our taxi on time. It was all good! Jean -- Canton OH -- USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Deeterbug
Reviews.Content: After reading great reviews on Trip Advisor about the Hotel Giuliana in Rome, we booked a post-cruise stay there. The staff was amazing. Each person we dealt with was very friendly and very helpful. They called to book for us an opera performance at a church right around the corner from the hotel. They perused maps with us. They always had a welcome and a smile for us. Our room was not as small as you usually get at small European hotels. It was immaculately clean. It was also very quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. The location was terrific. We walked with our luggage from the train station to the hotel in about 10 minutes. The closeness to the train station was a real bonus on the morning we left because we didn't have to deal with a taxi, we just went straight to the train station to catch the Leonardo Express to the airport. The hotel was only two blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore. The street was quiet and we had no worries about crime in that area. All in all, we were very pleased with the Hotel Giuliana and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: malbualt
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, easy walk from terminii station. Small, very clean hotel. Staff are all very pleasant and helpful. They recommended a very good italian restaurant nearby that served great italian food and wine. Nearby are other pizzarias and bars. Would definately stay here again. Ideal location for seeing the sights of Rome. MM

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ex-miner
Reviews.Content: Got back frome Rome on 3 days ago (13/3/08) and actually miss this hotel, it was better than being at home! The friendliest staff ever, wonderfully situated, I could go on. I have never even thought of writing a review of the many hotels I stay in but this place is the best - if all hotels were like this I would never go home! I was there with my daughter and grandaughter who both loved it too, now they want me to take them back - just when I am perfecting the art of travelling alone!

Reviews.Title: “A very clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Married2ACoffeeLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The lobby staff were amazing in helping us find local attractions. They were all proficient in several languages, including English (very important to us!). The owners, Jean and Luigi, are SO friendly. They really make you feel like family. The hotel is located within blocks of major attractions, in downtown Rome. Near the hotel are some awesome restaurants. In the evening we would just walk around the corner and be at a very nice restaurant. We had a small refrigerator in our room. We also had A/C! We stayed at two other hotels previous to this one and neither had A/C or a refrigerator. The room was VERY clean! Every day the maid came and cleaned our room. When we'd come home exhausted from a day of walking, it always felt inviting to see the room all clean and straightened. Even during the night someone was always there if you needed something. We didn't experience any problems with noise from other guests, and we didn't hear any road noise. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone who want a hassle free vacation, with nothing but lots of good memories!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this small family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanthompson14
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a small friendly hotel inRome this is the place to go. The Giuliana is a family run hotel ,all the family speak English and do thier upmost to make your stay enjoyable,nothing was to much trouble. The rooms are cleaned everyday and clean towels everyday which was a bonus The hotel is situated within walking distance of all the main sights great location and there are plenty of good resturants, bars and snack bars near by what ever you fancy.We will definatley go back to the Giuliana

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Price”
Reviews.Author: VizziOne
Reviews.Content: We needed a a place to stay near the train station in rome, The owners really do a great job. The rooms for the price are fantastic. I paid 72 euro . If your a student or need to stay near the train station this place is the best. Less than 8 minute walk to station. If money is really tight this is the one. I was there for one nigtht.Verry clean lots of hot water

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: KevinMeyer
Reviews.Content: Very practical, Metro & Bus at 5 mn by foot. Just on the via Nazionale, main commercial street. Rooms are small but OK and clean Receptionnist and service was perfect, as their advices

Reviews.Title: “Superb Family run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeNottingham
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 4 nights for our wedding anniversary and loved the place, we will be returning next year!. The staff were all very accomodating, very polite and helpful, they made you feel part of the family. Jean, who is a lovely lady, arranged flowers in our room as a suprise for my wife which she appreciated!. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, offering help to get to attractions and advising places to eat. The room was spacious and very clean, breakfast was great. There were croissants, yoghurts, fruit, cereals and you could have fresh coffee or tea. The location of the Hotel was good as well, 15-20 minute walk to Colesseum, Roman Forum and Trevi fountain. I would say this has been a great place to stay and as mentioned earlier we will be going back. M Warren - Nottingham UK

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kgkillen
Reviews.Content: Very clean with extremely friendly staff. Good size room, with huge bathroom (especially by Euopean standards). Within walking distance of the major attractions and the Termini station. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and clean”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: This was a centrally located hotel, just a 10 minute walk from Termini station. It is a doorway on a street of shops which you need to buzz to be let in and the hotel is located on the second floor. There's an old elevator for those less mobile. The room was adequately sized for 2 people by European standards. I liked that the floor was tiled - you could see it was clean. The bathroom was small and clean. Our bed was a bit too firm - I felt like I was sleeping on a tabletop. If this is a concern, you might want to ask about your choice of beds before booking. The room had air conditioning/heating and a TV. There were 2 English-speaking channels on it. We could walk anywhere from this hotel - 20 minute walk south took us to the ancient ruins like the Coloseum and 15 minutes walk north-ish took us right into the downtown area. It is on a quieter street off Via Cavour (the main road that takes you to the ruins). Via Cavour has several restaurants, cafes and hotels on it, basically a tourist area, which I felt was quite safe at night. Some restaurants were a bit overpriced though. Staff were helpful and polite and were fluent English speakers. I noticed someone on the front desk after midnight - not sure if it is manned all night but as you can't get in without being buzzed through, be sure to check if planning a late night. All in all, a good, clean, functional hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: Saggas
Reviews.Content: My sisters, my brother and I spent five nights at Hotel Giuliana. It was our first visit to Rome and weren't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is a 15 mins walk from Termini, on a very nice, somewhat busy, street. But, we didn't always have to walk to Termini to get a bus. Five minute walk to Via Cavour, nr Santa Maria Maggiore, and one could catch a bus. You could also walk further to the train (underground)station. The hotel is about a 15-20mins walk to the Forum and Colisseum. It is in a very good location. The rooms are small, typical European rooms. They are very clean. We were two persons per room and there was enough space to get around. Towels are changed every day. The breakfast, which is included in the price, is quite good. The gem of this hotel is its staff (Marianna, Antonio, and Ashwin) and service. They are very polite and charming. They speak very good English. They bend over backwards to make your stay comfortable. I highly recommend this B&B to anyone visiting Rome. You will not be disappointed. On my next visit I will be staying at the Hotel Giuliana.

Reviews.Title: “The true Rome feeling!”
Reviews.Author: lost-cape-bretoner
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking, warm, family oriented, clean, reasonable and quaint. That just about sums up our stay in this hotel. I met my husband in Rome who was serving in Afghanistan, after not seeing one another for the better part of 3 months, I booked this hotel for our reunion. What a great choice! It was clean, well located and the staff was amazing. Rosa....I miss your cappachinos!!!! Breakfast on the small balchony, made for an amzing first morning in Rome. The flowers were beautiful, and the people here were so helpful. The rooms were small, but we really didn't spend much time in the room, as we took in all the sights Rome has to offer. The location was indeed the best. The subway is within walking distance, as well as many other sights. Thats Amore restrauant just up the street from the hotel was awesome! I crave thier pasta and Rosa's cappachino....*sigh* If you are looking for a welcoming, friendly, clean, well located hotel.....this is the one for you! You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: NicB70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giuliana for five nights in March 2007. My parents were in one room, and I was in another with my two kids (and my husband joined me midweek.) Both rooms were what you'd expect in a typical European B&B or family-run hotel. My parents room was pretty small, but had a queen bed, desk, nightstands and television. Their bathroom was rather small. The room overlooked a daily market. Though I was afraid they'd hate the noise, the market is completely closed and quiet at night. It did get going early, but my parents are early risers on vacation, so the setup noise didn't bother them at all. My room was larger...a double bed and two twin beds, a desk, two nightstands, and a television..though the fit was tight. There wasn't much room to walk around. However, I had and very large bathroom, which was a pleasant surprise. The bath/shower combo was such that water got on the floor if you weren't careful, but I think that's pretty typical. I just used an extra towel to handle it. Our room overlooked a courtyard and was much quieter than my parents' room. The curtains in both rooms were such that you could make the rooms VERY dark for sleeping if you wanted. The rooms were kept very clean, and the staff was absolutely wonderful. They'd ask where you were heading for the day, and offered to call ahead to check hours or tours for you. They'd ask if you needed walking directions, metro directions, or a cab, and would call a cab immediately if you wanted one. The Rome Marathon was taking place while we were there, and they had great suggestions for avoiding traffic and closed restaurants, etc. If it looked like rain, they'd even offer umbrellas. They were always smiling and friendly and happy to answer questions. If you want some snacks in your room, they can give you walking directions to a grocery store and a quickie mart that are both easy to reach. My dad and I had a blast exploring the grocery store. The staff was also happy to direct you to local restaurants that were "non-touristy." We had some very good meals this way. Breakfast was a real pleasure each day. They'd make you fresh cappuccino that was to die for, and there was a great selection of fresh fruit , yogurt, and breads. My kids can get picky about breakfast and they were quite happy with the selection. My parents were also happy with breakfast. I've stayed in many other hotels in Rome...even the St. Regis Grand and the Grand Hotel Parco Dei Principi...so I can be a hotel snob. Those are where you stay if you want luxe. However, if you want a great price, a basic but clean room, and amazing service in a location that's VERY convenient to all the sites, then stay at the Giuliana. I'd absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: nycboundga
Reviews.Content: I had the time of my life on my vaction in Rome, and I owe it all to the hotel and the hotel staff. The room was small, but cozy and very clean. Besides, size doesn't matter, because all you should need your room for in the city of Rome is sleeping! The Giuliana has a breakfast nook that my dad and I ate in each morning. The food and coffee were great there, and it was nice to have a meal in Rome without coughing up 60 euro afterwards! A huge advantage this hotel has over others is its location. It is located very close to the train station, and all the Roman landmarks are easily within walking distance. In fact, my dad and I would walk past the pantheon, Coloseum, and Trevi Fountain every day more than once as we toured the city. We didn't even have to try! Now, before we left for the trip, we read a review that said the Giuliana was located in a "bad" part of Rome. This could not be less true. The Giuliana is located on a clean and (relatively) quite street. All of these things considered, the best facet of the Hotel Giuliana is still its staff. They were some of the friendliest, most intelligent, most helpful people I have met. They taught us key phrases in Italian, gave us directions to famous landmarks, and even reccommended a brick oven pizzaria (the one up the street, by the police station, with the lights. I don't remember the name, but it was remarkable.) It was great to feel so welcome and so taken-care-of, especially in a foreign country.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes71
Reviews.Content: The Giuliana is in a prime location which enables you to explore Rome by foot and a very good base for a tourist. It's been my first time in Rome and I had a fantastic time. The rooms are very clean and all our linen and towels were changed daily. Staff is extremely helpful getting out of their way to help you in every way they can.They do all speak perfect English which is wonderful when you're in a place you can't speak the language. I found the place to be very good value for money and I will stay there again next year. Thank you guys. Karim

Reviews.Title: “Great people in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AFbratnomad
Reviews.Content: I called to set up my reservation and they confirmed it via email. They included a very good description on how to get there and tour travel options for Rome that they could help set you up with. We spent 3 nights at Hotel Giuliana @ 130 Euro p/night. The room was extremely small for 3 people (couldn't get to the closet with the pull out bed being located in front of it which was the only place for it to fit). The bathroom was extremely roomy and well equiped. The room had a small tv, mini fridge, and an area setup to make tea. A good European breakfast was ready for our mornings (cereal, cafe, OJ, bread, & fruit (LOVE the clementines this time of year!) Recommendations on where to eat and what to see and how to get there were always pleasantly given. I had no problems with the sounds of the market set up outside out window because we were exhausted every night after our daily excursions. I figured my ipod earphones would help if it came to that, but there was no need. The market was great to get some more fresh fruit too! The lift (elevator) is old style and fun to use although it wasn't needed most of the time seeing as it's all only one floor up for our stay...it helped with luggage though. The staff was extremely helpful with everthing. Kindness and courtesy go a LONG way when you're in a foreign country on vacation. That being said I had an incredible time in Rome. Thanks to the wonderful people there who helped us with our stay. Ciao a tutti e buon viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and personal.”
Reviews.Author: stevesgirl29
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff at this hotel are very polite and friendly. They were extremely helpful when I needed to purchase crutches because I had injured my knee. The room was a good size with adequate storage for clothes. The water closet was a decent size. The location to the bus terminal was great - only three blocks. This made getting around very easy.

Reviews.Title: “a small gem”
Reviews.Author: irinibob
Reviews.Content: Want to avoid the 400-room hotel where nobody knows who you are? Try this small bed and breakfast just a few blocks from Termini Station. My wife and I spent five nights in October and had a wonderful experience. We slept well - the rooms are comfortable and quiet; we ate well - the continental breakfasts are good without being overwhelming. However, the nicest touch is the personal attention from the family running the Giuliana. Not only did they arrange transportation for us and recommend the restaurant where we had our best dinner in Rome, they went out of their way to help resolve a billing issue with another establishment that we discovered only after we returned home. Since we were no longer staying with them, they had no obligation to involve themselves in our difficulty...but they did and we are most appreciative.

Reviews.Title: “Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Soccermaniac20
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome, and I had no idea where Hotel Giuliana actually was located.
