I had read a review online, and the hotel sounded small, personal and conveniently located to the Colosseum, Forum, etc. That couldn't be a more accurate assessment. From the moment I walked up the steps to the reception and saw management's smiling face, received a big hug and a hot cappucino, I knew that I had made the right choice. I traveled with my 16-year-old daughter, and the room was the perfect size for us. The bathroom was adequate; there was always plenty of hot water, and everything was very clean. My favorite aspect of this hotel, however, is its friendly, caring and informative staff. There was always someone at the desk asking about our day and giving us helpful information. It is within walking distance of most of the main sights and is close to the Metro as well as the Train station. I would definitely stay here again. Kay Gill, Coppell, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Love this botique hotel and it's location!”
Reviews.Author: onefootoutthedoor
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and our seven day stay at this wonderful small hotel in a most convenient location. For the active traveler who will appreciate being within walking distance of Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, Spansish Steps, the Forum, Capitoline Hill, Palatine Hill, the Baths of Diocletian, the Metro and Termini Station, check out Hotel Giuliana. We had considered others, and even checked rates and availability of a couple of them. I think what pushed me over the edge was a previous reviewer who said to "just stop your looking and book this one while you can". I fully concur! We arrived at Termini Station via the express train from Fiumicino airport (having on a previous visit used an airport/hotel shuttle, I found this to be quicker and easier because of the Giuliana's location , which is an easy walk with rolling suitcase). As you zip along in the train and look out at the creeping traffic headed toward the city, you might be happy you chose the express train. The Giuliana is on the second floor of a rather bland looking building just down a tree lined section of Via A. Depretis, around the corner from the Opera House. You must be buzzed in through the castle like front door and take the quaint lift but, we never had to wait at all for either. We felt very comfortable coming and going day and night in the area. Not once did we feel at all concerned while wandering around the quiet back streets and alleys in the evening looking to find that one gelato place we hadn't tried yet tried. Upon our arrival in the mid-morning, our room was not yet available but we were shown where bathroom facilities were, and where to stash our luggage while we embarked on our sightseeing adventure. The friendly greeting and the cheerful and immaculate condition of everything there made us feel immediately at home and re-assured by our choice. We had a double room on the street side of the hotel which we found to be very quiet (sound proof glass in the windows) and a convenient way to judge how we should dress for the weather, by looking out at the passers-by on the street below. Every person we encountered on the staff was just so friendly and helpful to us. It was helpful to us also that they all spoke english as they arranged for reservations at the Borghese Gallery (highly recommended if you can get tickets), and also for a tour at the Vatican Museum (the tour is worth the cost if you don't like lines). Their willingness to take the time to talk with us, and share about themselves, their lives living and working in Rome, and their families, made our experience there so much warmer and more enlightening. We observed people checking in who were repeat visitors (which is always a good sign) and being given up-dates on what's going on at the hotel and the family style staff that works there. I know this is a long review, but we travel quite a bit and when I come across something that I feel is special, I feel compelled to share a little info with fellow travelers. The Giuliana is not the Ritz Carlton, but neither was I looking for that. What it is, is a great little botique type hotel for people who appreciate a well run small hotel, immaculate in every way, in a great location for the traveler who's intention is to really absorb the culture of a city. This hotel deserves 5 stars within it's type and price range. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Booked 3 nights, switched hotels after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Phila_Traveler79
Reviews.Content: We paid 150 Euros per night for this hotel. We were disappointed upon arrival, but not enough so to find another hotel. The size of the hotel and room were normal for Italy, no complaints there. We felt that it was below average in cleanliness and generally a little dumpy for the price. While we were checking in, several other guests returned to the front desk to ask for an upgrade because they were disappointed with the rooms – not a good sign. The first night we returned to the hotel very late and tired, but noticed an unpleasant odor in our room. By morning it was intolerable. When we told the innkeeper, she notified housekeeping, who indicated that she already knew!!! This was around 7 a.m., so she must have noticed it the night before and done nothing. We broke our reservation for the next 2 nights, but were charged the full 150 Euros for that night! If I were a business owner I would have been so embarrassed by the accommodations that I would not have charged anything, much less full price. This indicates to me that our experience was the usual course of business, not an aberration. We checked out and found a nicer hotel in a better area, for 120 Euros that was immaculate with up-to-date accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable amount of noise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of October. I can't believe that no one else mentioned this, but every weekday morning at 5am, a market sets up on the street below (the rooms are only one floor up). And it is LOUD! I understand Rome is Loud, but this was unbelievable. The hotel will tell you if you close your window and turn on the airconditioning the noise will be drowned out-not a chance. My husband was in the army and can sleep through anything and even he was jolted out of bed. The vendors start unloading at 5am, yelling to each other, dropping the metal poles they use for their tents and slamming car doors. It does not end, so you might as well get up! We asked for a room on the other side of the hotel, but were told the street traffic was worse, which I can not imagine. The beds are incredibly uncomfortable. In addition, the bathroom was dirty. There was hair on the wall in the shower when we got there (that remained the entire stay) and the shower curtain was covered in mold on the bottom--had not been washed in some time. It was difficult not to let the curtain touch you in the small shower. As for the location, it very good. Breakfast is simple, fruit, cereal, coffee and a basic pastry. I would NOT recommend this hotel- the noise is not worth it. I have a high tolerance, but it was really unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late September 2007. The hotel is very close to the railway terminus which is very handy. Also the hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. The room is nice and clean however the bed was the worst one I have ever slept in , in a hotel. Please do something about the beds......and it will be a great place to stay at. Next time we are in Rome will will probably stay in another area though.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: mirandaven
Reviews.Content: I am a woman in my very late 50's and I travelled overseas on my own for the first time so I was a little apprehensive in Rome. The staff of this little establishment were very friendly and treated me with respect. Nothing was too much trouble organising local tours and making enquiries for me when I asked re train travel to my next location . I also liked the fact that there was a lift in the hotel and reception was open 24/7. The hotel is centrally located and I was able to walk to any major sight or walk a couple of blocks to the Termini railway station or to a Metro station. I walked to Vatican City (about 30-40min) and to San Giovanni in Laterano without too much difficulty - but do take a map with you. They supplied local maps free. The room was comfortable, with ensuite and the safe was quite adequate for personal belongings. If anything was lacking it would be water pressure sometimes for showers but when you consider the age of the building I'm sure that most places in Rome would have the same problem There was no hot breakfast but there was a reasonable selection for a cold breakfast - offering several fruits, cereals, croissants, toast and coffee or juice. There was also a microwave for heating milk, etc. The hotel serves only breakfast and later in the day serves coffee and opens the small bar. They recommended a couple of great places nearby to eat which had good food and won't break the budget. If you are looking for a 5star hotel then this is not for you, but if you are looking to be treated personally and with respect then I recommend the the Hotel Giuliana in Rome. It is in an old building and a little inconspicuous but I would definitely stay here again. Miranda Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value with Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lufrano1
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I, along with three other couples, chose Hotel Giuilana as our hotel for a three day holiday before we boarded our Mediterannean Cruise. Somewhat anxious about choosing a hotel over the internet, we found that as soon as we entered the hotel, we felt like we had come home. The staff, Jean, Marianne and Antonio made us feel immediately welcome and far exceeded our expectations in terms of service, friendliness and genuine caring about our satisfaction. The room we had was very clean, functional and the beds, althoughnot as large as American beds, were confortable. The hospitality never waivered and the staff attended immediately to any need we had. For example,I had forgotten to bring a converter to use on my CPAP machine, and Anntonio made special efforts to find one for me despite the late hour. Jean, the proprieter and mother of Marianne, Antonio's wife, was warm, helpful and made us feel special on every contact. The continental breakfaasts were good and food was plentiful, and special efforts were made by staff to ensure you had a hot cup of cappucino or hot tea. The hotel also had a small bar available. In addition to the outstanding "family" that ran the hotel, the hotel was in a great location. In the adjacent street, there was a daily open market, and the hotel was minutes from the train terminal,. Jean had wonderful suggestions for restaurants that were not tourist traps, and willingly made arrangements for us for tours and transportation for all of us to be picked up at the airport, for transport from the hotel to our ship, and from our ship to the airport at the end of our cruise. The vendors the hotel used were the least expensive and most professional we experienced. When we departed, the whole family, including Jean's husband, Luigi, gathered to help us with our luggage, and bid us goodbye with hugs and kisses. As I said, we felt like family and now consider Jean, Luigi, Marianne and Antonio OUR extended family in Rome. We hope to return soon to this wonderful hotel and family. I would highly recommend this 3 Star hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Thank You to Antonio, Marianna & Jean”
Reviews.Author: Anne0411
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to Antonio, Marianna & Jean for all their help and advise, it really was most welcome. The hotel is about a 5 to10 minute walk from the Termini. Although the room wasn't large it was tidy & we certainly couldn't fault the cleanliness. Breakfast was as you would expect continental and was adequate with fresh fruit served every morning. From the hotel it took us approximately 20 - 25 minutes to walk to the Colosseum. We can also recommend L'Angolo di Napoli restaurant which is situated on the corner diagonally across from the hotel, where should ask what the 'desert of the day' is the waiter will tell you with a cheeky grin - it is me............ Can't wait to return to Rome and will have no hesitation whatsoever in staying at Hotel Giuliana again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel Near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: adimino
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near Termini Station - about a 5 minute walk. The hotel is on the second floor and has 24 hour Front Desk service. The room was small (as most Italian rooms are) but it was clean and the Front Desk clerk spoke English. He suggested a great restaurant around the corner that at first seemed empty until we walked down a flight of stairs or two. The only problem was that the lift was broken and we had to lug out luggage up the flight of stairs but the Front Desk Clerk helped us.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place”
Reviews.Author: Ojaigal
Reviews.Content: As a woman traveling in Rome solo (my first time in Italy), I was in need of an accommodation that was welcoming, with a high degree of personal service. Hotel Giuliana is a gem in all regards, and was a wonderful base for my stay in Rome. There were so many ways in which Jean and her staff made me feel at home, helping me get my bearings in Rome and find my way around. My room was perfect; simple, clean, quiet. Every request and need was met with caring and assistance. Jean even made reservations for us at another hotel for our one-night stay in Rome at the end of our trip, as Hotel Giuliana was fully booked. When I went on to Florence, I was sorry to leave Hotel Giuliana! Thank you, Jean and everyone, for making my stay in Rome a joy!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Oz home”
Reviews.Author: Trimma
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel. The entrance is not like your normal hotel being on the first floor of an old building but that's where it ends. this family owned business is excellent value. Just like a B&B. Very clean. The family and staff are so reliable and helpful you feel like one of the family. All speak very good english. excellent location. we like walking and it is within walking distance to most major sights and rail/bus transport. Convenience store and irish tavern 2 streets away to the left. If arriving late get their driver to pick you up, it costs a little more but a taxi will never find it at midnight. Our room was as good as any 4 star in Australia with a very nice large bathroom. A/c was a little noisy-cotton wool in the ears helped. Continental breakfast was excellent. Highly recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excatly What I Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaLynne77
Reviews.Content: Well when you are booking a Europe trip and you want a budget hotel, usually you are most concerned with location and with cleanliness. On these two subjects, the hotel is just great. The location is one where if you exit the hotel and go directly right, you will end up at the best shopping! There is a fantastic laundry facility within 5 blocks that we used with an internet station right inside...also within the same distance is a phone place where you can phone home (for me Canada) for extremely cheap...like I talked for 25 minutes for 3 euros. The breakfast was very nice and got us through our day. It must also be mentioned that the staff that work there are beyond helpful, cheerful and accomodating in every way. A solid 100% on staff. They had maps and reminders to go see this on these days because things are closed on certain days, etc. We had to use DHL and the great lady found us an address as well as the address to a store we wanted. The breakfast lady is just a sweet sweet lady. It is very busy in Rome in September so we didn't expect to be in a quiet hotel because honestly every street is busy. There was an in room safe and I felt safe in the hotel. We had 2 rooms and both couples felt this way. There were also restaurants everywhere to get food. Feel free to contact me if you have any specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkybec
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Giuliana after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. As this was our first time in Italy I was keen to stay somewhere really nice and this hotel was perfect. Staff are really friendly and helpful, always a cheery good morning or good evening. We arranged a taxi through the hotel to collect us from the airport, which whilst expensive in comparison to the bus we got on our return to the airport at the end of our trip, was a real luxury. The hotel itself is tucked away behind a huge wooden door. You have to press the buzzer to get in then climb two flights of marble stairs. There is a lift but we never used it. The hotel is very clean. The room we had overlooked the road and it is noisy when you have the window open but as soon as it's closed you can hardly hear anything, plus the airconditioning works a treat so no worries about sleeping in a sweat box! Location wise it's great. The first day we accidently stubbled across the Coliseum as it was only about 10 mins down the road. What also found really useful was the fact the Termini Station was so close, about 5 mins walk if that, as we got the train down to Sorrento later in the week. There are three restaurants on the same street, we only had the chance to try one, can't remember what its called but it has lots of fairy lights, anyway it was ok, but we thought the service was a little disappointing. By far the best restaurant we ate at was Leonardos just to the left as you come down the Spanish Steps. The food was brilliant and the waitress was an absolute star! All in all we had a fab time and were well looked after by Hotel Giuliana.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sal27
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in August and had a great stay. The hotel was very clean. We arrived before the check -in time and the staff was very friendly and we were able to freshed up at the hotel before leaving for the day even though our room was not available. Also, the owner was accomodating enought to let us change our departure day at the last minute. It has a very nice feel and is family run which make it a great place for your trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great break from the busy city”
Reviews.Author: bridgeforth_99
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in Rome as a stop off on our trip to the Amalfi Coast. This family run hotel is a great place. We were made to feel like it was our home. In fact on the second night when jetlag had me starring at the ceiling at 2:30 am, the night desk manager was kind enough to pour me very tall brandy just to help me knod off. I travel a lot durring the year and stay at many large chains. This was a great switch. They recommended a fantastic restaurant for us to eat at as we sayed there again on our way back.

Reviews.Title: “A fine choice”
Reviews.Author: mkc91
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is clean, cheap and reasonably located. We stayed here because availability was lacking at our first and second choices. Rome is not the sort of place you should spend a fortune on accomodation because you are heardly ever in your room. That said, if I were to go back I would probably chose the historic centre and spend a bit more. The service was good, room was funky (but clean), breakfasts looked nice (we actually ate out). Check out the other reviews. I think they do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!!! Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: Toothfairy2
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Rome and had studied TA for months trying to find a reasonable hotel for me and my sister in law. After sending out emails to many properties with our dates, bed requirements ( twin), air conditioning and a good location. My prayers were answered! I recieved a call from a lovely lady and she said she was calling from the Hotel Giuliana. Jean was also the owner of this property. She emailed all of the confirmations and directions on walking from the Termini. We arrived and followed the directions to the hotel ( got a little confused, street names are on the buildings, no signs). When we arrived at our hotel we were greeted by the sweetest young lady MariAnna. Our room was VERY clean, two twin beds , a very nice bathroom and air conditioned. So many reviews talk about the tiny rooms, but you only need a place to lay your heads at night. Again we are in Italy, not the US where we think big is better..... The rooms have a built in safe, mini refrigerator and coffee/tea machine. The hotel includes coffee, croissants,cereal, yogart and fruit for the morning breakfast and if you want an evening cocktail or wine the have that for purchase. We were able to walk to all of the sights, we did take the underground (two blocks away) to Vatican city one morning because we new we would be doing alot of walking seeing the Vatican and Museum. The staff at the Hotel are so helpful with good recommendations for dining ,directions,etc. I cannot express how wonderful Jean, Antonio, Marianna, Rosa and the late night staff made our trip the DREAM trip to Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel and would make this my home on my next visit. Hello my new wonderful friends at the Hotel Giuliana. We miss you and hope to see you again soon. God Bless.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Staff, Good over all Value”
Reviews.Author: dejavu73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana was an excellent overall value hotel in a good central location for walking from the Rome terminal (10 min), Colleseum (15min), Spanish Steps (15min) or catching the metro. My wife and I picked this hotel for its location, cost, and reviews on Trip Advisor. We're pretty active travellers and don't spend too much time in the hotel rooms usually so location and cost are more important too us. The room was small as are most European hotel rooms but adequate and clean. The bathroom was a little small but clean. The water pressure could have been better and it would have been nice to have a shower curtain so the water didn't splash outside the tub onto the floor. But these things were pretty minor for us. There was an odor coming from the closet where the refrigerator was kept... but this cleared up by leaving the door open to air out the musty closet. The staff was very helpful and spoke English very well. All were very friendly, polite, and knowledgable. Breakfast was continental and OK. We felt very welcome staying at the hotel and would stay here again due to its central location and value. Dominic N. Portland Oregon

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest & Cleanest Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DublinTraveller123
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Giuliana for 7 nights in Dec 06. We booked through Venere and got a good rate although the hotel owner told us to book direct next time as they can offer a better deal. The hotel is on the 3rd floor of an old style building about 20 mins walk to the colluseum. The hotel staff and owners were really firendly and made our stay excellent, nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms and hotel were spottless and newly refurbished. We were getting up early to go to Pompei one day and had to leave at 6:30am, they made sure that breakfast was waiting just for the two of us at 5:45. When we left we were (to our suprise) given hugs by the owner who then gave us two bottles of wine as a leaving gift! If your on a budget in rome but want somewhere nice to put your head down in an area that is safe to stay in then this is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: DonStanley
Reviews.Content: After booking with an agent found via Trip Advisor we received an e-mail direct from the hotel advising of trips available and inviting us to contact them if we needed any assistance. On arriving we were very warmly welcomed and given excellent advice, based on what we wanted to do, not a fixed sales pitch. Hotel is small as was the bedroom, but provided everything we wanted, but it was the staff who made the difference and that includes all of them. Position is ideal for site seeing and local restaurants were excellent. Would fully recommend this hotel if you want decent accommodation at a reasonable cost. Don and Pat Stanley

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Italian experience”
Reviews.Author: howe
Reviews.Content: My husband, friend and I have traveled all over Italy and Villa Guilana made us feel like we were living as Italians. We felt like we were visiting old friends. Guilana and Andrea are warm and welcoming people. There are six units on the side of their villa for guests. The units have lovely furniture, including iron beds, and are clean and cheerful. Each morning, breakfast is served under a canopy on tiled tables in the garden. Guilana surprised us each morning with a different homemade baked cake and fruit picked from her trees. Andrea was always helpful with our plans in the area. We all shared a dinner on the villa's veranda one night that we will not forget. Besides the menu of wonderful food grown on the grounds, the conversation was delightful. We all feel we were with friends during our time in Lecce. I would highly recommend Villa Guilana to anyone who visits this part of Italy. Lecce is a beautiful baroque city and worth a visit. Also, a short drive from Villa Guilana is Port Cesareo with beautiful beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Caring, professional ownership is the key”
Reviews.Author: BeantownMom_7
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the Giuliana for three nights last month and we would love to stay there again. Since this was our first trip to Italy, we focused on smaller hotels known for helpful owners. This really helped us make the most of our time in Italy. We really appreciated the personal touch, especially at the Giuliana where Jean treats everyone like family! The room was bright, clean and very new looking. Best of all the air-conditioning worked great! Yes, the bathroom was small by American standards, but it was the same as the two other hotels we stayed in in Venice and Sorrento. I think this is typical whenever they have tried to wedge private bathrooms into each room in an old building. The area was nice also. We were able to walk from Termini with all our luggage, but it was far enough from Termini to be an attractive area. It seemed very safe. Two blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore, and close enough to many major sites to walk to them. Lots of government buildings in the area too so I didn't feel like I was part of a herd of tourists all the time! Jean did a great job of recommending restaurants and tours to help us make the most of our too short time in Rome. We look forward to coming back someday.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: khkh4
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy, and we were traveling with our children ages 21 and 17. Hotel Giuliana was the perfect choice. I booked directly through the hotel where Marianna and Antonio were so helpful in making and confirming our reservations. We flew into Fiumicino and took the shuttle into Rome. Because of the great location of the hotel we were a short 10 minute walk from Termini Station. Jean, Giuseppe and the rest of the staff all speak English and that was so comforting as we adjusted to Italy. Our rooms were quite comfortable, clean and well equipped. Hotel Giuliana is right in the heart of Rome so most of the sights we chose to see were within easy walking distance, and the bus to Vatican City is just up the block. We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of our vacation, travelled through the country for a week and then returned at the end for 1 night. The staff was so helpful in suggesting restaurants, giving directions, and arranging early morning transportation back to the airport. We were made to feel welcome here and we are already planning a return trip that will most definitely include Hotel Giuliana

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaelgor
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more in a hotel. Short walking distance to everything in Rome. Train station is only a 10 minute walk which is vital when dragging around suitcases. Rooms are nice and cool and have a\c. Nice and clean and in good modern condition. Everything was easy to get to and recption provided tips are some lovely restaurants to eat in. Highly recommned this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a holiday in rome”
Reviews.Author: fordeey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Guiliana is an ideal place to stay if you are on holiday in rome. Getting there was so easy!!!!!! The train goes directly from the airport to termini station, which is less than ten mins walk form the hotel. We loved that the hotel had character like the little old lift up to reception was lovely. The hotel was clean comfortable, nice size rooms, generally very homely. All staff at reception were very helpful and welcoming. Within walking distance of everything in an area full off character. A little bit of rome you'd expect to have and the busy bars and restaraunts are only a cab journey/ bus ride away. Would highly reccomend this !!We were there in a couple but its a nice hotel for family/ solo travellers aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: netsirk33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while on our honeymoon. This was a great hotel. Very clean, big room, comfortable bed, and wonderful staff. It's very close to the train station. Great restaurants and shops near by. LOVED THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent again”
Reviews.Author: a123k
Reviews.Content: Date: May, 2007 Trip Advisor Member, San Diego,CA, U.S.A. We stayed in this hotel before and had a great experience. This time we spent 3 nights and were not dissapointed. Very helpful people, clean and spacious rooms, perfect location. We walked everywhere. Also, there is this excellent pizza place across the street and a little farm market on a street next to a hotel where we bought the best tasting fruits ever. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCiao
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights May 16th 2007. They are very nice and helpfull, room was clean and quiet enough to sleep. Breakfast of cereal orange juice and coffee was good to get the day started, they booked our tour of Sorrento for us (see review under Carrani). They offered good advice. Was worried about the area but always felt safe even getting back very late. Easy to get to most attractions. Good stay, thanks! Greg

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Liner37
Reviews.Content: What a great stay in one of the most beautiful cities in the world! I just returned from one night at the Hotel Guiliana. I shared a triple with 2 friends. Jean was VERY helpful from check-in, helping with directions, check-out, finding us a driver and even coming down with us to make sure the driver was legit! Nice quiet room. We were able to walk to the Colossium, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: BowralGillian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giuliana at the start and finish of our holiday, just a few days each time, and had the most wonderful experience. A friendly, welcoming place that puts you in just the right frame of mind to enjoy the rest or your time around Italy. The staff are more than helpful and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. Add to that the wonderfully central location, handy to the train and pretty much everything else, and this is everything you could want in a hotel. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Good Location, A Lovely Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChopperDoctor
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 found the Hotel Giuliana to be perfect for a relaxing weekend break. The service couldn't have been friendlier, the rooms were spotless and well-sized, and the location was ideal. We walked to all of the major attractions, in fact the only time we took a taxi was because we did not trust our map-reading after enjoying alot of Pinot Grigio opposite the Pantheon! Breakfast was basic, but relaxed and no less than we required, with great coffee. We felt that the Hotel Giuliana gave us a true taste of Rome, far better than some of the bigger, soulless chain hotels would have.

Reviews.Title: “owners are very "house proud"”
Reviews.Author: dubaiite
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of several hotels in rome, i finally narrowed down to Hotel Giuliana. As mentioned by other fellow travellers,I was doubting my choice when i reached the entrance to the building but once in the room,my misgivings did a 360 degrees. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom was a good size. The owners do their best to accomodate you and make you feel at home. I had stayed in four star properties the earlier week in florence and venice but the service and room quality of this hotel surpassed my expectations. The only thing that we missed was a toaster to heat the bread but then...that would just be getting nitty gritty. Keep up the service Hotel Giuliana, that is is your USP!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: malayalee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in 9/06. Pros: Walking distance to Tremini station and another metro stop; very helpful and friendly staff who booked tours for us and recommended several good restaurants; overall clean and spacious room/ bathroom; good value for the money. Cons: extremely hard to regulate water temperature in the shower and the shower/ bathtub area is small (although the overall bathroom is large) so if you are a larger person, you may have trouble fitting in; there is a street fair that sets up every day in the alleyway adjoining the hotel at approx. 5am - the noise is loud if you have your windows open, and it WILL wake you up... but the noise goes away almost completely if you shut the windows and have the AC on.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing.....”
Reviews.Author: LondonHerb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite disappointing. I payed 120 euros per night for a single room over Easter, which isn't cheap and it just didn't deliver. Room itself was ok, but location is so-so at best. This hotel seems to get great reviews because of its nice owners. They do seem nice, but I was mainly dealing with another guy who wasn't friendly at all. On my last night when I arrived at 11pm he insisted that I payed the bill right then and not the following morning as they would be busy then serving breakfast. And when I went out onto the street to get the money and paid, I was told the 5% cash payment discount wasn't for me as I had booked through Venere. This hotel is not bad, it's just bad value for money. My other two nights in Rome I spent in a similar room, in a better location, with better breakfast, with better service for just 80 euros per night. So think again when booking this place, as this place is overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Eternal Rome Revisited”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrekkerCannock
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Rome, this was our second visit to the Giuliana Hotel and we are happy to report that it was as good as ever. The rooms were well presented and kept very clean, the location is perfect and the staff and owners are tremendous, they cannot do enough for you what ever the time of day. As for Rome it was perfect, we walked for miles every day. You must visit St Peters and walk the Appian Way just outside the Roman Walls, Our only disapointment was the weather, it was just a little cold for us during the week we will go later in the year next time.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: glamgran
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful three night stay at the Hotel Giuliana and would just like to say a big thank you to all the staff who made our trip that little bit more special. We should have arrived at the hotel at 11.00 a.m on our first day but due to an air traffic control strike at the airport, we finally arrived at 10.00 p.m, we were greeted with a friendly smile by Antonio and shown to our Room No 2. He then told us of a nice restaurant nearby where we could eat. We overslept the following morning and missed breakfast, but when we came out of our Room Marianna not only made us coffee and croissants,she lent us a book on rome sights and made us a plan to follow, we found this extremely helpful. The hotel is perfectly located as said in previous reviews it is a 15 minute walk to most of the attractions i.e, Colisseum, Spanish Steps, Forum, and the Trevi Fountain (this is a lovely sight at night). The vatican we did as a tour, this again was organised by the hotel and was really good value. We walked back from the vatican after spending time at St Peter's. The walk back is a leisurely 35-40 minutes (we stopped for ice-cream) again. Our room at the hotel was very spacious double room with tea and coffee making facilities. The room is fully tiled and the bathroom is really nice. I found the mirrors nice for applying make up and doing your hair just enough light for the ladies this is sometimes a problem in hotels. From the beginning to the end of our stay we cannot thank the staff enough for their helpfulness and must mention the cappucino upon returning to the hotel. Thank you Eileen and Steve

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sonofagunn
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a wonderful 5 night stay in Rome at the Giuliana. HOTEL LOCATION & GETTING AROUND The hotel is located in the Viminale area near S. Maria Maggiore (a very impressive church) and is only 10 minutes walk from the Termini station. The Forum, Colloseum and Trevi fountain are also only 10 - 15 minutes walk from the Hotel. We did in fact find Rome fairly compact in general and only used public transport when we visited the Vatican which would have been a good half hour walk away at a decent pace. If you do choose to use public transport, I'd recommend getting a 4 EURO Metro pass which is valid on the Metro and the bus network all day. You can also get a ticket on one of the numerous open top tour buses which also lasts all day, however at 13 to 18 EUROS, this is an expensive option. That being said, I would recommend using one of these open top buses to orientate yourself with the city when you first arrive. Just make sure there is room on the top deck before you board as you don't get the same sense of direction if you're inside the lower deck. THE HOTEL If you're reading the reviews on tripadvisor, you will be well aware that the hotel is located on the first floor of a larger building. As you enter the building, the ground floor may well lead you to question whether you've made the right choice, however as soon as you get to the hotel itself on the 1st floor everything is OK. After a simple check in process, we were shown to Room 18. A perfectly adequately sized double room, with TV, tea making facilities and reasonably priced mini-bar. The bathroom was surprisingly large with a shower and a bath. (From some of the other reviews I was expecting just a shower). Some non-Europeans may be surprised to see that the bedroom floors are tiled rather than carpeted. This is fairly common in Southern Europe. We realised shortly after arrival that we had forgotten our travel adapter so I went to reception to ask where we would be able to buy one. This is where the exceptional service kicked in - "No problem", I was told, "Here's one you can borrow!" From the beginning to the end of our stay, all requests and questions were greated with enthusiasm and a smile. Whether it was a restaurant recommendation, advice on how to get to the attractions or simply a cappucino after a particularly tiring day walking around the Vatican Museums and St Peters. I normally stay at chain hotels however after my stay here, I'm now reconsidering that philosophy as the service we received at this family owned hotel was much much better than we've ever experienced before. The only negatives, which didn't bother us too much, but may others: - I think the plumbing in the builiding is quite old and I couldn't get a stable temperature in the shower. We were quite happy to have baths instead, however if you do get a room without a bath I'd check this out before accepting the room. - Also linked to the plumbing issue, you could also sometimes smell the drains. It wasn't awful, just an occasional whiff. This could be managed by keeping the plug's down in the bath, bidet and sink. - Lastly, our room overlooked a street market which set up quite early in the morning. I'm a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me, but my wife was woken up by it a couple of times. My advice is make sure the window and shutters are closed, however remember you are in the middle of a city so associated noise is to be expected. In conclusion, this is an excellent hotel in a great location that represents excellent value for money. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: GatwickSuitcase
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3night stay at Giuliana and have to say how helpful and friendly we found the staff there. The hotel is ideally located for visiting the many historical sites. It was our first visit to Rome, but with the help of a map, and the staff at the Giuliana, getting around was relatively easy. Tube and bus fares were cheap and travelling in the morning rush hour was a real experience. Wouldn`t have missed it for the world. We walked nearly everywhere, which gave us a chance to see more of the buildings and back streets, where there were some hidden gems.There are plenty of places to stop and rest your feet whilst having a cup of coffee, or whatever you fancy, and do some people watching. Although there is a market near the hotel it did not bother us, neither did the traffic. Our rooms were quite spacious and the beds comfey, a must after all that site seeing.We could find no fault especially with service and the considerate staff. We booked direct with the hotel and flew with Ryanair, saving ouselves a lot of money, which paid for the taxi from the airport, which Jean kindly arranged for us. The giuliana, a hidden treasure in the busy streets of Rome , that we would recommend to everyone, of all ages. Thanks again to Jean,Luigi,Marinna,Antonio,Gionni,Ashwin and Rosanna. We will be back. Edwina & Mick

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BillyGoatGruff
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed in February and raved about the hotel. The staff (Marianna, Jean and co)were so helpful and gave fantastic recommendations regarding authentic local restaurants and general advise. The subway stop was around the corner and meant it was very easy to make their way around Rome. The room was a lovely size and the breakfast a nice typcial continental style one. Overall I would highly recommend Hotel Guiliana for location but most of all very friendly personable staff who went out of their way to make this anniversary trip so enjoyable for my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cloughiesgreenjumper
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent budget hotel near the centre of Rome. It is a 10 min walk from the train station & about 20 minute walk from the Colosseum & forum. The staff are very helpful and freindly. They will help you book tickets for things like the tourist bus (recomended in a city of Rome's size) & for 50 euros they will organize a car to pick you up from the airport & take you to the hotel. The breakfast is excellent. Cereal, fruit, yoghurt, juice & tea or coffee. There is a wall safe and mini bar. Despite the fact that there is traffic going by in the street below for most of the night & day, it is very quiet. There is an excellent resturant just across the road, L'Angolo di Napoli, for those nights when its raining or you dont want to walk to far. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DandCCov
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this website. Booked by e-mailing hotel direct and booking flights directly with Easyjet we saved almost half than through a package deal. We spent 3 nights at the hotel. The room that we were given was large and very clean. I would say that the hotel is relatively basic but fine when you are only in Rome for short time as you are not often there. There was a TV (CNN for english speakers) and a safe (always handy) in our room. Breakfast is as stated in other reviews, cereal, bread etc. The best thing about the hotel is the staff, we were recommended 2 excellent trattorias which were within walking distance (one was practically next door) which as foodies really made our trip special. The only small downside is that the hotel is not more central however the sites are within walking distance (we did get the metro to the Vatican) but it left us wanting local restaurants in the evening (not a problem though as stated above!). I don't think that for the money we could have got anywhere closer and such as pleasant. In all, we had a lovely time in Rome, ate very well, and definitely need to return to do everything that we missed (there is so much to do). I would definitely recomend this hotel to others (bring some comfortable shoes!).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap , cheerful and charming staff we loved the Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: OxfordStefano
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple who stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for 3 nights in January 2007 and were pleasantly suprised. The Hotel is conveniently located close to the Termini station however it is a good 15-20 minute walk to the closest of sights like the Trevi fountain but it gives you a chance to take in the beauty of Rome. We had booked a superior room and found it to be comfortable , clean maybe a little cold but it was January. One thing to note is that depending on which side of the building you stay you might get woken up early on the Saturday morning due to the mini market in the next street. That though is just part of being in the city ... The staff were unbelievably friendly towards us and were always asking if we needed any help and was everything ok with the room. We had a great time in Rome and the Hotel Giuliana was a lovely place to stay and base our unforgettable weekend away. Thank you Hotel Giuliana !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Hotel, Owners and staff. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: paul1966
Reviews.Content: We are a mature married couple and this was our first visit to Rome and holiday abroad without the children. We thoroughly enjoyed a 4 day, 3 night stay at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome on the 17th January 2007. From the initial booking to a welcome home Email, the owners and staff made us feel extremely welcome. We had a Superior room, in the centre of the building, overlooking the courtyard, which was excellently furnished, spotlessly clean and quiet. The hotel is excellently located for the Termini main station and within walking distance of all the main attractions and local to the Republic metro stop. We walked every night to Trevvi Fountain for a delicious Italian Ice-cream. There is also an open top bus, that starts its journey just outside the hotel and can be booked from reception. We took the bus on our first day, to help familiarise ourselves, with the lovely city. The hotel can be difficult to find for the first time, but the directions given walking from the Termini were excellent. Like all hotels in Rome, they are not allowed to have big Neon signs. The hotel is small (~11 rooms), which makes every interaction with the staff a personal one. Breakfast was plentiful and always fresh. Thanks Jean, Marianna, Antonio, Gionni, Ashwin and Rosanna for making us feel very welcome and hope to see you again soon! Paul & Linda, Grimsby UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANTSAR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day break at hotel guiliana, from the moment we arrived we were greeted most warmly, and given lots of information of the major sights. We had arranged to go see AS Roma and were given directions on how to get there which was invaluable. We also asked for recomendations as to where to eat & again the staff came up trumps. Overall a very personal experience which added to a fabulous trip. Would definateley recommend to anyone considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: sbaron
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through the website after reading many positive reviews on tripadvisor (E90 per night with cash discount). I was very impressed with the hotel and the room considering the price. Rome hotels are extremely expensive, and this hotel is very reasonable considering. Our room was clean and fresh, large comfortable bed, safe and minibar, and a large clean bathroom with bathtub. The staff were extremely accomodating, offering directions and advice and overall made us feel very welcome and taken care of. Breakfast was nothing fancy but all we needed. My only complaint was the location, although for the price, I think it is the best we could have done. I would have preferred to be closer to the center--although many people have posted that it is only a 10 minute walk to the Trevi etc, I found it it be more like 25 minutes, and all uphill on major busy streets. Was quite a trek after a long day/night walking around. Location was convenient to the train station and the metro stop, but as we prefer to walk, I did find the hotel a bit inconvenient. Otherwise, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galway-7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel over New Year's and had a wonderful stay. I like to stay in places that are personally recommended and my brother had stayed here a few years ago and said it was well located and friendly. From the first e-mail exchange with the hotel, I knew that it would be a personal and professional experience. The owners and their front of house employees were exceptionally helpful, before we even got there. As we were travelling for New Year's I was eager to book a restaurant for December 31st in advance of travelling. I asked the owner to recommend a restaurant that was central and authentic Italian and she not only recommended but also booked one for us. I knew it would be good when she said it was where her husband and her would also celebrate new year. We had a wonderful night! In fact all the restaurants she recommended during our stay were very good. The location is excellent, less than a 10 minute walk from the main train station which means getting to / from the hotel from bus/train drop off is very easy. It's also within walking distance to all the main sites which is fantastic. We asked for a room in the quiet rear of the propery which meant we slept soundly away from the main road. All in all, it was a very reasonably priced, friendly professional place to stay - and the owners and their staff made it that way.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top hotels”
Reviews.Author: travelrig
Reviews.Content: We booked at Laterooms after seeing the price/reviews at tripadvisor and got two nights for £117. Easy to find the hotel, right next to the Via Nazionale (Romes kind of Oxford/Regent street), 5 mins from the metro, 5/7 miins from the main station (Termini) and only about 10/15 mins pleasant walk to Trevi/Navona/Vittoria Emmanuelle/ Spanish Steps...everywhere! Room was excellent, amazing double size shower, Big shuttered window, Uber comfy double bed, spotlessly clean, cheap minibar with beer/soft drinks. Facade was nothing to shout about, just a standard midfloor hotel. On OK street, pizzeria, deli, few shops on it. Breakfast was basic, but as it was buffet, just eat what you want, bread, cheese spread, packaged croissants (+chocolate), yogurts, fruit, tea, juice etc. Would've been good to have a bigger/better bar/restaurant. But overall, great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike&michelle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little hotel, located in the heart of Rome. Walkable to 90% of Rome's sights. The staff were extremely friendly, and VERY helpful. We were amazed with the room, and cleanliness and tidiness of the hotel. We will definitely been returning!! We recommend this hotel to anyone who reads this! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: RBGrapevine
Reviews.Content: Small, intimate family-owned hotel. Delightful owner/family. EXTREMELY HELPFUL when our Credit Cards and Identity were piclkpocketed. Helped us get our Credit Cards cancelled within two ours of the event. Well located for walking or taking subway to major sightseeing locations

Reviews.Title: “Simple yet charming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mistryglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Quaint family-run hotel strangely only occupying 1 floor of a building (it seemed). Don't be put off by the simplicity as it's central to everywhere and you'll be too busy sight-seeing. The owners are charming and helpful. Breakfast is coffee, juice, packaged pastries and cereals. The location is a 10 minute walk from the station and extremely close to the Colosseum, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Only used the metro for Vatican City as was too lazy to walk! I wouldn't recomment this hotel for couples but definately for a group of girls or a family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: WhiteVan
Reviews.Content: A small but excellent hotel located just south of the main railway station and on the very periphery of Romes main attractions. The Hotel is readily accessible, well run and well maintained. The members of staff make a tremendous effort in providing an excellent degree of personal service for each and everyone of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Relax at Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: Nejen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is a small family run hotel centrally situated less than 10 minutes walk from Termini Station. Staff are very efficient and friendly, all speak English and someone is on duty 24 hours. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Breakfast and all taxes are included in the tarrif and a 5% discount is given for payment by cash. Via Agostino Depretis is a busy road during the day and evening so there is noise from the road especially due to the cobblestones. However the traffic does not go all night. There is a small local street market in the side street each morning except Sunday. There are a good number of reasonably priced places to eat in the vicinity. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend Hotel Giuliana to any travellers to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel- highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lone_wanderer001
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Hotel Giuliana for a week, and I'm not sure what I liked most: the friendly staff, the room itself, or the proximity to all of the sights within Rome. Starting at the top, everyone who worked at the Giuliana was friendly and helpful, and always ready with a map to show me where to find certain things. They even helped book me into a tour of a museum that I really wanted to go to by repeatedly calling over a day and a half since the line was so busy. The room was great too- always clean and very comfortable. Mine came with a safe, which I found very useful, and I found the breakfast just what I needed every morning. Finally, the location of the hotel was great. I took the train from the Fiumicino airport to Termini station, and it was less than a 10-minute walk from the hotel. Then, when touring around, I was able to walk to everything: the area of the Colisseum was a 10-15 minute walk, the Spanish steps/ Borghese Gallery was 15-20, and even the Vatican was only a half hour or so. I will definitely be staying at the Hotel Giuliana the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel considering price”
Reviews.Author: Daneth
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and comfortable rooms, good location, friendly staff. Absolutely worth considering, decent rates for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: sml1
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with friendly and personal service centrally located in walking distance to most sights as well as public transport to/from the airport. The hotel is not located in a typical restaurant area but right around the courner there are a few very nice restaurants - all with good food for a nice and relaxed evening meal after a full day of sightseeing. Perfect for an oval weekend - I'm looking forward to comming back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: NYCAADL
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giuliana is in a great location run by a professional and friendly staff . A short walk from Stazione Termini and public transportation. We prefer walking as opposed to buses/subways and in my opinion, it is close to all the major sites. Our room was quite large by European standards and very comfortable. The staff is fluent in English and Italian and unlike other hotels it is staffed 24hrs a day. This is an incredible find in Rome. We will definately return to this hotel on our next visit and are recommending it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GRRB
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to excellent reviews on trip advisor and it certainly lived up to expectations. A small hotel excellent for a base to see all the major attractions. We walked everywhere apart from when we went to the vatican and st peters. The staff were all very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble. As two single female travellers we found the area in which this hotel was situated, safe,even walking around after dark. There were several good eating places nearby with varying pricelists. had a wonderful first trip to Italy and would recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MagsMurr
Reviews.Content: Jean and Marianna were excellent in the sense that nothing was too much trouble to them. They were welcoming and smiling and always showed great interest in their guests enjoyment. They rate ten out of ten for customer care! We booked via e-mail and they made arrangements for us to be picked up at the airport and arranged excursions so we could just get on and enjoy our visit to Rome. I would highly recommend this small and friendly hotel. The accommodation is extremely clean and we were very comfortable there. Margaret and Dave Murray

Reviews.Title: “Be at home at the Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: attycapw
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor member, Massachusetts, U.S.A.: We spent four wonderful days at the Guiliana in October (2-5). This is a small family owned and operated Hotel. The price was reasonable and the location was good. It is located within walking distance to the train and the metro and several beautiful churches. The rooms were large, well kept and clean. Our room had a private bath, phone and T.V. They provide a small breakfast and have an eating and gathering area, which were nice amenities The people here were wonderful. The owners Luigi and Jean and their daughter Mariana were all friendly and extremely helpful. Whether we were looking for restaurants or attractions they were always available with information and recommendations. They even helped us plan our travel for our trips to other parts of Italy. The whole staff was great: Antonio the night clerk, John and Ashwen the morning staff were all the best. In addition, all the staff spoke english and beared with out attempt at Italian. Staying at the Guiliana was like staying in someone's home. From the miinute we walked in we felt welcomed and comfortable. If our travel take us back to Rome, the Guiliana is where we would stay. All and all it was fantastic. Thanks, Mariana, Antonia, John, Ashwen, Luigi and Jean. We had a great time and we miss you. You are like part of our family. Good luck with the Wedding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Central for visitors to Rome”
Reviews.Author: deemacdee
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth time I have stayed at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome and the reason that I keep returning is that it is centrally situated,(eg. a few minutes' walk from the main attractions, such as the Colosseum,) small, friendly and family-owned and they all speak fluent English and Italian (and probably other languages too) and go out of their way to be helpful. This is not a luxury hotel with spas, pools, hair salons, etc. but it has absolutely everything you need for a comfortable stay, and at very reasonable rates. There are fully-equipped bedrooms and bathrooms with TVs, hair-dryers, safes, etc. It's amazing value for accommodation in the middle of Rome and I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: jveiss
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location with very friendly and obliging staff.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: smn2006
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly (good English) and the location is good (10-15 min. walk to train station, reasonably close to some attractions), but for the price we paid (Euro 150 per night), I believe we could have done much better. The entrance absolutely stinks of dampness and sometimes garbage - that's not a big deal, as you are going straight to your room. There is an elevator, but it is tiny and ancient - there are not a lot of steps anyway, so this was not a big problem for us. The room itself is very small (no surprise). Our room was directly over the hotel entrance, on a very busy street - decent soundproofing though, but some noise does get through. The bathroom was perhaps worst of all - no room for toiletries and the shower area is so small that I was constantly hitting the taps with my arms, resulting in a shock of freezing or boilling water, depending on which tap I hit. That might have just been my clumsiness, but there is very little room to maneuver. Worse than this, the exhaust fan in the bathroom, instead of sucking out the steam from the shower, seemed to be blowing in sewer gas from the toilet vents. Very nasty. I'm confident that there are much worse hotels in Rome, but I'm equally confident that you can find better than this for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Giuliana is definitely a jewel”
Reviews.Author: cristalfla
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The staff (family owned) goes out of their way to make you feel welcomed. The accomedations are very nice and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a budget I definately recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fugl
Reviews.Content: Having never booked a trip abroad without going through a travel company I found the prospect doing a do it yourself job quite daunting. I found the telephone number for this hotel in a guide book on Rome and as soon as I made contact with the hotel reception I had a good feeling about it, I was not dissapointed. They were helpful right from the start offering a reasonably priced taxi service from Ciampino Airport (50euros). The entrance though not over inspiring does have an air of security about it. The hotel reception is on the first floor, you can reach this by either lift or stairs. The staff I found very friendly and helpful, I had booked a room with twin beds (150 euros a night) as a friend of mine and I had been invited to a wedding. We found the room very satifactory in size with an efficent air conditioning system. The bathroom was a reasonable size and clean. Clean towels were provided daily and the room was cleaned every day. The street outside could be noisy at times (what do you expect in the heart of Rome) but by closing an effective double glazed window can soon resolve that problem. I wouldn't rave about the breakfast but it was adquate and the coffee was nice. The location of this hotel is excellent near to plenty of pizza bars restaurants etc, The main railway station (Termini) is a short walk away as is the metro and you are within walking distance of many of Rome's great sights, including the wonderful church of San Maggiorre which is a less than a 5min walk from the hotel. Being in Rome was a wonderful experience and this friendly reasonably priced family run hotel did nothing but add to it. Should I return to Rome, which I think I will, I intent to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Abruzzes
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome. And we highly recommend Hotel Giuliana. It is perfectly located. A ten minute walk (with luggage on wheels) to the Termini station. No need to take a taxi upon arrival at the airport. Just hop on a train (11 euros) and walk to the hotel. Across the street from the hotel there are 2-3 restaurants and a pharmacy. Extremely practical. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is generous with fresh fruits, yogurt, coffee and bakery items. Also, the price is right. By the way, Rome is beautiful. Make sure to get up early and wear comfortable shoes. There is lots to see and tons of tourist everywhere. Have a great trip Gauthier Family

Reviews.Title: “It Was Just Right”
Reviews.Author: margue
Reviews.Content: A tripadvisor member from Montreal,Canada. Stayed 2 nights at the hotel at the end of September. I would definitely go back. The price was good 185euro for 3 people including breakfast. The cappucino was good. We lucked out one morning, because they served fresh croissant. Otherwise, they serve cereal, bread, fresh fruit and pre-packaged cakes. I would personally get ride of the pre-package breakfast, after all we are in Italy were food is just so good. The staff, Marianna and Ashwin were very helpfull even before our arrival, helping out with my reservation and the transportation to the hotel. They also took the time to give us info. on Rome and the best way to visit the sites. The room size was fine, we had a room with 3 single beds and the bathroom was also a good size..Everything was very clean, no odors. Yes, it was noisy, but what do you expect, we are in Rome, not in the country. I would return to this hotel, but I would ask for a room off the backyard so that I would not hear all the street noise. Perfect location, excellent staff and perfect for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Damp and smelly”
Reviews.Author: luke9
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed two nights here and was amazed at how they could charge so much for a such a dump. The whole place smelled of dampness and it had the worst breakfast of any hotel anywhere. I have had a much better breakfast in youth hostels. Breakfast was coffee, cerials and pre-packed stale toast or bruchette, really awful. The dining room was a bizzare mix of junked garden furniture. The bedroom was also an odd mix of junked furniture. The only good point was that it had aircon, but the drain for the aircon moisture was fed into a rubber tube which fed into a bucket and it dripped all night! I had to tie a plastic bag to the end of the tube to stop the dripping noise. Probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We chose it because of the good reviews on this site!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, sincere and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Nik A
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August and would definitely go back next time I'm in Rome. Location at first seems a little out of the way but is actually perfect. 2-3 minutes walk from Termini for subway and buses, and as central to other tourist desitnations as you can get in Rome. We contacted the hotel direct and got a better deal on room rates. Very reasonable rates for Rome (E95/night all incl with a/c) Staff were the best I have experienced in a loooong while. All spoke perfect English and were as helpful as I could have asked for. Rooms were fine. Clean, good working order (we had one problem during our stay with an AC unit - they immediately supplied us with fans at 2:00 in the morning, and moved us the next day to a new room). Breakfast was fine - typical continental fare. Authentic Italian cafe downstairs if you feel like breakfast with the locals. August was too hot for me: 34C at night, 40Cin the day + humid. Many restaurants were closed for summer break. Next time I'd go in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LKSF
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately had to book our hotel in Rome at the last minute, and given our limited time, had to settle on this hotel for its location and reasonable high-season rates. There were a few key areas where this hotel came up short and ultimately affected our overall impression. Room size: while we understand that European hotel rooms are small, we don't believe you need something along the lines of a brown belt in gymnastics to maneuver within the room. Outdoor noise: ever wonder what it would be like to have your bed floating above an intersection in downtown Rome? Well, we certainly are no longer wondering. Bathroom odor: to say that our bathroom smelled would be like saying there are a lot of churches in Rome. The smell, just like the number of churces in Rome, is not something you can really grasp without experiencing it for yourself. There was something predatory about it: the more you smelled it, the weaker you became.. as if your will to escape it was being sapped. Imagine carbon monoxide, but substitute the smell of an odorless gas with the smell of death. The bathroom itself, an olfactory shrine of evil, was quite small, however. So small, in fact, that the door only opened 45 degrees before hitting the toilet. So small, in fact, that half your body stuck out of the shower (I'm not kidding). A few of the hotel staff were nice and quite helpful, but given the shape of the building, there really isn't any reason to return here. We will do better for the price on the other side of town, closer to the river on its east side.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!! ”
Reviews.Author: jandj21
Reviews.Content: AWFUL!!!!!!!!! Please, whatever you do. STAY AWAY! Dirty, smelly, very noisy, bad location, bad shower (couldn't get hot water and the water only dribbled out). I have stayed at better and cleaner youth hostels. Lucky we only had one (sleepless) night there. Not worth the 80 Euros they charge you (10 extra if you want to turn the AC on).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly home while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JATL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real "find" that was recommended to us by friends. It is on the 2nd floor of a building, so it is not your usual hotel entrance. In the end this really added to the charm. The STAFF is the best - very helpful with everything - reservations, directions, suggestions, etc.! While Italian, they speak very good English, which made our stay much easier. The rooms are fairly basic and can be noisy from the street if you open the windows. Definitely opt for the AC package in the summer. Good breakfast with great coffee drinks. Very close to Termini station and within a 10-15 minute walk from many sites in Rome We were there several days and got to know the staff people there well, exhcanging family pictures, stories, etc. Would stay here again and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to lay your weary head”
Reviews.Author: JPKIWI
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to find accommodation in Rome in July as everywhere recommended seemed to be booked out. Yes - we were looking in June for July so no great surprise. We fell upon Hotel Guilana through the internet. They responsed immediately with all the infomation I requested plus more interesting facts. They seemed very genuine. We needed 3 rooms with aircon. Absolutely no problem. Their english is excellent, their rooms decorated tastefully plus they were easy to find. We wanted somewhere close to the train station (termini) so we didn't have to lug out luggage miles, they are only a 7 minute walk away. When you arrive at Hotel Guilana, the front door is locked and they buzz you in. A little suprising but felt very secure. They are located on the first floor. Breakfast is provided. We highly recommend Hotel Guilana, if you are on a budget, and need somewhere central to stay in Rome. They were extremely helpful, ordering our taxis, booking us on a Rome bus tour, suggesting markets and best places to shop, giving you maps and helpful hints of what the Italian expect etc. Enjoy yourselves we did. This is the third time I have been to Rome but the only time I have ever suggested a place to stay. Hope its helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Momum
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for Hotel Giuliana as we booked it after seeing all the great reviews on tripadvisor. We were not at all let down - the hotel is very central, our room was clean and quiet, and the staff were incredibly helpful. For the price this hotel is definitely 5 stars in my opinion and I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome. I've also stayed in the gorgeous Capo D'Africa (which has a 5* rating on tripadvisor). Capo D'Africa was lovely and better decorated, but the difference in price (£110 per night v. about £65 in the Giuliana) means I think the Giuliana is a better hotel as they are offering a similar standard of accomodation. My only complaint would be that the breakfast was a bit naff, but I made up for it by having a lovely four course Italian lunch every day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service !”
Reviews.Author: bside_jones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Giuliana for 3 nights in June as part of our honeymoon. The room size was average, the bathroom was large, and both were kept very clean. Antonio, who worked the front desk in the evenings, was extremely friendly and helpful, recommending restaurants, providing directions, and giving us a complimentary bottle of wine as a part of our honeymoon stay. Even during the height of World Cup excitement, the service was excellent. If there was one minor minor issue, it was that the air conditioner would turn off automatically when you left the room, so you wouldn't get that blast of cool air after a day of sweating in under the blazing sun. We'd return here for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Good stay. Staff make it a 4 stars for me.”
Reviews.Author: saint_the_mountain
Reviews.Content: With all the good review this hotel had in tripadvisor we had great expectations. We were a bit nervous when er arrived, because from the outside this hotel isnt sexy. Anyway we have enjoy our stay with a staff awesome and very helpful. The room were ok but will need a repaint soon. Breakfast was also ok, but i dont understand why they served crescent like this they were wrap in plastic and didnt look fresh like european country can make ! Coffee was very good ! The Good : The price, room size, walking distance from lots of nice things, The staff of the hotel, the coffee The Bad : Location is a little bit crappy with homeless sleeping in the streets, Its an hotel you sleep only (no terrasse or pool, etc...), The pastry. Its a good hotel better than average, but not a 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MB&KW
Reviews.Content: Charming family run hotel. Convenient location near the Termini, but we heard no street noise at all. Comfortable, clean, relatively spacious rooms. Standard breakfast, except for the cappuccino, which was excellent. What makes the place truly special is the care you receive from the owners and staff. Everyone was warm, friendly, and helpful. Good restaurant recommendations too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: JJAMN
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this hotel is the extremely friendly and helpful staff. We stayed a week with our three children. Get past the unprepossessing entrance, climb one flight, and Marianna, Antonio, Jean and Johnny will make you feel like you already have friends in Rome. Ask anything - they are glad to help or just chat. Clean rooms, modern bathrooms, complete continental breakfast with espresso, cappucino or even cafe Americano! English speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value n service”
Reviews.Author: kaptah
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay in this little hotel when in Rome. Its really good value for money, locationwise its perfect, only some 10min from the railwaystation by walking. In many cases breakfast is very modest and specifically if used to have a scandinavian full buffet. At Giuliana its a lot better than in many other small hotels in Rome. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Couer de Bois
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent customer service with a nice breakfast. We were very pleased with our 3 night stay in this small family run hotel. It has great character. If you want good value, friendly staff, a clean basic room and bathroom then this is the place. You feel like you are living in Rome as opposed to being a toursit. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, I consider myself a hotel snob and am usually trying to snag a great hotel for a medium price - I don't have to stay at the very best but won't stay at the worst. This hotel kind of throws you going into it because of the work being done downstairs at entry. You climb up a curving stairway to the second floor to the hotel reception area. This space is small and worn, but the employees make up for that! Very nice, helpful and attentive. Once directed to your room, you'll find its' clean and simple. The bed sets very low and I would compare the rooms ambience to a Days Inn. You can't beat this hotel for their cafe lattes in the a.m. and terrific location. If you're not expecting luxury, give this hotel a try. Don't take a cab from Termini however without negotiating the rate first. It's a very short walk and we were ripped off for 21 Euros by a cabbie late one nite upon arrival to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: law12646
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel by a family member :) We were greeted by very friendly staff and made feel very welcome. Anything we asked for was accomodated for, including restaurant reservations and site seeing suggestions. Breakfast was continental and adequate. The hotel is small compared to American standards but well within budget for Rome and centrally located which for us was very handy and suitable for our vacation. It is close to the Termini and walking distance to the main sites. Rooms are small but compact and clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay here and if we visit Rome again would stay there in a heartbeat! Thank you for giving us good memories of Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This little hotel, down the street from Sta. Maria Maggiore, is a perfect base from which to explore the wonders of Rome. The staff, many fluent in English, is friendly and helpful. I had no difficulties making arrangements with them for day trips and museum visits via email, and once I arrived they even made suggestions based on what they knew I was interested in seeing. There is a cozy breakfast, including a delicious cup of cappuccino with a heart in the steamed milk, waiting each morning, and a smile from the front desk after a long day of sight-seeing. The rooms, although a little small, are clean and comfortable. Besides, who wants to spend hours in a hotel room when in Rome!
