Should my coins in the Trevi Fountain do the trick, I will be staying here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average but the Customer Service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: We spent our final night in Rome at Hotel Giuliana after a 3 night stay at Hotel Modigliani. Initial impression of the hotel lobby and balcony was dissapointing as it is tired and dated, but our standard double room was clean, a good size with a large bathroom (shower and bath). Our room was front facing but we had no issue with noise as we kept the shutters and windows closed with the air-con on full (which is a MUST in the summer and worth the extra 10 Euros). Location is reasonable and handy for the Metro (only 3 stops from Spanish Steps), but walking in the heat to all the sights every day would be too much for us. Service was impeccable - the staff were the most approachable, friendly and courteous that we met during our stay in Rome. Breakfast was mediocre - as was the capuccino. Had we only stayed at Hotel Giuliana we probably would have been satisfied but it was dissapointing after our stay at Hotel Modigliani which is a similar price, a more central location (2 mins walk from Spanish Steps), better decor, nicer breakfast with lovely outside garden area - however at Modigliani the rooms are smaller with tiny bathrooms and tiniest showers! (no bath!) - so I guess it just depends upon your priorities.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ASP2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giuliana for two nights. First off, its location is fantastic. Its only a 10 minute walk from the Termini train station, and within walking distance from some of the major historical attractions of Ancient Rome such as the colleseum and Forum. Its also located in a nice area with interesting little shops and cafes. Upon arrival, we were greeted by extremely helpful staff, who were able to suggest very good restaurants in the locality and provide maps and directions to points of interest. This was a huge plus since we were only in Rome for such a short time. Our room was very nice and clean. The breakfast was fine, but I think could be improved by the addition of more fresh goods instead of prepacked sugary pastries. The best things about this hotel are location, value for money and the helpfulness of the staff. However, unfortunately, I have to agree with previous reviews regarding the noise. Both nights, we were woken up before five am with the noise of people on the street outside setting up their market stalls. The noise continued for hours. As a result, we were exhausted when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money - Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: sunflash
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Italy for our anniversary and stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for four nights in total this May. We chose the hotel mainly because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. We found the hotel to be in a good location, just about a 10 minute walk from the front doors of Termini Station and less than a 20 minute walk from the attractions, such as the Coliseum, Forum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The area in which the hotel is located is safe and clean and is located at the end of a little tree-lined street, so it's easy to find. There are several restaurants and cafes in the area of the hotel, as well as banking machines, and a few shops. The staff at the Giuliana was second to none! They went out of their way to search train times and flight times for us and to make recommendations for seeing the sites and for dining. Whoever was on the desk when we left for the day or returned at night was friendly, cheerful and always ready to assist us in whatever way possible. As we spent two days there at the beginning of our trip and two days at the end, they allowed us to leave a piece of luggage there until our return. I can't say enough about the Customer Service at this hotel. The breakfast was simple, but very good. It consisted of Cappucino (excellent), orange juice, fresh fruit, cereals, croissants, packaged sweet rolls and yogurt. The breakfast room is small, but cosy and has a bar as well. There is a table out on a little terrace just outside the breakfast room where you can enjoy a coffee or a drink at the end of the day. The room was about what we expected. It was very small with two twin beds pushed together (pretty standard in Europe). The linens were clean and fresh. The bathroom was large by European standards and was also very clean. There were shutters on the large bedroom window that overlooked a small side street. I was happy that we weren't in a room facing the front because I had read (and heard) complaints about the noise there. I am here to tell you that there is noise on the side street as well! In fact, every morning there is a market on that street and the vendors start setting up around 5 a.m.!!! We often didn't get to sleep until 1 or 2 because of the street noise, so that didn't leave us a lot of time to sleep. We asked if there was a quieter room available, but there was not. One morning of our stay (our last night in Rome), a truck pulled up directly under our window and left the motor running for quite sometime while its driver banged and clanged around setting up his place at the market. The fumes that drifted up and through our shutters were sickening and we eventually got up to shut the window (then it got very stuffy). Although the weather was beautiful and one didn't require air conditioning (nice breeze at night), it might be a good idea to request it, if only to drown out the street noises. All in all, we had a wonderful stay. However, we will look for something different for our next stay. There are plenty of options in this price range (160 euros/night). The reason we would go elsewhre is mainly due to the noise factor. Another reason is the lack of Internet accessibility for guests. Most of the other hotels we stayed in across Italy had either free or inexpensive Internet access in the lobby or breakfast room. Although the staff was kind enough to tell me where there was a nearby Internet Cafe, we found this to be an inconvenience when having to check in with children and family on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “A true roman gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my wonderful Italian vacation and cannot wait to write about the great hotel I stayed in while in Rome - Hotel Giuliana. After our first terrible night at Best Western Mondial (see my other review) we knew we had to move...so with the help of Tripadvisor and Frommer's we stumbled upon the hotel Giulina. The pictures seemed nice and the price was excellent - so we decided to give it a try. And what a great idea that was! Immidiately upon arrival we were greeting by a wonderful owner, Jean. One one nicest people you'll ever meet, she put us in the room right away (even though we arrived early) To be fair, i must say that the room itself is fairly simple and average sized (for Europe). The beds and couch were average too, the bathroom small, but very very clean. Once again, the price was great so we didnt complain. Every morning, Jean serves breakfast....everything is fresh and tasty and the cappucino is simply delicious! But what made our stay so memorable were the Hotel staff....the most amazing, nicest, wonderful and helpful people you'll eve see...Special thanks to our concierge, Gianni (hope i am spelling it right) for all the time and attention to both of us. Rome wouldn't be the same....Thanks to Jean, Mariana and Tony - I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome to see Rome and to be in Rome, we love to walk everywhere to get a feel for the place, and maybe have a glass or two of wine. This hotel was perfect for us, immaculately clean and quiet, yet right in the heart of things, we walked everywhere, and everywhere was so close. Excellent staff helpful and willing to offer advice, and English speaking, which was a blessing. We organised eh flights and the people at the Hotel Giuliana organised transfers and an excellent room, it was like a Bridge travel package only 50% of the cost. If I get chance to visit Rome again I know I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Our family had a great time at Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family spent three nights at this great little hotel and intend to return. The staff was friendly and attentive and the rooms were clean and fresh. Our morning breakfast and cappucinos were great starts to some great (and long) days walking Rome. My daughter fainted in the Coliseum the first day there ("fortunately" it was only heat stroke) - and the staff was incredibly helpful and ready to assist us getting to a hospital if needed. When our flight home got goofed up and we needed to stay an extra night but the hotel was fully booked, the staff assisted us in finding another place and in negotiating a better room rate. Lastly, we had to catch a taxi at 4:30 AM to the airport. Having been ripped off in Madrid by taxi drivers (combined with my poor Spanish), the night time manager came with us to converse with the taxi driver to be sure our rate was the same quoted when we booked the ride. Hotel Giuliana's staff and owners treated us very well, and we recommend them highly.

Reviews.Title: “Retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome was facilitated by a recommendation. Stay at Hotel Giuliana, our friends said. Yes, the rooms are nice, clean, and near the historic city center. Yes, the rates are competitive. Yes, it includes breakfast. But it also includes a personal interest in your visit, in your daily activities, and in your failures and successes during the day! The family-run firm is caring and knowledgeable. I saw several tourists helped, to the extent that two, (non-guests at that), returned with flowers for the owner for her assistance!

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in this great little hotel and was sorry to leave. It has much to recommend it -- foremost, the helpfulness and friendliness of the proprietors. The hotel is spotless, its location perfect. I am looking forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpat17
Reviews.Content: Very nice small simple family run hotel in an excellent central location. The facade is presently under renovation and there is significant street noise for units facing the front of the building. The staff / family is extrememly kind and helpful. The rooms are small and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with best people & service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable, this small family run hotel. Located in second floor of private building. Completely renovated and like visiting family. Private van arranged for visit to Anzio landing area and cemetery at ridiculously low price. Have returned twice as location in walking distance of major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome”
Reviews.Author: PartickThistle
Reviews.Content: Eight of us visited Rome for the Italy/Scotland rugby match. Minibus transfer from airport arranged by hotel, driver was waiting at arrivals and took us straight to hotel. Very helpful staff with good recommendations for sightseeing and restaurants. Good location and rooms. A favourtie was Cafe Bar Viminale on Via de L Viminale just round the corner from the hotel. Ask for Simone, tell him the Scottish people who took him to the rugby sent you!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a visit to Italy. When we first arrived in Rome, we stayed in a hotel near the Vatican, and then traveled for several days in northern Italy. When we returned we decided to opt for a different hotel. The Hotel Giuliana was recommended to us from the hotel we stayed in in Florence, with which we also were very happy. The first and foremost thing that stands out in my mind with the Hotel Giuliana, is their outstanding staff! I actually sought out the owner, as I wanted to compliment her on the caliber of her staff. They were extremely helpful with every and any question we had. The hotel's common area is very charming and inviting. Our room was of a good size, including the bathroom, with comfortable beds and fresh linens. The breakfast area is also very cozy and a good breakfast was provided. The location was also very handy, as we could walk to several major attractions, as well as having easy access to the Metro. We ended up extending our stay in Rome three days more. The Hotel Giuliana could not accommodate us for the last night as they were fully booked, but the hotel staff went out of their way to find us other accommodations, even going as far as escorting us to the new hotel. I cannot say enough about our stay at the Hotel Giuliana. We were not disappointed at all with the recommendation, and preferred it to our original hotel in Rome. I would recommend the Hotel Giuliana to anyone. Ann Horn

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central”
Reviews.Author: ddbj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. First impressions are bad, because entire hotel is covered in scaffolding so a bit hard to find. Also, we had booked ahead by 9 months to ensure a good room, but were given the smallest, most cramped room with the world's tiniest bathroom. Complained and immediately got a good room (#4) with BIG bathroom and room to move. Cleanliness is not great. There was lots of mould in the shower and the pillows hadn't been changed for years. Many stains on them and they smelled. The fresh pillowcases couldn't mask that. The pillowcases on the extra pillows we used from the closet hadn't been changed as they smelled of perfume still. The matresses are pretty bad. You can feel every spring. On a positive note, the staff are very helpful. Lots of advice about buses to catch and places to go. It is a very central hotel, only about 10 minutes down the road to the Colossuem and 5 minutes up the road to the Train Terminal. The breakfasts in the hotel are very basic. Bit of cereal, croissants and coffee. We mentioned to the woman owner that we had booked at the hotel due to reviews on TripAdvisor. She got really paranoid, asking what number the hotel was on the rating scale and kept pushing us to write a really good revue to get the rating up. Probably would stay again, but might do more research for a better place. At 150Euros per night, there might be somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASH031
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel in a good location..within reasonable walking distance of most sightseeing destinations. Room was very clean and nicely furnished. It was fairly dark due to the exterior scaffolding but I presume this is temporary. Helpful staff on reception. Hotel Giuliana removed the anxiety of travelling as a single female in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from all the good reviews on trip advisor and it totally lived up to my expectations! The rooms were clean and the breakfast lovely. But best of all was the staff. We arrived late and we were greeted at the door by name!!! Our bags were taken up to our room and we had that kind of wonderful warm hospitality throughout our three night stay. I inquired about a cab to the airport (hadnt asked to have it booked) and when I returned to my room later that night to ask about booking a cab the following morning I find out that Jean had already booked it for us! Now thats service! The location was great. Don't let the building turn you off. Its upstairs in a warehouse kind of building and does have a lift. I would stay here again gladly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for our honeymoon. We really enjoyed. Jean, Marianna and the rest of the staff were great. It was very helpful to have native English speaker to guide you. The room was comfortable and well priced. The location was great. We would stay there again. Julie & Mike

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this mid ranged price hotel in February this year, not expecting much for our money but we were very pleasently surprised. The rooms are fairly spacious for Rome and very clean. The hotel is tiny itself but the staff are incredibly friendly and extremely helpful. We would highly recommend this hotel as it is close to all the top attractions as well as being within walking distance from termini station (just ignore the entrance to the hotel!!)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hospitality at Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giuliana in Rome, Italy is a small family-run hotel near the main railway station (Termini) and convenient for walking, buses or metro to all the major sights. It is staffed mainly by family members, and all are extremely friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The room was comfortable and cheerful, the bathroom clean and spacious. My mother and I spent only two nights, but felt very much at home and wished we could have stayed longer!! Highly recommended and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rob_g03
Reviews.Content: They made our Roman Holiday that much more pleasurable. Great location for seeing all the sites and taking the train. The rooms and hotel were very clean and comfortable and the service was impeccable and accommodating. Breakfast was more than adequate and the cappuccino's were awesome. My wife and I thank you

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel given the ratings it received from tripadvisor and booked direct with the hotel who at all times were very helpful. This was a surprise trip for my mother's 60th birthday. The hotel was within walking distance from Termini station and all other main attractions. The staff ensured my parents had a trip to remember. On the day of my mum's birthday they called to her room with glasses and a bottle of wine. The location is excellent and staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel to anybody wishing to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 10 days and were very pleased. The room was small, but large by European standards. The bathroom was particularly small, but that didn't seem to matter much. Very affordable, clean, great location - close to the Metro and close to Termini without being in the questionable neighborhood directly surrounding the station. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, a great hotel for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel at the end of a two-week trip through Europe. This was the most enjoyable hotel that we stayed at. The location is great, very close to the train station and central to all the sights of Rome. The staff here are the most helpful and friendly people. They offered great advise on everything from when was the best time to visit the attractions to where the best local places to eat and drink where located. I cannot say enough good things about them. When I go back to Rome, this will be where I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly hotel - Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: abbott_obrien
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming hotel in central hotel location, less than 15 minutes walk to main sites. Very good standard for the price we paid, we were expecting something much more basic. In quiet side street off busy shopping and resturant area, within easy reach of main bus routes to Spanish Steps and The Vatican - which you need in the evening if you've been walking and exploring all day! We stayed here as a large family group to celebrate a special birthday in mid-December and suited all of needs. Hotel owner very friendly, with hot frothy cappucinos on demand. Hotel also arranged for us to be picked up from the airport by taxi so we got into Rome as quickly as possible to make a start on Pizzas and vino for the boys, shopping for the girls, and sightseeing for all. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lapuce
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, very friendly people. My parents spent almost a week in Hotel Giuliana in November and had a great time. They have recommended the hotel to our friends and family and i cannot stress how helpful and willing the staff are. Excellent location to explore Rome. Lovely room, lovely breakfast and very clean. The staff could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonneford
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and daughter have just returned from a 3 night break in Rome. I want to say I would certainly recommend this hotel. Jean and Luigi, the owners, and the staff we met, Ronaldo, Johnny and the lovely maid, were so kind and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean with a fridge, hairdryer and safe. Ther was constant hot water and as it was December I was worried about being cold, but the room had its own heating device which you could adjust via remote control. I've read a review on this site where someone complained about the heating, well WE WERE DEFINITELY NOT COLD. All the staff gave us advice on things like public transport, pharmacies etc. and we were given maps of the city and Jean even lent us a guide book. On our departure Jean kindly gave our daughtar cake and orangeade, opened a bottle of wine, and sat down with us for a chat before she called our taxi to the station. How many owners would do that! Hotel Giuliana thanks for making our stay in Rome a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly. The most notable thing about the hotel was it's tasteful decor and cleanliness. It was perfectly situated to enable us to visit all the sites of Rome on foot (blisters to prove it) without having to take a tour bus. Myself and my husband definately recommend the hotel Giuliana as the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlpahrettaTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from Novmember 25, 2005. We were very happy with our stay. The owner Jean and her staff were extremely nice. They were always ready to help if you had any questions. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to many sites. If we go back to Rome we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSW42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, wasn't far from the train station and close to a supermarket and restaurants. The rooms were well presented and clean. The staff were friendly and assisted us in getting around and letting us know what was going on. Breakfast was basic but very nice. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Guiliana is the absolute BEST of all features”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When searching for the perfect little hotel, one looks for location, quality of bath & bedroom, price and friendliness and this is the ONLY ONE in which we have ever stayed (Paris,London, Vienna, Amsterdam etc)that features ALL we looked for! We cannot say enough great things about The Hotel Guiliana, an unassuming family inn in which we stayed for 10 days last month! The location is near to Termini for side trips but far enough to be in a safe and charming neighborhood 15 minutes walk in any direction leads you to the Colleseo, Piazza Navona and the Trevi Fountain. Fine shops like MaxMara and Anteprima are down the street; a great family restaurant L'agnoli di Napoli is across the street, a fun steet market is on 6 days a week AND it's only 5 blocks to the Opera. The owners and staff are friendly, helpful and patient.Morning expressos are served in American-sized coffee cups! Quiet, spacious (for Europe) bedrooms feature comfortable double beds. Best of all, the bathrooms are LOVELY with big tubs and showers with INSTANT hot water and modern toilets. Without question, we would (and hope to) return again to the Hotel Guiliana to explore more of this great city! Caio bella and grazie to everyone at the Guiliana for making our first visit to Rome a very special one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Elparaiso
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the Giuliana. The location being so close to Termini was great, just a short walk with the luggage. I was well prepared for the entrance having read other Trip Advisor comments but I could not see the problem that some people had. I never tried the lift, but it was only one flight of stairs. The room was a superior room (No.4 just off the reception) and this was all that I could have asked for. I have paid much more for a hotel and got less. The toilet/shower room was fine, being large enough and clean (as was the rest of the room). Breakfast was a simple continental breakfast which was as much as I expected. The staff were very friendly and helpful and some of the negative comments I do not understand. Overall, if someone found staying here ruined their holiday then I can only imagine they are blaming the hotel for some other problem they have encountered, because there was nothing about the hotel that negatively impacted on my stay at all. I would stay here again if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2005. I can understand both the positive and negative reviews about this hotel. It is no doubt in a great location-we walked absolutely everywhere. The Termini is also easily walkable. The staff are friendly and the room was a fair size and clean (hard floor with a small rug). The bathroom was OK but there was no shower door just a curtain which encircled you (and unfortunately stuck to you also as you tried to shower-didn't like this). It was difficult not to get water on the floor. We paid 100 euro for a double room with breakfast but had to pay 15 euro extra for a remote control for air-conditioning in the room as it was very hot. The hotel is located on the first floor of a mediocre looking building with a deserted and delapidated ground floor. There is one ancient lift which may/may not work? When we asked about this the manageress said that she would have loved to have converted the ground floor into a reception etc. but has been refused planning permission due to strict planning laws to control the proliferatrion of hotels in Rome. This was also why the hotel was slightly difficult to find-as hotel signs cannot protrude from buildings ruining the appearance of this historic city. Breakfast (and the breakfast area) were limited but palatable enough. All in all you get what you pay for and I think this is probably a a reasonable price for what you get in this hotel. I know city hotels are just for sleeping in but I probably would pay a little extra next time for more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie tanto Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the couple of American reviews our trip to Rome was made all the more enjoyable by our stay in the Guiliana Initial first impressions of stepping into the 1920/30's(an elegant age)were very soon changed on reaching the reception and being greeted by such wonderful friendly people Bedroom was very comfortable and bathroom very clean, altogether quite acceptable Continental breakfast was just what one would expect for a continental trip and always served with a friendly good morning Location was so central we could not have planned it better even if we had been to Rome before. Easy reach of the station and all the wonderful sights, even the Pope made an appearence for us Advice on restaurants gave us some wonderful romatic evenings, and the Trattoria round the corner was supurb Not "5 Star" but thats not what we went to Rome for. What we got was a wonderful trip to a beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from another wonderful trip to Rome, and as always stayed in the perfectly situated Hotel Giuliana. This family run hotel is a great base for sightseeing being only 10 minutes walk away from the main Termini – for those of you that haven’t been to Rome before this is where the airport buses drop you and its also the main train station in and out of Rome. I was traveling with my ten year old son who wanted to see the ruins of Pompeii so we got the train into Naples (about 2 hours direct) and then a train to Pompeii (another 20 mins or so). Anyway my point is that it is comforting to know that you have only a very short walk from the Termini to the hotel, especially if you are arriving at night or if the whether is bad! The rooms are a good size, not massive but not too small and they are well kept and clean. The reception area and passage way had been recently redecorated. Some rooms have baths and others have just showers. The staff are excellent and very helpful giving advice on places to visit, restaurants and transport options. At the moment there is some repair work being done to the front of the building but this didn’t interfere with our stay at all. This is not a five star hotel, and it is not pretending to be. For a five star hotel you must pay five star rates, this is a great hotel to stay in if you want to see the sights of Rome – and when I visit a city I don’t spend my whole day in my hotel room! Even if I did I would be comfortable at the hotel Giuliana. I travel a fair amount every year and I have stayed in many hotels, for the money you pay, the hotel, the service, and the location Hotel Giuliana is second to none. I highly recommend Hotel Giuliana and look forward to my next visit. PS When you are out and about please check the price of soft drinks in bars and resturants before ordering, I ended up paying five euro for a Coke! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don’t believe the hype. This place is very small, the rooms are poorly decorated and fitted, the place is located on (part of) a floor in a very old building currently undergoing major renovation. There is one very old and very small lift (i.e., it can barely hold 2 suitcases). The set-up for the hotel is ‘odd’, and the manager is particularly unhelpful if you have an enquiry that departs from her usual preferred running of things (i.e., call a cab). Although it is located near the train station, and that is convenient, it is also the case that there are also hundreds of other hotels to choose from in the location. We were so disappointed we checked out the price of the Best Western around the corner (4 stars), and found that it only charged an extra 20 Euros. Some will probably appreciate this place, its cost effectiveness, and the superficial friendliness of the manager/owner. Others will spend another 10 or 20 Euros for an ENTIRELY DIFFERENT hotel experience. This place spoiled our visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small family owned and family run hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly, personal. Rooms recently remodeled, very nice. Great location in central Rome near Termini station. Close to the subway. You can easily walk to the Colosseum. Also close to very modern Internet Cafe. We enjoyed the continental breakfast and the capuccino every morning. Good neighborhood, close to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel, An Amazing Deal for Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Giuliana in July of 2005. Not only were the staff incredibly friendly and accomodating, but the room was very clean and comfortable for the price. We were afforded everything that we needed, usually without needing to ask. We only regret that our late nights kept us from missing what smelled to be a lovely traditional Italian breakfast with expresso and all the trimmings! Johnny, the night staff, was an incredible help with all things Roman, and the owner and her daughter demonstrated graciousness and hospitality over and above what is even traditionally Italian! Overall, a great central location on a moderately busy street... with quick access to food (especially great gelato!) and transportation links. For the price, you are getting double your money at this hotel. My husband and I plan to return as soon as we can, and are considering it for a month-long stay. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. It was centrally located and the staff was extremely friendly. Costumer service at its best!

Reviews.Title: “A decent individual little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKBBristol_England
Reviews.Content: Clean and convenient. Friendly staff. Quite an individual hotel. The street is a bit noisy, not that it bothered me. Breakfast simple but good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is a good place to stay when visiting Rome and wanting a central location from which to explore the city. For those wanting a large hotel where you're just an anonymous face, this isn't the place you're after. Hotel Giuliana is a small hotel which allows you to get a personal and friendly service from all the staff. I really was impressed and touched by how they valued the comfort and enjoyment of our stay. All the staff speak very good english and were always only too happy to help. I can't emphasise enough the excellent service we got during our stay. Our room was a good size and very clean, as were the ensuite facilities. There was also a small fridge containing a few soft drinks and a couple of beers - even better was the fact that the prices charged were cheaper than pretty much everywhere we visited on the tourist route. The breakfast on offer is simple but good with fruit, yoghurts, cereals and breads/pastries on offer. To sum it up, I'd say it was clean, honest and friendly. For the price we paid I think it's a good deal. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel Guiliani was fantastic and made my stay in Rome that much better. Every staff member was there to help with all questions and went above and beyond to help get me where i wanted to be. Jean the owner was a joy to meet. Greeting us always by name. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was great. They also have a cute little deck off the side to eat breakfast. When I make it back to Rome again I will be staying at the Hotel Guiliani!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great HQ for a Roman expedition”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Giuliana is perfectly placed, near to Termini Station but in a less busy area. The staff are extremely helpful and always friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for them, whether giving advice on transport and sightseeing, or booking us into a (very good) local restaurant on our first night. Our room was a good size and spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom which was equipped with bath and shower, toilet and bidet, and basin. As it happened, the extractor fan wasn't working, but this is a minor quibble. Breakfast was simple but quite sufficient, and available at very relaxed hours! There is a bar in the lobby, and the staff will serve you from it any time you want. Our room overlooked the side street, Via Cesare Balbo, and as someone else pointed out they do start setting up the market at about 6.00 am. I take the point about sleeping with earplugs, but actually that's not a comfortable way for me to sleep, so I did find the market preparations disturbing. But this was the only downside, because everything else was splendid. I'd certainly recommend this hotel most warmly. If noise disturbs you, maybe request a room away from the street. Our thanks to Jean and the staff for helping to make our stay so pleasant and memorable! Steve Kings, Bristol U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Guiliana”
Reviews.Author: bpthib
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Guiliana from October 17 to October 21, 2005. Someone on staff was available at anytime of day or night. Marianna was very helpful, suggesting restaurants nearby and providing us with maps and directions. We felt like we were family during our stay. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom good size. They were both immaculate. The hotel is very conveniently located. We could walk to everything. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, very accomadating, helped with our transportation immensely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at the Hotel Giuliana. The whole staff was very friendly and helpful. Jean the owner took care of making reservations for transportation for us three different times. She also help us figure out where to catch the bus to get us where we wanted to go. They all made us feel right at home in a city that we knew very little about. The rooms were very clean as well as the lobby and deck.We will definately go back to this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Giuliana is a good bet for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner75
Reviews.Content: My trip to Rome with my sister was her 21st (belated) birthday present and I wanted it to be as special as possible within my budget, and this it was. I have to say that I spent a LONG time deciding on which Hotel to choose (we were going to be staying 6 days and 5 nights and I wanted to be comfortable), but this is where Tripadvisor is great and after much searching and comparison decided that the Giuliana was the one. From the very start Jean was more than helpful, and can arrange anything you might need. People who post on this site saying that it was not value for money should compare Giuliana's prices to other Hotels. yes, it is pricey but what do you expect from a European capital city? At least with that price comes a very clean room, comfy bed and warm atmosphere. The lobby and the building (which someone complained about earlier) merely adds to the charm. LOCATION I wasn't sure about this at the beginning, and would have preferred to be in the Trastavere, but actually, the Hotel is so convenient for arrival into Rome from the airports (into Termini) and is is so close to Republica metro and bus routes that you can get anywhere you want very quickly. I would also add to those who can, just hail a taxi from outside. To get from the Hotel to somewhere like the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain/Piazza Navonna it only costs about 8 euros (about £5-6, and if there are two of you it's so worth it). Most of the time though we just stepped out and walked - a lot, it's the only way to see a city. We were pleased at the end of the day to be coming back to a quiet location, rather than a side street off the busy-ness of say, Campo de Fiori. There is a local restaurant across the road from the Hotel (directly across the road) which was VERY good value for money - and great pizzas. ROOMS Our room, no.11, was the furthest from reception and so quite quiet (though I am not saying that it's a noisy Hotel inside, far from it!). One downside is that all rooms face onto the street and on one side there is a market which starts setting up at about 6am, but it's not that noisy at all and if you have earplug with you you won't hear a thing!) Our room as very clean indeed with a large bathroom and comfy beds. Cleanliness is very important to me when travelling, but this Hotel should take pride in it. THS SIGHTS/MONUMENTS MAJOR WARNING WHICH CANNOT BE EMPHASISED ENOUGH!!!: Vatican Museum and St Peters Basilica: GET THERE EARLY - seriously! We were lucky enough to bump into some people we had met on our plane out (a lovely Canadian couple - if you read this post your email address we'd love to get in touch!) and so we jumped the 2 hour long queue. It's worth getting there for 8am and you will walk straight in. not much fun to be queuing, especially in the autumn when it's raining! For most monuments I would advise getting a good historical guide or the audio guide headset thing. Rome has the most history of any city I have ever visited and things to see, but has NO SIGNS ANYWHERE telling you what it is you are looking at! I found this particularly frustrating when I was at the Roman Forum and was clearly looking at a pile of rubble which I knew had massive historical significance, but had no idea what it was! At the end of the day when you go on a city break the Hotel is really only a place to sleep in, but Giuliana felt more than that. A couple of time we came back a little earlier before dinner and had a nap - ask in reception for a cup of tea or coffee and they bring it to your room. I loved Rome and we had a wonderful time, and the Hotel Giuliana was a good place to stay and I would stay there again and recommend it to others. Thanks to Jean and the family!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a fraud!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for our family of four seven days before we were to arrive in Rome. We had arrived in Milano and we were touring the country via car, so we were not readily reachable. Our reservations were for starting on a Sunday night, but our plans changed and we ended upo not going into Rome as planned. We called to cancel our reservations on Saturday morning (about 36 hours before we were scheduled to arrive at the hotel) and were told told that, unbeknown to us, they had a policy which required cancellation 2 weeks (14 days) in advance (we had only made the reservations 6 days earlier!), so they would (and did) charge our credit card US$ 325.00 for cancellation. Beware of this fraud. I would never deal with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am one of the realistic experienced travelers of european two star hotels and the Giuliana was fit our travel needs perfectly. Their small size (11 rooms) allowed the staff to attend to whatever our needs may be. I think if you look at the all of the dozens of reviews of this hotel, most of which give them four or five stars then you can safely ignore the odd outlying negative reviews. The entire staff went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible, they even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine for staying seven nights with them. We found the rooms to be very clean, nicely appointed and relatively quiet considering their central location in downtown Rome. The breakfast was typical, but plentiful and coffee drinks were made to order by a staff member. I would suggest contacting the hotel directly by phone or e-mail for reservations and not go through (---) because that booking service will add on about 20 euros/night!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: SaintCharlesTim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Giuliana for five nights early September. I found them on tripadvisor and was pleased with the reviews. They are a small, eleven-room, family run hotel. We had to e-mail each other several times to accommodate my tentative arrival and departure schedule. They were fast with their responses. When I walked in the door, I gave Marianna my best “bon JOR no”. She replied, “You must be Mr. Hughes, welcome” in British English. I later met Marianna’s mother Jean, the owner of the hotel. We had many nice chats, including one with a friend of one the employees who spoke no English. I sipped my coffee as Jean effortlessly volleyed her conversation between English and Italian, telling us stories and having us both laughing. Breakfast was fresh coffee, juice, milk, cereals, fruit, yogurt, and croissants. The breakfast area itself is rather small, but that forced me to join some others. That was nice and I even had dinner with two couples one evening. I stayed in the single room (11). It has a single bed, shower (no tub), dresser, TV, a shelf, and safe. This is the only room without air conditioning, so a fan was supplied. As this was September and the room has a window that opens fully, this was okay. Jean tells me air conditioning is coming to this room, a good idea, I think. The size of the room is what I expected. European rooms are much smaller than their newer cousins in North America. I’ve been to various parts of Europe so this was not unexpected. Fine for one person. The last night I stayed in Rome my friend who lives there stayed with me so she could see me off in the morning. I asked if another bed could somehow be added (worked for one night but I wouldn’t suggest this in lieu if getting a double room.) Antonio did this cheerfully and I didn’t realize what trouble I had put him through until I saw that he had to rearrange the entire room. Of course, I paid for an extra person but he could have easily said no since it was a hassle for him and both his boss and me would have been none the wiser. Now, the entrance. It is a large wooden door at street level. A simple sign says “Hotel Giuliana.” The hotel itself is on the second floor (first floor European.) When you first open the door, you get the impression you are walking into an old warehouse. Don’t let the entrance fool you! The hotel neither owns nor controls this part of the building, so please give them a break on it. It's well lit and it is a strange entrace, but not creepy or anything like that. When departing one morning for a daily tour, three ladies where entering. As they lugged the door open, they looked at their surroundings. One said “Oh, my...” I quickly intervened and told them “It’s okay, it really is! Go up the stairs to the hotel entrance.” The elevator is small. If you have a lot of things, like the three ladies I ran into did, I suggest you do what I told them. Place your luggage in the elevator and send it up, walking the stairs yourself. The steps are right next to it and we’re talking about a walk up one floor, not up the Leaning Tower of Pisa. The elevator in an older, open shaft model so you can see where your luggage is even after you send it up. Bottom line: The entrance is different than what you’re probably used to or may expect, but it’s no big deal. Really. I know some say that that the staff is expected to be polite; hospitality is their business. That is true and I can’t disagree with their logic. I’m just saying that friendly and accommodating service seems to be rare, yet Hotel Giuliana has an abundance of it. I would like to comment upon some recent reviews. We’re all entitled to our opinion and I do respect that. A reviewer from Toronto suggests that these reviews are biased in some way. I tell you truthfully that I have never been in Rome before, I have never stayed at Hotel Giuliana before, and I have never met the owners before. I don’t “own their stock” so I have no financial bias, and have nothing to gain by making something up. I’m not sure what sort of bias I could possibly have. Another reviewer suggests that people don’t pick a hotel because of staff friendliness. For my fairly extensive business travel in a cookie-cutter Hampton Inn, he is correct. In America, I’m “home”, no matter where I am. But this is different. I’m a foreign country where I speak ten words and, despite pre-planning research, am unsure of the local customs, transportation, and so forth. A friendly, helpful, and engaging staff suddenly becomes more valuable to me. As another angle, consider the many people who travel to the same destination year after year, staying at the same small resort in, say, Wisconsin. Many of us know someone like that. Does their resort of choice have an upper hand on all the others due to how nice it is? I’ll wager you the main reason is that they have come to know the owners. Always make your reservation directly with the hotel. Avoiding a middleman can’t hurt. Would I stay there again? Yes, and I hope it is soon. If I didn’t, I’d feel like I was snubbing some old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for short trips”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We’ve been to Rome second half of September 2005 – 2 adults and a 7 months old baby, and stayed there for 4 nights. I know some Italian which proved very useful. Location The hotel is conveniently located – about 10 minutes walk from Termini station, relatively civilized area. Few restaurants, few café’s, a small super-market very close, and street markets until 11 am, right beside the building. The super-market with extended hours was extremely useful to us, since the baby needed lots of things – bottled water, food diapers etc., and we couldn’t dine out every single night – so it was good to have a place to buy food and stuff in a hurry. The hotel - general The entrance of Giuliana is quite hidden – 2 big wooden doors leading into the street, and the building’s lobby kind of scary – they share it with others. The elevator is from the beginning of the century and looking like hasn’t been serviced since. We are not that fussy to need the elevator for the first floor, but we had a umbrella stroller for the baby and it was hard to get in and out the elevator with it. The reception & breakfast area is small but clean and modern. The room was quite big and very clean, the bathroom was sparkling clean as well. We also got a play-pen for the baby. They have a fridge in the room but the power goes off every time you leave the room so don’t expect to keep the stuff cold for a long time. People complain about towels – I found them not that bad, they were clean, not cashmere-soft but well… hotel towels, of course I had my own for the baby. The breakfast was good, not extraordinary good, but good: coffee, 3 cereals, yougurt, fruits, bread, jam, croissants – I brought it in the room every morning because the baby was adjusting to 7 hrs jet-lag and he was waking up at 9:30. The price we paid for the room – 160 euros per night + extra air conditioning, was kind of high for the service. The staff The staff – polite and English-speaking – is their own business after all. We didn’t need special treatment or directions because we travel a lot and we are able to get around by ourselves. The only thing we asked was a city map which any hotel in a city like Rome could provide, but I found a better one at a tourist info center near Santa Maria Maggiore. I can’t say a lot about friendliness because we didn’t come to Rome to make friends with the hotel owner, but to visit the city. Closeness to major monuments Mind that we traveled with a baby in tow, so it took us longer than average, we had to stop a lot to feed the baby, change the baby and sometimes entertain him. We walked everywhere, except Vatican city where we took the subway – if we had been without baby, we would have walked there too. Not advisable to get into buses or subway because of pickpockets. It took us about 20 minutes walk to get to Traian’s Markets, Roman Forum, and about 30 minutes to get to Colosseum – measured from the hotel. We couldn’t go on Via Sacra - the road was too bumpy for the stroller. It took us about 1 hour to get to Fontana di Trevi and Pantheon – good walk, lots of street markets and real Italian life which was great. Overall, Rome is not that big, and if we could do it, anyone could – just get a good map from one of the tourist-information points. It’s free, and you will not need the hotel staff to plan your trip. Also bring a city guide, so you won't have to spend money on audio-guides everywhere - there is too little info provided at monuments. Conclusion Giuliana is okay for short stays, a bit of pricey though. Please, who is choosing a hotel over staff friendliness? They are all friendly because they are paid to be so. If I recommend the hotel: yes – clean, close to Termini, walking distance to monuments. If I would go there again – I would enquire first at 3 stars hotels on Via Nationale or Via Depretis, if I would get better price, probably I would go there. For sure I’ll keep Giuliana in mind for a next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler2327
Reviews.Content: There have only been a handful of reviewers on this site that I've found to be truthful about this hotel. Unless you don't mind tile floors in your room (with the exception of a tiny area rug), no hot water, a dribbling shower head, extra cost for air conditioning, mildew smell in the bathroom, breakfast consisting of pre-packaged croissants and awful coffee (no fruit, of course), and the worst decor I've seen in a hotel, there's NO WAY this hotel deserves even 3 stars! The hospitality was fine, but they're running a hotel so they should be nice and accommodating, it's not a "bonus". Dare I say that the people writing these reviews are biased in some way? If you decide to stay here, you'll see through the pictures and the reviews to the truth--it's nowhere near worth the money you'll pay! We ended up going to another hotel where we could enjoy the time we spent in our hotel room instead of having to "put up" with anything.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy, small and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First impressions were not great upon entering the ground floor lobby, which is a shared entrance off street level. But don't be put off. Once upstairs in the hotel reception you will be given a warm welcome. In our view Hotel Giuliana is a great value for money hotel in an excellent central location close to shopping, restaurants and all the major tourist attractions. Jean and all the staff were very friendly and their local knowledge and recommendations made for a wonderful stay. Our room was clean and comfortable and we had plenty of hot water. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service!”
Reviews.Author: sbarber
Reviews.Content: Like the others who reviewed this hotel, I cannot say enough about the wonderful staff of Hotel Giuliana. My husband and I stayed there for 7 nights between Sept. 10-17. On our second day in Rome, a thief copied our bank card number and emptied our account. The hotel staff could not have been more genuinely concerned and helpful. They let us use the computer to check our bank account, they explained the cheapest and easiest way to make a call to the U.S. and they even sent one of their own staff to the bank to act as our interpreter. And that staff member then went above and beyond of his own accord, taking the time to lead us to the police station despite being off-duty at that point. The day-to-day service was equally impressive. They made dinner reservations for us, got us tickets to the Museo Borghese, made excellent restaurant recommendations and generally accommodated our every request promptly and with a smile. Don't think by all this talk of service, though, that that's all the hotel has to recommend it. Our room (No. 8) was very nice - large comfy bed, excellent shower with great water pressure and plenty of hot water, and, best of all, superior air conditioning that we could control ourselves. Most places in Rome are not air-conditioned, so it was pure bliss to come back from a hot day of sightseeing and be able to turn the AC to the temperature we wanted. Breakfast was more than adequate. There was variety enough to suit about any palate - 3 kinds of cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, bread and cheese and prepackaged pastries - and the freshly made cappucino is wonderful. And the location is ideal - my husband and I walked everywhere, and even the Vatican, far to the west, only took us about 30-45 minutes to reach. Everything else - the Colesseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Villa Borghese - was only 15-20 minutes away. I was a bit worried about its proximity to Termini Station, having read how sketchy that neighborhood is, but we felt very safe. One caveat: Our room overlooked the street and so got quite a bit of street noise. It didn't bother us, but if you're a light sleeper, you may want to bring earplugs or request a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “our family of four was well taken care of!”
Reviews.Author: dianeg78
Reviews.Content: anyone reading the reviews of hotel giuliana can see that almost everyone who stays there loves the place. i am writing because i want to add that it is a nice place for families. i stayed there in august with my husband, 14 year old son and 12 year daughter and we were all very, very happy with the experience. granted, the size of the room was a little small, being in the heart of rome. the 4 beds took up most of the room. the bathroom was spacious with a shower/tub. the rooms (and the entire hotel for that matter) were immaculate and simply furnished with lovely textiles. the locale is ideal. a 10 minute walk to the colossium and less than 20 minutes to the spanish steps. but the heart of the hotel giuliana is the warm, personable staff who will take however much time you need to assist you with any questions. one last thing that doesn't have anything to do with the hotel: hold on to your belongings while on a bus or the metro!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed at the Giuliana for the last several years. Actually, we we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else! The rooms are always spotless and the owners, Jean, Luigi and their daughter Marianna are the most pleasant and friendly people we have ever met. I noticed a review of the Giulina on August 26th this year by some idiot from El Paso USA and I just had to write to say that either they stayed at an entirely different hotel, or the were on drugs for their whole stay in Rome. Please ignore anything that these people write about the Giuliana, I can assure you that if you chose to stay at this hotel when in Rome, you will have a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent my first 6 days in Italy at the quaint Hotel Giuliana. It was my second time spending an entire month in Italy and my second stay at the Hotel Giuliana. I do not usually write reviews of my stays at hotels, but my girlfriend with whom I am travelling this time wanted to write a review of the hotel because she found the experience so very enjoyable -- aided by the helpful tips from the extremely friendly staff at the hotel. I have "beat her to the punch" on writing a review because apparently she found a very negative review of the hotel on Trip Advisor that, frankly, I cannot understand as I was in that very hotel in August (just a few days ago). As with my first experience, I found no musky smell and plenty of hot water in this boutique hotel in the heart of the ancient section of Rome. True, it is not the Hilton, so if that is the experience you are looking for, you would be better off booking elsewhere ... for much more money. However, if you want to experience the true feeling of Italy in a comfortable hotel (albiet boutique size rooms) which is central to just about everything, then this hotel is a perfect choice! We had a wonderful time with no complaints and are indebted to the staff for their very valued suggestions of where to go, what to see and how to get there. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I spent a couple of weeks in Italy this August and really enjoyed the Hotel Guiliana. The staff were amazing!! Very willing to help with any and everything, and spoke fluent English, which was a plus for us. They really went out of their way to assist us with arrangements, and were most accommodating when I overslept and missed the breakfast. The room, while small, was adequate and fit our budget. The shower was tiny, as seems typical from our travels in Europe. But everything was exceptionally clean!! The room was quiet and comfortable. Good air conditioning, which was a must for us at night. A lift, which was only needed for the luggage. A great location, very convenient and safe!! Staying here was a great introduction to Rome, and, if we had it to do over, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort is more important than friendliness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was expecting hotels in Rome to be overpriced, but I was let down by the appearance of the hotel for the price I was paying. The rooms are incredibly small, which I can tolerate, but mine smelled of mildew and I did not have hot water for my morning showers. The hotel elevator and building itself are a little sketchy- at least you are not there for most of the time when visiting. After reading other reviews, I see a pattern....no hot water, mildew smell, and being let down by the pictures posted on the web (deceiving.) Yes the staff can be courteous and polite, but isn't that a requirement not an "added bonus" of running a hotel. Sorry, but when I stay at a hotel the most important thing to me is comfort (cleanliness, room temperature, running hot water, etc) and this hotel lacks that, especially for the prices of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Like part of the family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Inclined to keep this place a secret, I resist the urge not to tell you about the great location, friendly service and cosy rooms. There were three of us plus a baby sharing a three room with a cot and the staff were very accomodating. The 'all you can eat breakfast' was not maybe all you would want to eat and it would be nice to have a bath instead of a bidet, but overall, our experience of Rome was complemented, perhaps even enhanced, by the smiling reception and the authentic italian touch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 23rd - 30th July, 2005. Upon arrival, after the taxi had dropped us off at this "big brown door", we wondered if we were at the right place. But we soon found that this was the correct address and Jean, the owner, met us at the old cage elevator and assisted us to the first floor reception. Meeting Jean, was like catching up with an old friend whom we hadn't seen for a while. She was just so warm and friendly. We had a double room, with air conditioning, overlooking Via Depretis. The room was spacious, airy and bright and the bathroom was a good size, modern and clean. We could walk to the Coliseum, the Forum, the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the bus from Via Nationale took us to other points of interest. Visitors to Rome should not miss a total view of the city from the top of Via Garibaldi. We had dinner on one night at the Abbruzzi in the street behind the hotel and one night at the restaurant diagonally across the road. The morning street markets, selling just about everything, were just around the corner and there were two supermarkets close by. Jean gave us a tour brochure and we selected a day trip with Appian Tours, the bus leaving from the end of the street, near Maria Maggoire Church. The chosen tour to the Isle of Capri was definitely the highlight of our trip in Italy. Jean and Luigi's daughter, Marianna, along with Antonio, were at the front desk during the day with Johnny and Rolando doing the evening/night shifts. Their friendliness and assistance with maps and directions was greatly appreciated. At the included breakfast, Rolando made the best coffee and seconds were always offered. He is an asset to the group. A real friend! Among the reasons we chose this hotel was the fact that they all spoke English (and they accepted us not speaking Italian), the hotel had an elevator and our roon was air conditioned. These factors weighed heavily in our choice of accommodation and we were not disappointed. We would certainly recommend the Guiliana for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Canuckster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana July 15 to July 17, 2005. It is a lovely little hotel. Not overly fancy but very nice for a reasonably priced, well located hotel. Jean the owner and the staff were very helpful. Jean recommended a family restaurant called Trattoria Abruzzese which was close by and had great reasonably priced meals. We had a lovely time in Rome and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the outside and entry you wonder is this place ok? Once inside you know you made the right decesion to stay. The staff came downstairs to welcome us and assist with the luggage. The rooms are very clean and well cared for. The air condtioning worked great, the beds are comfortable, the rooms had a refrigerator and safe and both worked. The breakfast was good and my wife says the coffee was great! The staff is what made this an extra special place to stay. We were helped with directions, reservations and most important good places to eat. They only have 11 rooms but they treat you like you are staying at a fancy 5 star hotel. The pride in ownership shows. We will definately return when in Rome. We have already recommednded the hotel to friends traveling in Septmeber.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a very rough beginning (missing the flight from the USA) the staff was so accommodating when we called to let them know we would be one day later arriving. Yes, we had to pay for the night, but that is totally understandable when they only have 11 rooms! The room was very nice, comfortable and the facilities were very well kept. We visited with another couple from Mississippi and were given this recommendation from another bed and breakfast which was full. If we ever visit Rome again, we will definitely stay here! The staff was so wonderful in every way--the breakfast was nice, friendly visits with the owner, and great recommendations on where to eat! You cannot go wrong with this bed and breakfast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Little Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: expat17ksauk
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome after three and a half weeks travelling back to the UK from Saudi via Athens and Crete, and were using the Hotel Giuliana as the base for our four day stay in Rome. We arrived late at night and were immediately impressed by the personal attention we received from the staff. It was like visiting a friend's house, with an attitude that many of the much larger hotels we have visited could do well to emulate. The room we had was fairly large with a high ceiling and en suite bathroom. with the three basic facilities that are nice to find when travelling; a fridge, hot drink making facililties and a TV to catch up with world events. Breakfast in the morning was a nice continental style of rolls, fruit and the kind of good coffee that I have only found in Italy. The family run business was very friendly, and gave the impression that any problem that you had would not be beyond them to help resolve. Overall the four day stay was made much more relaxing by the staff's attitude and service and we will definitely stay there when ever we pass through Rome again

Reviews.Title: “A gracious welcome, a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: casual-travels
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in an area that allows ready access to a magnificent city, this small, well-run, charming hotel was ideal for our first trip to Rome. Jean and her staff were extremely gracious and helpful in every way. Whether giving directions, making suggestions for restaurants, assisting with transportation, or graciously making us feel we had a home away from home, someone was always ready to assist with our trip needs. Our room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and provided the perfect resting place for active travelers intent on experiencing the ambiance of the city and seeing Rome's beauty. Hotel Giuliana will definitely be where we stay when (not if) we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JenAnnB
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the reviews in Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. After a horrible charter flight, it was a fantastic relief to see the driver waiting for us exactly as requested, and to be whisked off to the hotel. The rooms in the Hotel Giuliana are clean and functional. The bathroom is large and well equipped. We had a room overlooking the balconey and it had a little fridge, which was very handy. We found the hotel quiet and the air conditioning was most welcome in Rome in July. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. But the best part was the fantastic location - walking distance to the train station and subway, but in a very handy neighbourhood with lots of reasonably priced restaurants, a supermarket, great gourmet food shops, and lots of clothing/shoe stores. The hotel is walking distance to many top attractions. We were very happy with our stay at the Hotel Giuliana.

Reviews.Title: “We love Italy and the ever best hotel in Rome, hotel Giuliana.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited hotel Giuliana in June this year, because we have stayed by this hotel every year since 2000. We do not have to visit Rome every year, but we have to visit our nice friends Jean, Luigi and all the staff every year, because they are so wonderful people doing all their best to make you comfortable. The hotel is centrally and perfect located, very clean and nice with normal standard three stars room - but the most important is the very friendly and personal service from the staff. You feel a unique hospitality, and hotel Giuliana is now becoming "our second home". We do not hesitate to recommend our best friends for a stay at Giuliana with this high level of excellent personal service from the nice, careful and English speaking staff. - You can buy everything, but not these kind of human qualities! - Giving hotel Giuliana our most warmly recommendations to all TripAdvisor memebers, we do look forward to our next stay in "our second home"!.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure!”
Reviews.Author: upstatetraveler
Reviews.Content: What a treasure. From the moment we walked in, we were made to feel like family. Jean, Antonio and Mariana could not have been more gracious, caring and helpful hosts. Add to this a very large, very clean and exceptionally quiet room. The hotel is in an exceptional location that is just an easy walk from the train station and within walking distance of many of the major sites. Also close to the metro if you so choose. Mornings began with a wonderful breakfast and getting suggestions on how to get the most out of your day. Three excellent reataurants are all within one block of the hotel. We spent a total of five nights and if we should travel to Rome again, we would not look any further than the Hotel Giuliana. We would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel Giuliana to any of our traveling friends. A truly exceptional find.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Guiliana in Rome and thought it was fantastic. Situated in the heart of Rome it is a must for tourists seeking something special. Not only is the hotel a very home-like environment but the service that is available at the hotel is hard to beat. 24 hours a day there is someone on duty to assist with any fine-tuning your stay. I found them to be very professional and held them in the highest regard. The rooms are well equipped with private shower, television, mini bar and very comfortable beds. The rooms are always kept very clean and are maintained extremely well. If you ever have an issue, the friendly people there would be more than happy to help you. Breakfast is served every morning with the availability of tea/coffee and other beverages. There is a range of fresh fruit and other delicious food available in the morning which will satisfy every taste. The bar is licenced with a wide variety of drinks. The hotel has a perfect location, was very quiet, safe and was also close to the main street of Rome Via Nationale where most things can be located. There is a lift for use to all floors for people who have heavy luggage or who have a disability. I would not hesatate to reccomend it to anyone. Do yourself a favour and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family run hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I,along wth our 14yo son stayed in Rome all last week (14th of July 2005) at the Hotel Giuliana. We all would unequivocally recommend it as being an outstanding hotel within its category. The highlight points of the Hotel Giuliana are as follows: 1. The very, very friendly owners of the Hotel run every facet of the Hotel themselves and they are committed to providing the highest standard of service. 2. The room which we had was a good size for three tall people and was kept impeccably clean. It was air conditioned and was quiet. 3. The breakfast was very generous and wide ranging. Lots of fresh fruit, cereal, bread, yoghurt and excellent espresso coffee. 4. The Hotel is located close to the Station Termini (5 -10 mins walk), close to the Via Nationale (ie good transport and shopping) and close to some excellent restaurants. The only "downside" to the Hotel is that the owners, although being very Italian, previously lived in London for years, so their English accents (perfect English!) almost have you thinking that you are in London! During our four week journey to Europe we stayed at 5 or 6 hotels in various countries. The Giuliana was the best of them all! When next in Rome, we will be back. Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: goliath03
Reviews.Content: Last May my wife and I spent one our most enjoyable holidays in Rome.This was very much due to the fact that we stayed at the Hotel Giuliana.our fourth occassion to do so.The Hotel Giuliana is situated very conveniently on the Via Agostino Depretis just a few minutes walk from Termini,Rome's central railway station and beside the Basilica of St. Mary Major. Many of the major attractions of Rome such as the Colosseum, the Forum, the Spanish Steps, and the Basilica of St. John Latern are within walking distance. Nearby on can get buses and/or the Metro to St. Peter's Basilica as well as many other destinations. This is really the ideal part of Rome in which to stay. However, it is the overall quality of the Giuliana that is its major attraction.The helpfulness, friendship and warmth of Jean and her staff cannot be surpassed.This gets better all the time. The rooms are clean and very comfortable-a really great place to stay.That is why we have stayed at the Giuliana four times and are now looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very let down by not only the appearance of the hotel (lack of hot water for 3 days), but also the staff. During my husband's and my honeymoon vacation, the first "Noche Bianca"- white night- took place. We were to check out of the hotel the next morning at ~ 9am to catch a train to Napoli, but all of Italy had a power outage and the trains were not running. We found this out of course that morning when we were to leave. The hotel staff would not let us stay at the hotel until the trains were up and running, saying they had guests that were arriving that day by train, who had booked the room we were staying in. When we pointed out that they obviously could not arrive if we couldn't leave because the trains were down all over Italy, they didn't care, and kicked us out of the hotel with no where to stay except on the train station floor which we did that entire day. When we were leaving, I told the staff that I would not stay there ever again for this inhospitality they showed us and told them to cancel our 1 day reservation we had booked for our return to Rome (a week later.) Apparently, Jene (owner) was never told to cancel the reservation, and she charged my credit card (without my signature or permission), when I called and told her about what had happened, she refused to refund my money...saying there was nothing I could do about it, and she was not going to lose her money over this. So I filed a complaint with my credit company and they ruled in my favor and took the money away from her. This was nightmare for us, especially on our honeymoon. Because of this, I was so skeptical of using my credit card anywhere in Italy for the duration of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Knowledgeable, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: ITourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana for six nights in June 2005. Overall, it is in a good location. It is within easy walking distance of Termini Station, the main train station in Rome. It is only a few blocks away from the train station, which is a pleasure when carrying your luggage in hot weather. Also, it is not so close to the station that you get caught up in the rush hour traffic, or the atmosphere, associated with any large train station. I found most of the tourist attractions within walking distance of the hotel, but I am a runner and in my 30s. The closest major attractions to the hotel are the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Coliseum. The furthest major attraction was the Vatican, but you can easily get a subway at Termini Station that stops there. The hotel is located on the entire second floor of what seemed to be a commercial building. I would describe the Hotel as comparable to a bed and breakfast in the United States. There is an elevator to the second floor, but the elevator is quite narrow on the inside by standards in the United States. All personnel of the hotel that work the front desk speak English. This is a huge asset. The staff can provide invaluable information and assistance in planning or refining your itinerary. Do not overlook this! Language is a problem throughout Rome unless you speak Italian or you are at a major tourist attraction. The staff is also very friendly and likeable and they really go out of their way to be accommodating. They are really nice people. My room in the hotel was good. Neat as a pin. The bathroom was spotless. The air conditioning worked fabulously. The room was equipped with a safe. Despite what I had heard about hotel rooms in Europe being small, my room was comparable in size to a room in the United States. The free breakfast each morning was fine. There were several cereals to choose from, coffee, orange juice and rolls or pastries with butter or other toppings every morning. Although not related to Hotel Giuliana, I had two of the best dinners in my life at Trattoria Al Camoscio d'Abruzzo, 74-76 Via Castelfidardo, telephone number 06/4462183. I mention it because it is very close to Termini Station and I would estimate it to be about 3/4 of a mile east of the Hotel. I highly recommend it.
