If I had found the place earlier during my vacation, I would have eaten there every night. The food was that good. Compared to the prices of some other hotels that I had reviewed before my trip, Hotel Giuliana's prices seemed pretty reasonable. You get a 5% discount off your bill if you pay in cash at the end of your stay. Bottom line - Hotel Giuliana is a nice place to stay when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Bella, Bella, Roma!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just return from a 6-day trip to Rome. We absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Guiliana! Jean, Mariana, Antonio and the rest of the staff were especially kind and helpful. The hotel is on the second floor of a building that is in a wonderful area near the Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica. We felt very safe in the neighborhood and it was easy to walk to most important sites in the city. We were even able to take a day trip to Firenze (Florence) after seeing many sites in Rome. The staff at Guiliana printed the train schedule for us and gave us great tips. Since the hotel is located close to Termini, it was very easy. We will definitely stay at Hotel Guiliana if we return to Rome. Grazie Hotel Guiliana for making our trip so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our two week jaunt around Europe, where I researched all of our hotel rooms using this site. After reading the reviews for Hotel Giuliana, we decided to book a triple, and we were not dissapointed! First of all, everything they said about customer service is right on the money! Jean and her staff were warm, personable, and friendly, making us southerners feel right at home. They helped us with all aspects of our stay in Rome, booking tours, recommending restaurants, etc... The gentleman on night staff (I forget his name) went above and beyond by helping me with the next leg of our journey, getting me train times and information for traveling to Tuscany, as well as personally calling our next hotel and getting specific directions for us from the train station. We were very impressed! The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the location was excellent. If you are in fairly good shape, you can walk to any of the historical sites, except for the Vatican maybe. The train station is a couple of blocks away with a metro station as well. We were with my older mother in law, so it was helpful that the hotel was located next to a major tour stop, a basillica, so it was easy to catch a tour bus there. Also, the tour company the hotel recommends is just up the road. The only complaint I have was that the shower overflowed on us a couple of times, as it had only a very shallow basin. We got the hang of it after a couple of attempts, and I would recommend turning off the water while soaping up so you don't overflow. A very small problem in an otherwise overwhelmingly pleasant experience. Hotels are very expensive in Rome, and this one is a good value for the money! We would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from the magical city of Rome. What a wonderful place, treasures around every corner. Apart from sore feet everything else was perfect! The hotel was easy to find (as long as you come out of the train station at the right entrance). It was fairly central with lots of culture and nice resaurants on the doorstep. The family who owned the hotel gave us lots of advice as to how to make the most of our short visit. The hotel was spotless and had a reasonable continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ciao1018
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giuliana is in a good section of Rome with a view of the church Santa Maria Maggiore from the front entrance. We had no trouble walking everywhere and finding good and reasonably priced places to eat. It is close enough to the railway station so it is convenient for taking side trips outside of Rome. But not too close. Our Italian relatives in Rome said it was a very good and safe neighborhood. The Teatre d'Opera was two blocks away and we attended it one evening to see the Ballet with absolutely no problems walking back to the hotel at midnight. It is also within walking distance of many of the major tourist sites, such as the Colosseum, Forum, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, etc. The only place we needed the Metro for was the Vatican and Villa Borghese. The metro was fast and safe, so that was no problem. The staff at Hotel Giuliana are very friendly and helpful. They helped with phone calls we received from Italian relatives. An email we received from the Vatican was delivered to our room right away. There was a phone in the room and breakfast was free. The breakfast was a good one, with yoghurt, cereal, capuccino, fruit, bread, pastries, etc. Some days we did not bother with lunch. The hotel takes up one floor (is one floor up) of a lovely old building and there is a small lift. We only needed to take it when we had our luggage. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. I found the price to be very reasonable (145 euro/night for a double room with twin beds). It was a bargain! In the summer, air conditioning is extra, $10 more a night, but we did not need it in May. We loved the daily vendors selling goods in the side street next to the hotel! We recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JudyHauger
Reviews.Content: We returned from our trip to Italy June 5, 2005 and had a too short of a time in Rome. We loved the Hotel Giuliana and wished we could have stayed several more days. The location is near the train station, but very quiet and easy to walk to most attractions. The hotel arranged a tour of the Vatican musuems and a ride to the airport. All were done quickly and done well. Our room was very comfortable with great A/C. Everyone was friendly and the service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana - A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giuliana is a great place to stay when visiting Rome, Italy. The accomdations were pefect. The staff was very kind and friendly. They treat you like you are family. The location can not be beat. It is a short walk to just about all of Rome's attractions. The restaurants and site tours that were both recommended and booked for us by the staff were all excellent choices. I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: June 2, 2005 My family and I recently returned from a trip to Rome. This was our first trip to Italy and we stayed at the Hotel Giuiana which is a family run hotel located in the heart of Rome and walking distance to many of the attractions. Our room was very comfortable and we were treated to a nice breakfast each morning. But what made our stay most memorable was the family and staff of the hotel who were so welcoming and hospitable to us. We hope to be able to return there sometime in the furue. We highly recommend the Hotel Giuliana to anyone who visits Rome. Sincerely, Arlene Williams Westmont, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Giuliana was very enjoyable. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. We stayed in a Superior Double room and, in response to an earlier poster, we did look at the regular rooms and they were indeed smaller than ours. The room was very clean, though I do have to agree that the towels could use an upgrade, and it was disappointing that air conditioning cost extra (we definitely needed it in mid-May). Staff was very friendly and helpful, and location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine, but my husband hated it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, but after wandering the dirty streets of Rome my husband was not comforted to return to this room. First of all the elevator and stairs to get to hotel are scary and then the room was small, and the street noise below made it difficult to sleep. The bathroom was tiny. I liked it however, because it was clean, and decent, close to a lot and the employees all spoke English. The breakfast was good. Delicious cappucino and nice nice people. It was a nice hotel for Euro standars, but pricy. Next time I might opt for something else, though might enjoy the familiarity.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive”
Reviews.Author: thisissar
Reviews.Content: After going back and forth on the street and asking numerous people about where the hotel was exactly located, we managed to arrive at the hotel. The hotel wasn't clearly marked and it didn't help that all streets don't have signs to guide you. Though the check in went pleasant, we were astonished to see the bedroom. Pictures can be deceiving and we learned that at this hotel. Since we checked in and immediately left to explore the city, at night upon arrival, the bathroom stunk of mildew. There was no soap dish so you had to get creative. It was quite warm and when we went to turn the AC on, we realized that the hotel charges 15 Euros extra our jaws literally dropped. This was the most expensive hotel during our 18 day Europe trip and the extra charges were just not acceptable. In the morning when my husband was taking a shower the water wasn't hot. Breakfast was decent. All the friendliness in hotel staff just doesn’t matter when you’re visiting Rome, as you’ll be out the whole day sight seeing. At night one just needs a decent hot shower, a comfortable bed, and AC on a hot day without having to pay extra for it. Our advice would be to find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Small Haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PaddyBathEngland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this small family run hotel very much, the location was well placed and the family and staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The entrance to the hotel is very unusual but adds to the hotels charm. Thankyou for a very comfortable few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice-sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: kbrwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in May. The staff was very helpful and gracious -- especially at breakfast time. The room was large for European standards. The hotel was a short cab ride to most attractions. All of their communication with us was efficient and clear. We did have some minor grumbles. Although the windows were double-glazed for soundproofing, I was still bothered by the street noise, especially when the street market vendors started setting up right below our window at 6:30 a.m. The towels were the stiffest and thinnest ones I've ever encountered. And we were misinformed about mass times at nearby Saint Mary Major, which caused a domino effect of delays in our schedule for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just after Easter (2005). I can't thing of anything new to say -- I think the positive reviews of the Giuliana on this site have said it all: Very friendly, pleasant, and helpful staff; good English spoken, clean, nice simple buffet breakfast, conveniently located, especially in relation to the main railway station (Termini). Our room was adequately-sized, had a wall-safe and refrigerator, blow-dryer, tv. A very minor 'complaint': When we were first led into the room by a staff member it would've helped us if that person pointed out the refrigerator and other features to us. (We didn't notice the very useful refrigerator -- hidden behind a curtain -- until our four-day stay was half over!) I/we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our little hideaway.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a very pleasant stay at the Hotel Giuliana. It was so close to Santa Maria Maggiore we could almost reach out and touch it from our window, yet it was tucked away enough from the tourists' noise and hussels. The owner was kind and careing and spoke excellent English. Cutest lady made me cupuccino everyday. The weather was perfect. It was my third time in Rome . I will go back for more! Disabled ,but determind traveler. Pennsylvania.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend the Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: gshlaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 lovely nights here in May. Jean and her staff could not be more welcoming or helpful; the hotel is easy walking distance to two Metro stops and the train station, making it very easy to get to everything we wanted to do. There's a delightful restaurant right across the street for casual, but excellent food, and two others within a couple of blocks that are a bit more formal, but entirely local with excellent value. An extra bonus is that there's a street market outside with different vendors every morning -- but don't worry about the noise: Our room overlooked the side street, but the double-paned windows were so effective that we didn't even know the market was there until we opened the curtains! My only negative comment is that I couldn't see any difference between the "superior" room which we had and the "standard" rooms which were 20Euros less. I looked in most of the rooms, and all the doubles seems to me to be the same size, with the same bath and other furnishings. Ask for an explanation of the difference before agreeing to the higher price. Gwen & Jack, New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sprince497
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 day stay in Rome at the Giuliana...we had a wonderful stay...The room was nice and had all the amenities we expected..AC, safe, full bathroom, and was clean and neat. The staff was very helpful in assisting us in planning our day in rome...and picking out restaurants for lunch and dinner... Our breakfast each morning was like dinning with family, and we made many new friends. The staff made reservations for us... gave us directions...helped with tours, always with a smile... and everything worked out great. Our stay ended too quickly...but was capped by last evening lemoncelli....and a discussion of our next trip back to rome....jean the owner and her daughter marianna..were super...sam and lola, dallas texas

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: Roma'72
Reviews.Content: I booked my room with Hotel Giuliana by e-mail. Their reply was courteous as were all dealings with them. The first thing I noticed was the cleanliness. It is a well kept hotel. The single room was a good size as was the bathroom with a shower cubicle, wash hand basin and toilet. The place was clean and was kept that way throughout my stay. It is not a large hotel with about 20 rooms I thought. The staff were at all times friendly and most had excellent English; in fact the owner's English was better than her Italian! (She is not Italian.) I was to the front of the hotel overlooking the street (Depretis). I didn't have any problem with noise but as it was April I could keep the window closed. There is no air-conditioning though and this could be a problem in the summer. The street is not a noisy street. It is off Via Nazionale and leads up to Santa Maria Maggiore. All in all it is a good, central location to stay in. Some minor problems: lack of air-conditioning, no fridge in room. Staff led me to believe that these problems would be sorted out and I believe them. There is a sense of wanting to treat guests well in this hotel which I really liked, a sense of personal pride in what they are doing. From me they get top marks. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming and Caring Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Giuliana. It was situated in an ideal location within walking distance of most of the major sites and monuments. The rooms were spacious, immaculate and very comfortable. All the staff were cheerful and ever ready to help. No doubt we will be returning to hotel Giuliana and will be recommending it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a late night arrival in we received a warm welcome. The hotel is within walking distance of the Termini station and therefore simple to use as a setting off point while touring Rome. The rooms are clean and compact with interesting plumbing... A most enjoyable visit with really helpful staff. We will definitely recommend this venue to those visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana last week after reading the reviews on this web site. Jean the Manager made the booking so easy via e-mail & sent directions on how to find the hotel which is only a couple of minutes walk from the Termini & is centrally located for all sightseeing in Rome. On arriving the friendly staff made us feel very welcome & gave us directions to the main sights most of which are within walking distance. The Hotel was very clean,amazing value for money & we really enjoyed our stay here as we were made to feel very welcome.Lastly if the above isnt a good enough reason to stay here there is a wonderful restaurant directly across the road that makes wonderful pasta & pizzas but gets full very early!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and members of my family, have stayed at Hotel Giuliana on two seperate occasions for a few reasons. Jean the owner made it so easy to book by email and phone and always responded promptly to our enquiries. This was followed up with excellent relevant information on getting there. Once at the hotel (which is so central to all of Romes spectacular sights) all the staff are so friendly and obliging and will go out of their way to answer any queries you may put to them. It really seems to operate with all the warmth and hospitality of a family run venture and like a family one always looks forward to visiting again as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Picked this Hotel as it was mentioned in my company's Intranet. It's a small Hotel, easy to find and outside of the slightly dodgy area around Termini Station. Instructions on how to get to the Hotel were good and clear. A very warm welcome from lovely staff who all speak good English. Room very clean with spotless bathroom and handy, free of charge, safe. Simple but perfectly adequate breakfast. Coffee exceptional. We were given excellent instructions about the location of all the main sightseeing and a good map. The recommendations for local restaurants truly excellent. The pizza restaurant across the road is fairly good but the restaurant behind the Hotel (I think it is Abbruzze) is exceptional. Turn left out of the hotel, left at the cornet and left again. Our only problem was the noise from the street market. It's no problem during the day but they start to set up at 06:00. I suppose you must realise that you are in Italy! Would definitely recommend this Hotel and it's very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pizza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giuliana is equidistant from most of the main sites and easy to find, especially given the excellent directions that were sent to us prior to arrival. The room was clean and spacious and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our only criticism was the breakfast which was very basic. That said, we would thoroughly recommend a stay at the Giuliana and there's a great pizza restaurant almost opposite.

Reviews.Title: “A highligt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome is just behind - and we will probably be back again some day. If so, Hotel Giuliana will be our first choice. It is in central Rome, but what is more important is the service, the"home-feeling" and the atmosfere we do not remember we have experienced in any other hotel. Hotel Giuliana gave our five days in Rome something extra and unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at Hotel Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Giuliana felt like being with Family. The staff spoke English and were very helpful with any directions and suggestions of what to see whilst in Rome. Jean prides herself in the efficient running of the family business. The hotel is small and the service provided is 24 hours a day. The hotel is walking distance to all the attractions within central Rome. I would definately recommend staying at the Hotel Giuliana.

Reviews.Title: “Cappucino? Yes please!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was rather by accident we arrived at hotel Giulliana last February. But we were welcomed in a very warm and homely atmosphere. Everything about the hotel was great: the people, the room, the elevator (!) and especially: the cappucino in the morning! Though the hotel is rather small, the rooms are large and comfortable and very clean. The hotel only has eleven rooms, but that means the people working there immediately start to know you. They are always ready to help you and to give you good advice on nice restaurants in the area, advice which we did not hesitate to follow! Special thanks to Toni for his friendliness and readyness to help us! Thank you very much! And hope to see you again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Making Rome yours”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a month long tour with 5 days in Rome where i stayed half the time at Hotel Giuliana. The hotel is perfect; I have never experienced such incredible service before. Any question I had, even the odd questions where researched and answered by the staff. Over my month long trip through France and Italy I would say this is the best hotel I stayed in and I am not impressed easily! The hotel is very well situated, rooms are immaculate and I can assure you I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Rome simply for the warmth of the service. I thank all the staff at Hotel Giuliana and look forward to seeing them again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely small but convenient hotel (all situated on the first floor) with very kind staff. Nice room and bath. We liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Happy in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Grandson and I stayed at the Hotel Giuliana. The Staff was very friendly, helpful and gracious. After showing us to our room and letting us settle they encouraged us to let them give us a map and directions to where all the sights, restraurants and conveinces were. They all spoke English and knew the fastest way to everything. They even found our church that we attend on Sundays and the time of meeting, plus phone number and directions to get there - very personable. The Hotel was very clean, comfortable. The Bathroom was very modern and tiled. We could control the temperature in our room. Breakfast buffet had variety for continental buffet. We felt safe there. We could easily walk to the Train Station, 10 minutes, where you get the train to the Airport. We were close to the Metro Station and walking distance to the Opera Theatre, restraurants, shopping and historical sites. The room rate was very reasonable for Rome. We were very pleased with everything. I recommend this hotel to my family and friends with pleasure and to you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvsmacca
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giuliana is priceless! The staff are so kind and will make you feel like a member of the family. Rooms are sparkling clean and of decent size. My room was on the street but there was no issue with noise. Breaksfast is nice, with cereal, fresh fruits, yogurt, cheeses and assorted rolls and cakes. The hotel is located on the first floor of a wonderful old building just off the Via Corso, a short walk from Termini Station, but far enough away to lose that "station area hotel" feel. You are 10 minutes from the Colosseum and walking distance from the Via Nazionale, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The neighborhood is lovely with a local market every morning, a great little pizza place just next door and the Opera is around the corner. You can see Santa Maria Maggiore from the hotel as well. Staff will gladly suggest itineraries for you and help you plan them! I stayed at Hotel Giuliana for 12 days over Christmas and New Year and loved every minute. I had an unplanned itinierary change which could have ruined my trip but Jean and her staff were so kind and helpful that I ended up being glad that I stayed in Rome for all of my trip! I felt like I was leaving friends and family when it was finally time to come home. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough! If you are looking for more than just a room in Rome, then this is the place. The staff all speak English (among many other languages) and will share a glass of wine and stories with you at the end of a long day of sightseeing. I was even requested to send an email to let them know I arrived home safely! That is customer service beyond compare! I booked this hotel based on reviews here on TripAdvisor. I was not disappoined and you won't be either!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Kids, Close to Everything - What a Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family, consisting of my mother, husband, 4 year old daughter and 14 month old son traveled from Philadelphia to New York to Rome in November 2004. It was quite a journey for 2 weeks through Italy, armed with bags, car seats, backpacks and cameras. Thank God for the staff at the Hotel Giuliana! Upon arriving at the Hotel, we were greeted by a very warm staff and shown a comfortable room, even for the 5 of us (and all of our gear). The Hotel Giuliana staff became our friends during the short 3 days we spent there, and they could not have done enough to make us feel at home (even warming milk at 2 am while our son tried to adjust his clock)! The morning cappucinos are to die for, before heading out to see the glory that is Rome. Hotel Giuliana is close to all of the "must sees", 10 minutes from the Collisseum/Forum, around the corner from the metro so you can be at the Vatican in 20 minutes, and an easy walk from the Pantheon/Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. You will get terrific directions, recommendations and wonderful conversation. And all of this at a bargain price! It's a tremendous find.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at the Hotel Giuliana in Rome for 10 days in October 2004. The location was very convenient -- near S. Maria Maggiore and not too close to the Stazione. It was a neighborhood, a little off the beaten path. We discovered and frequented a really good local trattoria and sidewalk cafe, where the owners and staff were just as welcoming and friendly as the hotel. Everyone spoke English as well and were very helpful in providing advice on getting around. We could easily walk to all the sites, which we did. Hotel Giuliana is a small hotel, one floor of a lovely old building with an ancient elevator. The owner and all the staff are great. The room we had was a good size, clean, with bath, and window overlooking the street fair. When it got noisy we just closed the windows and it was quiet. A large breakfast was served everyday in a bright little room. The price was excellent when considering all that was included, and compared to hotel prices in Rome. We would definitely stay there again and recomend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by Hotel Guiliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Guiliana in Rome, Italy. We met friends from Sweden there and we were all charmed and delighted with our stay. From our arrival to our departure, we were treated with warmth and charm. Hotel Guiliana is small and intimate - a comfortable place to retire after a busy day of sight-seeing. We found it to be conveniently located with regard to shopping, transportation, dining and many of the famous points of interest. Our days have been busy since our return and our lives hectic, but our hearts are warmed when we think back on our time in Rome. We love Rome and part of the reason we love Rome is the "Hotel Guiliana." Thanks again to the staff for the warmth and charm extended to us during our stay in your delightful establishment. You helped us make memories to last a life time. We hope to visit you again. Warmly and most sincerely, Friends from Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel not only had wonderful service, but a friendly smiling staff that was always helpful and available. The room itself was comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was very nice and had a beautiful marble floor. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is close to all the major attractions and close to the Metro and train station for quick day trips. Many lovely restaurants on every corner and tons of shopping. We had a lovely honeymoon and contribute a large part of it to the wonderful hotel and staff. Many thanks and we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Rome. We were there over the Christmas holiday and it was exciting. The Hotel Guiliana was convenient to the main railway station, clean and comfortable with larger than normal rooms. The bathroom was quite large and even had a make-up mirror..nice! The in-room safe was also a nice feature. The rate included a very substantial breakfast with made to order cappuccino or coffee. Jean and the staff were unusually friendly and helpful, and we highly recommend this hotel. It was a great deal if you want a small, clean hotel with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Homa Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more like a B&B. Delicious breakfast. Attentive staff. Close to everything. And the shower in our bathroom was a marvel: what pressure! what heat! We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated the personal, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be a basic hotel with all the necessary to make our stay comfortable. Being fairly central, it was easy to get around the city. The owner and staff were extreemly helpful and friendly, somethin which is not easy to find in a bigger hotel. We recommend this hotel if one needs a clean and comfortable place to sleep in and which offers a good continental breakfast in the morning. I would say that, considering the price, it is above average and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: fredk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from late November trip to Rome, Pisa and Venice. Stayed at Giuliana and could not have been a better place. Jean and Luiggi and daughter and rest of staff were wonderful and friendly throughout four night stay. Very helpful with ideas about getting around the city and seeing sights. Rooms clean and comfortable. We kept window open to street market below during day and sights and sounds were wonderful. Very close to Train station, but excellent location a block from Santa Maria Maggiori and Opera. Great little restaurant and coffee bar just across street. This was the best hotel we stayed at in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “On balance we were pleased with the Giuliana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was without exception cordial, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was generous. The room was a very comfortable size and the bathroom was beautiful. We appreciated having a wall safe in our room. Our only quibble is that the room might have been a bit cleaner. But I would definitely recommend the Giuliana to friends looking for a hotel in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Giuliana
HotelInfo.Address: Via Agostino Depretis 70, 00184 Rome, Italy
